review: I had the grilled chicken sandwich. It tasted OK, but was such a pain in the hind end to eat that I will never order another. The bun  couldn't absorb (or repel, I guess) the condiments they put on it, so it turned into a pile of mush in no time and fell apart in my hands. I had to finish the sandwich with a fork.

Even though I'm usually not a fan of chains, Red Robin defies the norm by delivering a casual and satisfying dining experience on a consistent basis.  It's a burger place, so try to avoid the rest of the menu and just get a burger! The A1 Peppercorn Burger ($10.39) and the Burnin' Love Burger ($9.59) are my personal favorites, both delivering some serious flavor. Take note: All burgers are open to customization, so don't be afraid to substitute certain cheeses, sauces, or other items to make the perfect burger for your taste. The fries could be crispier, but they're bottom-less, and just cover them with Red Robin Seasoning or Dat Campfire Sauce! Everyone raves about the Freckled Lemonade ($3.99), and it's very good for sure, but for a change of pace, get the Root Beer Float ($3.19). Endless root beer float for that price is an absolute steal! The service is definitely friendly enough, and there are a few TVs scattered around if you want to peak at a game that's showing, which adds to that fun, casual environment.  If I'm struggling to think of a place toe eat, Red Robin is a solid standby.

So, here is a rather disappointing review of the Red Robin in the Paseo De Saratoga shopping center.  It all began with a burger craving, and neither of one of us wanted In-N-Out, so we decided on Red Robin.  Big mistake [tonight]. We were seated in an expeditious manner, as expected, by a pretty good hostess.  Next, comes our waitress, Ashley.  She was a little short thing, with what appeared to be a decent personality...at first.  We placed the drink order, which consisted of a patron margarita and two strawberry limeades.  It took her quite a while to bring them.  Next, comes the order.  I don't really know how difficult it is to write down on your little pad, "bacon cheeseburger, dry, with fries."  The next order was the Whiskey River BBQ cheeseburger (with fries), which somehow happened to arrive at the table, prepared correctly (amazing). So, during the entire time it took to dine, Ashley stopped by to 'see how things were,' just once.  We still didn't have any utensils or napkins about 10 minutes after our orders arrived.  Empty food plates and drink glasses began to pile up on our table, during which she showed absolutely no interest whatsoever in clearing them. This was not an enjoyable experience for any of the parties involved, including our little waitress, 'Ashley.'  She had a very apparent attitude problem tonight.  I just hope it gets fixed before she forces more customers to feed their appetite elsewhere.

Location/Ambiance: Located in the Paseo De Saratoga shopping center which is full of things to do, eat, and buy. I usually go here before going to the AMC in that plaza and appreciate that I can have dinner before a movie without having to get in my car in between. Red Robin is a chain restaurant and has that chain restaurant ambiance. Clean, large, with ample seating. I went one weekend and the wait was 30-40 for two people.  Food/Prices: I'm usually not a fan of chain restaurants but Red Robin is not too shabby. They have consistently good "gourmet" burgers at a good price that are served with delicious, BOTTOMLESS steak fries. I always get the Guacamole Bacon Burger ($9.89) - SO good! Fresh guacamole with a hint of lime, crispy bacon strips, and swiss cheese - droooool! You can customize your burger so that's a plus. One of the best things is their HONEY MUSTARD. Sometimes I crave that more than the burger. Also, their Red Robin seasoning turns those steak fries into a party. It's mainly a burger place but there are also other entrées like pasta and sandwiches but I'd avoid anything but a burger. There's a bar if you'd like an alcoholic beverage with your meal as well. Service: Good. I'd give Red Robin 3.5 stars if I could.
We love Red Robin Burgers! My hubby and I have been here several times to eat and we've never really had a bad experience. The food is always good. Service is usually good. 'Nuff said!

I've been to a few Red Robins in my day...but all the other locations were back in SoCal. Gotta admit, this spot never disappoints. We've only been here during the weekend a few times, and we never had to wait to be seated. There's plenty of seating here and the customer service is definitely a 4 out of 5. Food comes out in a timely manner. We only had to deal with waiting for our a food a bit longer than usual once, because our waitress seemed like she just started working there. Burgers: bomb dot com. Pasta: bomb dot com. Endless fries AND only a few dollars more for sweet potato fries: BOMB dot com. Only thing I miss is their salmon and chips, I used to order that ALL the time back in SoCal...but I guess they discontinued that item. The restrooms are actually pretty clean too, which is a plus for me!

My favorite RR location other than the Newark one where my roomie works at. Fast and efficient service and the food is always good. Parking can sometimes be a hassle, but other than that the food and service is right on target. Love the RR Royalty Card free appetizer when you register it and free birthday burger for your bday month. Campfire sauce is awesome for dipping those bottomless fries.

I love this place! I'm always greeted and seated right away and the servers are all really nice and helpful. Wither I'm there for a freckled lemonade (which is amazing!) or a full meal, I always have a great experience at this location!

We went into this restaurant after not going in for over a year due to bad service the last time we were there. What a difference a year makes. Billy was our server and he was great. Supper friendly and polite. We had a $25 credit from that bad experience from a year ago. He was helpful in making sure we were able to use that credit (which we were not planning on since it was so old) and apologized for our experience then. The food was good and the wait for everything was fine. The reason they are getting 3 instead of 4 stars is I had ordered my dressing and walnuts on the side for my salad and when the food runner brought our food out she did not bring those items out.

I have become a huge burger lover thanks to my BooBear and of course, a FRY WHORE, so hearing on the radio about their bottomless fries, I made an executive decision and had J take me to Red Robin to carb it up! We were seated in a booth by the kitchen, which was a bit distracting but our server made up for the crap table. Sabrina (our server) was very upbeat and patient with us (and the other tables she was looking after) and I really appreciate that, for it was my first time coming here in about 6 years and was unsure of what to order. I ended up choosing the Chophouse burger and J picked the Burning burger(?). The flavors in my burger were nice but the portion size was ridiculously small and Jason didn't like his burger much either and both of us agreed that for the price, it was a rip-off. However, the massive amount of steak fries that Sabrina kept bringing over to us made up for the pitiful sized burger. If we did come back, I would stick to stealing fries and maybe getting an appetizer instead; getting a burger smaller than a single In N Out burger for 3 times the price is ludicrous.

Red Robin is a great place to go if you are looking for a great burger and a kid-friendly restaurant. We were at the Saratoga location this past Sunday after seeing the Lorax with our 2 1/2 year old daughter. The restaurant was quite crowded when we got there around 6 but the wait was not bad. The manager on duty that night was extremely friendly and patient with our daughter when she asked for a balloon. Although they did not have any strings for the balloon, she went out of her way to get a straw to tie her balloon to.  This may seem like a small or insignificant fact to some but as a mother, I was very pleased to see her take the time to make my daughter happy. She even got down on her level to talk to her and when a couple approached to put their name on the list for the wait, she told them she would be with them in just a minute. She seemed to be doing it because she truly cared and not because she had to. In this day and age, when most staff/managers at restaurants seem like they never want to be bothered by children, this small act of kindness made my daughter and in turn me, very happy!

I like coming here because the burgers are really good, plus you get all you can eat fries.  What's not to like about all you can eat. I have gotten a few of the different burgers they have to offer, and I have never been disappointed.  For the price, I'd like the burger to be a little bigger, but the unlimited fries more than make up for it.  The meat tastes great, and the produce is fine.   The fries are really good too, and I always upgrade to garlic fries because that's how I roll.  Again, the fact that it's all you can eat is awesome to the max.   The service has always been top notch and that makes me say yaaaay.   All in all, you can't do bad coming here.

I've been here many a time before and the food is pretty good, at least the burgers and fries. I really haven't had much else he before. I often go here because it's a cool place to meet up or go before seeing a movie at the Amc theaters.  I am mostly writing this review because of the exceptional service I had he on my most recent visit by the waiter andres.this guy was on top of it! He was nice yet to the point. He brought us some fries while we were waiting for our burgers and kept the refills coming without us ever needing to ask. He was like a mind reader.  When we were done he offered to split the bill for us, this is the first time I think any waiter has ever offered this to me before. I thought that was awesome. If I had this sort of service every time I would probably come here more often. Me and my friend made sure to tip Andres well before we left. I may even ask for his section next time I go back here.  I would say red robin is more of a 3.5. The burgers are pretty tasty but a tad over priced. I would say a burger at Carls Jr. is similar yet much less expensive.

first i must add a little personal note and state that i was raised with small portions and organic meat and with a dedicated and talented mother that cooked excellent meals nearly every night. it was my first time coming in today with the family (family of 4 - two kids) and might I just say now my last as well. I came in with a fresh mind and hungry stomach and was excited to try my first American restaurant. As soon as we got seated after 25 minutes it took the waitress 10 minutes to bring drinks and be ready to take our order. we ordered an appetizer specifically so we can munch on before the meal, however the appetizer didn't come until 20 minutes later along with the food! I thought appetizers come immediately(?) or else we wouldn't have ordered it in the first place!! now I ordered my first prime ribs and i was extremely displeased. not only was it expensive but it really doesnt taste like meat. it tastes like a bunch of hormones and false tenderizers. I'm sure right now if I were to apply extensive research and figure out what was in those ribs I would be very displeased; and not to mention how my stomach just didnt take that sandwich at all well. fries were okay, I just felt that everything was extremely greasy as well as one of their classic burgers on the menu (I stole a bite from my brothers burger). now not to mention how LOUSY the service at that place is. no towels on the table? two time request for hot sauce? forgetting water? extra refills on things we never requested? I'm sorry, but I've been to other places which is a little bit better than that. I don't recommend this place for good food. if your coming just to fill yourself up and fatten your figure, by all means I recommend.

The last time I came here was almost a year ago so I decided to bring my cousins here for their first time since they are all big fans of fries.  The burgers were smaller than I remembered but the bonzai burger was still pretty yummy. My mom liked her mushroom burger too. Warning: We're not really burger people so it's hard for me to compare with other burger places. We upgraded two of our regular fries to the sweet potato fries for 80 cents (still bottomless though!). The sweet potato fries were a huge hit amongst my family, parents included. Try it plain before you decide to add extra stuff on the fries because I liked it just the way it was (although I have to say that the Red Robin seasoning is yum-o, but way salty).  We came on a random Tuesday night around 7pm so I was surprised that there was such a long waiting time. We had a 7 person party and had to wait close to 40 minutes before we were seated. Red Robins doesn't take reservations either so if you're planning on coming with a 5+ party, I would come earlier than expected to put your name down and go shop across the street at Target or something.

I came here with a party of six for dinner on a Sunday night. Let me requisite my next statement with this: the place was completely empty!!! "It's going to be fifteen minutes." the hostess says.  WHAT?!?! FIFTEEN MINUTES? There's no one here! I think she might have heard my friend grumbling so she sat us in a few minutes, but she did not do it with a smile on her face. We're seated and our waiter takes our orders and asks how we want to split our check. When we asked for six separate checks, he says that he'll do two. At this point, I felt as if they couldn't split six checks so I tried my hardest understand. Fast forward to the check, and one of the managers told us that they could definitely split the check six ways.  So why the two separate checks? I can only come up with two possibilities: 1) you're lazy 2) you're stupid It's part of your job, dude. Is splitting two checks three ways really any harder than splitting one check six ways? Okay. I might be a little harsh, but the situation just baffles me to no end. The onion rings stack were delicious and the game day nachos were good as well, but not enough to get me to come back. Main courses were mediocre burgers at BEST, but the endless fries were awesome. I really love the Red Robin seasoning they give you at the table. TL;DR Better burgers and service at In-N-Out

Meh.  The food is edible.  There is a lot of it.  It's sloshing in grease, and there isn't anything on the menu that would fit any healthy eating criteria.  It's also crazy crowded because of the movie theater.  It has no vegetables on the menu.  All in all, I would rather go elsewhere.  But we like to meet our friends here before a movie, just like everyone else.

We should have known better,,, than to give Red Robins a SECOND chance!   1st time: family & I just had a great time at the AMC-14. We went to diner at RR after- this was my first time going. My hubby had been at the RR near Eastridge and said the endless fry basket was great. So, we get in there, not crowded at all, and we are sat right next to the restroom???  There were at least 12 other open tables near the front.- once our order arrived we were not given any napkins, our waiter disappeared, hubby had to ask another waiter to bring us napkins and was told, 'I'm not your waiter!' once we saw our waiter I yelled for him, he came up fast, I asked for napkins and for a refill of the drinks and ENDLESS FRY deal, he acted as if he was really tring to make up for his neglect, he then disappeared again?  After finishing our burgers the waiter shows up with just the napkins NO FRYS, hubby asked for the frys and the waiter replied, 'oh yea! Do you still want them?' hubby replied, 'why bother, we already ate our burgers!' and the waiter just blew it off because he did not care. Ok, fast forward ::2nd time:: family birthday request to go to RR- not mine,,, The wait time was average this day, after being sat at our table, the noise of the patrons seemed to increase full speed ahead adults shouting across their tables and screaming children and cring babies?!? We were wondering what was up, it was the music!!!  It was so loud it was driving everyone crazy without realizing it! But, then again, our waiter still sucked- he only gave one guest from our party a refill, we asked for extra mustard- he never brought it, and the check took forever. So, no I will not be returning to RR - Red Robins KP

TLDR version: horrendous service, poorly prepared food I've tried coming here a couple of times, and usually end up going somewhere else due to inexplicably long wait times.  I once tried to come at lunch and the place was half empty with no one waiting, but was told that there would be a 30 minute wait time. But I decided to give them a chance and came here relatively early on a Friday night.  The place was busy, but wasn't totally packed.  As usual, they said it was a 30 minute wait.  One hour later, my friends and I were seated.  I don't think they actually do any estimations; they just say 30 minutes regardless of how busy they are. A friend of mine has the menu here memorized, so as soon as we're seated she orders a bunch of appetizers for us.  It takes 45 minutes before the food shows up, and the waitress disappears for 20 minutes at a time.  Our burgers come out a little over an hour after we place our orders.  Water and drinks were left empty, and they didn't even give us utensils until 10 minutes after they brought our food. If the food was awesome I might overlook the bad service, but other than the awesome onion rings the rest of the food sucked.  The burgers were all burnt.  We had one child with us who ordered the grilled cheese, and the cheese wasn't melted.   A side order of mac and cheese came out cold.   I've been to other Red Robins, and they're not my favorite place but they're a decent place to get burgers.  I'm staying away from this one for good though.
SUPER excited about the gluten free bun!!! They have a gluten-free menu, but last time I was in the bun wasn't listed on it. Ask for it, though! It was great!

The good: Gluten free menu, the server Andres!!  the bad: fry seasoning is not gluten free, tricky. the ugly: the wait This was the first place I ate out since I began my gluten free venture. I have to say Red Robin BRAVO, because you made my first experience a good one.  I have to admit I was scared. Eating out is almost impossible when you are gluten intolerant. SO imagine my wonderful surprise when I heard they had a gluten free menu. (I took pictures)  During the wait for the table I looked at my choices, I was disappointed because no Bonzai burger but soy sauce is like 60 percent wheat so I understand.  Ordering: I tried not to make my gluten problem a problem so I didn't tell my waiter, much to my boyfriends dismay. I ordered the cheeseburger. Protein style when I asked if they had a seperate fryer for their fries He said yes but looked at me weird. I asked for fries with no seasoning. My boyfriend couldn't handle it anymore and said "she can't have gluten" A big look of realization came across the waiters face and he said "we have a gluten free bun."  GLUTEN FREE BUN!!! I almost died. YES please.  I ordered my food feeling so happy and when it arrived I was so happy because apparently when you have allergies you get a yellow basket that means the manager prepares it or whatever so you are sure it is perfect and gluten free. I still thought the fries looked like they had seasoning so I asked if I could get different fries. THe waiter took it all in stride and I thanked him profusely.  My food was good. Yes good and the bun was not lacking. I have to say though they added relish to my burger which I hate relish but  that was probably my fault. The bun is an extra $1 but it is worth it. My fries we amazing and my $2.50 well drink was also amazing. (happy hour after 9pm, M-F) If you go and you are gluten free Eat without being worried. Andres is also an amazing server.

Good Happy Hour Margaritas and Bottomless fries... Although, I wish they would be more generous with their fries servings especially if it's shared by a group, lol. It feels like we have to beg for more all the time we ask for more.

Fast service at the bar during Happy Hour. Simply Chicken Sandwich w/o bun: It was ok.  With just the chicken, lettuce, and tomato, it's a pretty plain meal as is.  I got a side salad instead of fries which was plain, but what I asked for. Chicken Caesar Wrap: Tasty.  I like the creamy Caesar dressing.  The portion was huge.

After the hike at Big Basin, we came to eat lunch here.  Probably not the best place to eat, but heck.....I wouldn't have eaten here if it wasn't for the hike! :) For a table of 8, we had to wait 15 minutes even though it was 2:30, but once we were seated, the server was quick and attentive.  We asked for fries before our food came out since we were starving.  I had my favorite: the California Chicken Sandwich with no mayo on a Whole Grain Bun.  Normally, I would eat half and I'm full, but this time, I ate the whole damn thing and I didn't feel guilty at all!  The sandwich was tasty and the fries were addicting.  Doesn't help that they're bottomless either!
Awesome food, awesome service. Really like the cocktails here. If you are a single or couple, you can nearly always sneak to the front of the line, even when it is busy.
Came here Monday with coworkers and one of my bosses. The server that started with us, Tyler, super friendly and made great recommendations. Server that took over.... she was ok. Food was yummy!

Guilty pleasure here- I love their guacamole bacon burgers. I am not a fan of chain restaurants, but I am a fan of Red Robin. I have been countless times and to several differnt locations and they never disappoint. I always get the same thing - that guac burger. I have seen people eat salads here and they look good, but come on, they make gourmet burgers. Time to cheat on the diet.  This location is as good as any. Good service, friendly staff, clean, and usually quick.
I love this location, ive been coming here for the last few years love the beer and i LOVE the fries, the staff is friendly ive never had an issue here.

Red Robin's has transformed! Great service, full bar, and sign up for their rewards program. Get a free burger on your birthday, visit 5 times in the first 5 weeks and get $20 gift certificate,  AND buy 9 items get the 10th free! Plus they have this $6.99 double cheeseburger right now that just can't be beat. Add a buck more to add bacon or mushrooms. So,  turns out the Red Robin's chain has a new CEO,  well I say bravo.

It started off so great. The host and our server were super friendly. The server even flirted with my friend's baby boy and chatted with us a bit. Shortly after she took our order, she disappeared. Thankfully, we'd had the foresight to ask for both our drinks and a separate glass of water. By the time the server reappeared, all our glasses were empty. It took about 30 minutes to get our food and it really just seemed our server was in the weeds. That confused me, seeing as how the restaurant wasn't even halfway full and it was a random Thursday night. We had to ask for a few things multiple times (like drink refills), and my friend was disappointed when her mac and cheese came out SUPER al dente, not to mention COLD. My burger was super tasty at least (and hot!), and I got to sub out the bun and a salad for fries, which made me happy. But would I go out of my way to come here again? Nope. There are better burger places with better service.

First off, I don't typically come to this one, because it's the furthest from my house. Secondly, my future husband really doesn't like this place. at all. ever. But after last night, I think I might have changed his mind. Rather successfully, I might add! After a shopping trip at Westgate, he wanted Amatto's. I like the sandwiches, but I just wasn't in the *mood* for it. So after much deliberation, I conceded and started to drive towards Santa Clara. Finally, he said, just go where you want! I said, but you don't LIKE where I want! Eventually HE conceded, and we turned around and headed to Red Robin.  The wait was pretty long - we heard they were short staffed - so we put out name in and scouted for a place at the bar. After about 10 minutes, a place opened up, so we snagged it. John, the bartender, was quick, friendly, and poured with a pretty heavy hand, and was really nice to look at! By the time we were eating our appetizer, our name was being called (even though I had told the hostess we were sitting in the bar, whatever). Our food came quickly, and John was always quick to fill out drinks and ask how things were going for is. The future husband decided he liked his Blue Ribbon Burger, and of course, I loved my Baja Turkey Melt. REALLY sad that they're no longer serving their AWESOME french onion soup anymore! Overall, I would come back here tomorrow to sit in the bar again. Also! Happy hour prices are seriously DIRT cheap. I'm a whiskey drinker, and their well whiskey is Barton's. Not too bad, especially for $2.50 for a whiskey and coke! Small domestic drafts are also $2.50, big ones are just $3.50. Happy hour runs from 3-6 and 8-close. If there's a wait, sit at the bar!

Food here is alright. It's not good, not bad. My go-to is the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Sandwich. So much flavor and so messy, but so good. Best thing about Red Robin is their bottomless steak fries and their bottomless strawberry lemonades :) Make sure you tell your server exactly what you want all when s/he is at your table or else you may never have a chance to flag them down. This place gets pretty hectic on weekends and it's very frustrating when you want more water, extra condiments, refill or the bill.

RED ROBIN...............................y u u u u u c k....... I went here for dinner with a party of 3 around 8:45pm tonight. Being it was nearly 9pm on a Thursday evening, I didnt expect a wait, but there was a 20 minute wait, which ended up taking 25 minutes.  As soon as we sat down, the person I was with said "I bet the service is gonna suck tonight" and boy, were they right.  First of all, being this Red Robin is right next to a movie theater, and Batman is showing at midnight tonight, along with the movie's trilogy, the manager of this location should have had the common sense to over staff, rather than under staff.  Nearly half of the restaurant was empty, but due to the fact the customer ratio was greater than the server ratio, everything just ran as slow as Eeyore on heroin.  The chefs were more backed up then the Octo-moms birth canal.  It took nearly 40 minutes to get our food after we ordered. When we finally got our food, they said "oh they are making your sweet potato fries, so we brought you some regular fries to go with your burger for now". Oh really!? Gee, thanks.... because I had no idea that sweet potato fries took 45 minutes to cook. Maybe Miss Idaho herself was back in the kitchen peeling them?  A few minutes later, the sweet potato fries FINALLY arrived. I was hoping that after the first bite, my teeth would turn solid gold or something spectacular would happen, due to the fact... they took so damn long, but unfortunately.... nope, they were just plain ol' sweet potato fries.  After finishing up, we asked for the check. The waitress informed my party that she went ahead and comped our drinks and took off the $1.00 charge for the sweet potato fries. Personally, I feel she should have given us all mani/pedi's to make it up to us, being the entire experience sucked as bad as the Star Wars prequel.  But with some restaurant chains, bad service and bad food is to be expected.  Let's just say that the ride back, wasnt a walk in the park, and more like a rush to the nearest restroom.  I felt as though I was in labor all over again and with every red stop light, the pain and breathing got worse.  The pains in my stomach felt as though the lolipop guild were doing a kickline against my insides.  I began to sweat and feel more and more awful.  My burger flashed through my imagination still moo-ing at me, all pink in the middle, and giving me the middle finger, telling me, "payback is a b!tch".  I felt like I for sure got a piece of mad cow on my plate, and maybe now it was multiplying inside me wanting revenge?... Maybe all of my vegan friends back in LA werent just "food hipsters" afterall? Maybe this vegan thing wasnt such a bad idea? I thought to myself. Finally, after the pain subsided and I awoke next to the toilet ((kidding)), I realized that maybe it was time to end things with Red Robin. Time to tell the 'big red faced guy' that it was over, and I wouldnt be seeing him or his delicious drinks anymore (and no, I am not talking about Mel Gibson).  This might take some time to get over. Afterall, I never experienced anything like this before with Red Robin or my innards, for that matter.  Needless to say, I wont be coming back. It was a fun ride, but a bumpy one. It was fun while it lasted, but not while it blasted. Well, you get the point....

I've been there many times, and the food here is great. Though, I don't go to many burger joints so take this review with a little grain of salt.  I recommended the Freckled Lemonade, though I would watch out on all those free refills because the calories ADD up fast. Same with the free Fries that come complimentary with the the burgers.  It can get quite busy and as a result their service may be a bit slow, otherwise it's a nice place for your friends or your family.

it's hard to rate a chain restaurant cuz each one is its own situation. i am generally pleased when i go to a red robin and usually never have cause for complaint - meaning the service is okay and the food good - nothing outstanding. so this review starts with a complaint - i ordered the artic cod sandwich and when the waitress brought it - it smelled like 2-day old ling cod!! took a tentative nibble and promptly spat it out (i was past being embarrassed - it was that bad) flagged a waitress and told her the sandwich was not fit for human consumption...then the customer service we foodies dream about happened. the manager came to the table and said he was gonna make it right. And he did! that sandwich looked and tasted like it was made with the highest care - fresh out of a fryer with fresh oil in it. pretty dang tasty... so i'm not giving a 1-star cuz they messed up and almost food-poisoned me...i'm giving them 3 for doing the right thing and without an attitude. of course, i would have given them 5 stars if they had made that 2nd sandwich on the house... but red robin retained a customer - the bottom line is that i'll be back when the urge for a burger hits me...

Hollar for $3.50 gold margaritas during happy hour!!!!! Went here on a Friday afternoon with my lil fambam right before the rush. Got seated right away, in the patio area since it was a beautiful day. Plus I have two boys that are under 4. Server was great and drinks always makes any situation better. Hubs ordered the chophouse burger which is huge burger and tasted FANTASTIC. I had the tavern burger which tasted like a whopper but cheesier!! I thought it was very tasty. My boys had the mac n cheese, they just love anything cheesy.... All in all, burgers are good and drinks are perfectly priced. def going to swing by if we are in the area.

One of my favorite places for a delicious juicy burger! This is my favorite location. My usually is their Royal Red Robin burger which consists of bacon and a fried egg. I always ask for extra crispy bacon and this is the only location that really makes it extra crispy. The garlic fries are amazing especially if they are straight out of the fryer.  Don't forget to signup/register for a Red Robin card. Get a free free burger after purchasing 9. I think you also get a free appetizer on your first use (verify that this hasn't changed). You also get a free birthday burger in your birthday month. The kids menu has plenty of choices for a reasonable price. The balloon at the end of the meal is always a treat for my son.  It can get pretty crowded for lunch and dinner on weekends so plan accordingly or come early.

Awesome place for artery-clogging, obesity-inducing food!  I usually get the guacamole bacon burger and towering onion rings to share (both of which are mouthwaterning-ly AMAZING). This time I had the Avo-cobb-o salad with focaccia bread and balsamic dressing and bleu cheese on the side. The salad was delicious that I didn't really need to add any dressing at all. The grilled chicken was nice and tender too. The focaccia bread was just pita bread with some "focaccia" flavoring though.    Great and attentive customer service is consistent no matter which location I go to. What I love about Red Robin is that portions are huuuuge for the price! I always have enough for lunch/dinner the next day- maybe it's also because I stuff myself with the bottomless steak fries hehehe

This place got their four star rating not just because their burgers are good (their burgers are about a 3.5), but because they give you bottomless fries. Come on, you can't beat that. Their new tavern burger is great. It's a double patty but not twice as big. Each patty is smaller, but you get two of them. OK, you're now saying "what's the difference then?". The difference is that there's more edges to the burger to get the flavor of their grill. It really makes a huge difference. I highly recommend it. The downside of this place is that there's usually a wait, and their service is iffy. Sometimes it's decent, but most of the time it's not so great.

Bumped up to a 3.5! Lately, my experiences at Red Robin have been great.  I love cheeseburgers. It's the perfect sandwich. Umami Burger has become The Best Burger Of My Life, but unfortunately, you won't find us driving to San Francisco every time I'm craving a burger (which is at least once a week). I still think In n' Out is better than Red Robin, but if I'm not feeling Animal Style-y, we go here.  I usually get the regular cheeseburger. Sometimes sesame bun, sometimes onion.  I don't always get the relish because it's sweet. Always American cheese because I like the way it melts. Lately, they've been cooking the beef perfectly - whether I ask for medium or medium-well. And it doesn't matter if it's steak fries, sweet potato fries, or onion rings - always ask for a side of campfire sauce.  Service is hit or miss - depending on who you get.

God help me, I really do like a Red Robin burger every now and then... So good!  Endless steak fries? Yes, please!  Free refills on root beer? Heck yeah. Did you know that this particular Red Robin carries craft beer as well? Probably not the best idea to suck down a pint at lunch BUT it would be a great after work treat. Or if you've had enough of your family, drink a few ;)

great bugers well thats what they are known for.... the burgers are also very big so its easy to split with someone plus you get bottomless fries so that always good.  Please don't come here and order something else other than a burger yes the other stuff is still pretty good but come on the burgers here are just so dang good.

Veggie friendly: you can sub any of their burgers with a Boca or garden veggie patty. I recommend the 'Shroom burger. This location gets high scores for service. I was here with a group of moms with young kids, and the servers were super attentive (bringing kids' food first, checking on their refills, keeping hot stuff out of the radius of baby hands, holding doors open for strollers etc) Thank you! We left a big mess in our wake, and YES I do guilt tip :)
This place rocks, the burgers are just the best in the area. Staff are so friendly.

Food was 3 stars :( got a turkey burger...correction. "SANDWICH". It didn't blow my mind, but it was palatable. The steak fries were pretty on point though. However, the reason I wish to review my experience here today is based solely on the the CHARMING waitress we had *insert sarcasm* named Shannon. When she took my order I told her I would take the grilled turkey burger. She read my order back to me as the turkey sandwich, which in my experience is a completely different dish. So I wanted to clarify with her that the "sandwich" would come with a turkey PATTY (not deli slices) and would come on a hamburger bun! And she replies impatiently... "yes, the sandwich." Ok. Maybe she is having a bad night, I'll let that one go. What really bugged me was when she actually brought my food to me. She says and I quote "Here's your turkey BURGARRRR. Don't take offense." Is she serious?! Not only that, she was not attentive to our table at all even though there weren't many other patrons at the time. The other members of our party complained that things we asked for were brought to us at a much later time. Average food, bad service. I will not be back.

Taking my oldest daughter here were fairly good experiences. Over the years and two more kids later I now come to realize that just as Denny's is for senior citizens, Red Robin is just the Denny's for middle aged adults with children. My kids like the burgers, but my kids would like the food anywhere they go just as long as they are out anywhere. Good burgers and generally average food. But, just that, average. I find my family just coming here when we're too lazy to go anywhere else and maybe the fact that my wife is just one visit away from getting a free burger.
Poor service. Subpar burgers. This is suppose to be a burger joint right? Only upside are the steak fries.

Red Robin has always been pretty good. Service was good but i really usually just come for the bottomless fries. the burger that i like to get is the whiskey river burger, but i have tried the bacon guacamole burger before. I like the whiskey because its got great sauce, and the combo of the rings and bacon are great. the guac burger isnt that great because they usually put too much bacon on it. always get the tower of onion rings. DONT COUNT YOUR CALORIES CUZ YOULL BE DISSAPOINTED!

Red Robin is definitely not the best burger in town, but provides consistent quality. Unfortunately, that quality is only deserving of 3 stars. As far as ambience and service go, this place is very good. But the food is consistently good. That is all. Just good. Not great, Not deserving of 5 stars.
Bonzai burger is my favorite.  Service sometimes is lacking.

I stopped by before a movie for dinner with my BF and his son. We were seated in a booth in the bar area. After about 5 minutes I noticed an  unpleasent smell coming from underneath my table. I reached down to straighten my pants and my hand was partially covered with FECES!  I ran into the bathroom and washed off the feces off the leg of my jeans.   My Bf was explaining to the servers why we were leaving and they just kind of looked at us like we were crazy or something. No body bothered to look under the table at all. They just sat someone else there at that booth after we left.  I know a lot of chain rest. are very dirty, but this was Horrible!!  Good bye forever RED Robin

I hadn't been to this Red Robin a while and felt like having something extra fatty this night. As we pulled up we noticed that their sign out front was different and looked nothing like the old one. We didn't think too much of it and just went in. To our surprise they had remodeled the whole restaurant. The waitress said they were trying to get away from the Chuck E Cheese feel. The Food: The food is always great but this time it seemed extra tasty and not as greasy. I don't think they changed the menu items but it tasted a bit better than before. I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger which I always order when I go here. I did notice that the bacon seemed to be of better quality than before. Not only that but I received three strips of bacon vs. the two that they normally give out. I got my burger on a wheat bun with American cheese. They waitress did ask how I wanted my burger cooked, some pink or cooked all the way through. I like it juicy so I went with some pink and I'm not sure if they gave you this option before. The hot date got a Chicken Caesar wrap which she said it also tasted good.  The Staff: The staff was nice as always. I did notice that they stopped wearing jeans like before. It's a little dressy and it looks nice, so long as they feel comfortable in their attire. The waitress came around a few times to make sure everything is ok. The only thing that sucks was that we did not get offered drinks or a refill on fries before the check was brought out. It's not like I was hungry after the meal, but it would have been nice if we were offered.  The Restaurant: As I said above, they remodeled the whole place. The layout was similar as before. The bar on the same side and the restrooms are located in the same spot too. They changed up the booths and made everything nicer. They moved the TV's around and added new pictures and frames. They even had framed pictures on the ceiling (dangerous, would not want to sit there) which looked cool! When you put your name on the wait list they take it down on a note pad and they actually text you when your table is ready. This is cool because you can go and wait in your car if the waiting area is too full. Am I going back?!? I will be coming back, especially now that they fancied up the restaurant without charging the customer more for their meals.

Red Robin is delicious and the staff is amazing! We ordered one drink, but our waitress gave us a free drink ON THE HOUSE. Okay, now how amazing is that?! Not to mention that the staff is super nice as well! And the food. Okay, don't even get me started on the burgers. It's like a hunk of delicious, dripping, fat. Except it's the most beautiful burger. Red Robin serves burgers but it's cheap and it's an ART. Their burgers are delicious! And so are the drinks. AND UNLIMITED FRIES. Okay, what more could you ask for? I would come here every week if I could! Definitely five star in my opinion, especially with its nice staff and price range.

Our server Crystal is great. Attenitive, sincere, shows patience & listens well. Family ordered the following. 'Shroom Burger, kids cheese pizza, kids grilled cheese, fried mushroom appietizer & sweet potato and finally the Artic Cod Fish n Chips. Being this is 01/01/2013 place is not as crowded as one would expect. Though this is a high traffic area with a movie theater some 100 yards away our wait was only under 10 minutes. Will be back again.
Wonderful service, very good food. I like how they have substitution options, like gluten-free or broccoli instead of fries. I'd go back!

When my girlfriend suggested we try to Red Robin on a Saturday night before a movie, I had my doubts.  Sure enough, we were told it would be a 25 minute wait for a table.  However, if we were to seat ourselves at the bar, there wouldn't be a wait at all.  The (metaphorical) clouds parted, and there was a little table for two waiting for us by the bar.  Hooray! We didn't have to wait long for our food.  My avacado bacon burger was well done (at my request), and done well.  Gf enjoyed her chicken ceasar wrap and fruit salad.  We also drank tasty lemon drops, recommended to us by our server.   All in all, this dinner was an integral part of what made our date night a success.  Excellent.

Great spot to have dinner before the movies ! Red Robin is my spot faSHO! My favorite RR, in particular though, is this location. The service is fast(er) and the food is always on point. Shoutout to the waitress who gave us free milkshakes, very nice of you! I also love how it's located in a shopping area with the AMC right across.... only bad thing is that I always get a food coma while watching a movie afterwards but i'll take it!  tip: get the freckled lemonade!!!!

Red Robin is a pretty decent restaurant. Positives - I really like their arctic cod fish burger. The fish is crispy and has just the right amount of tartar sauce. - The fries are delicious! I love the Red Robin seasoning that you can put on top! Negatives - Long wait- At times I had to wait near 30 minutes for a table.  It gets very busy on Friday and Saturday nights. -Inconsistent service- One time, I had to wait 30 minutes for a new batch of fries. It shouldn't of taken that long to get a fries refill. At times it also took long to get the drinks (water, soda, etc).  Overall, Red Robin has decent food but lacks great service. The wait times are also very long!

I feel like lately I've been on a Red Robin roll.  For like years I hadn't been to one.  Within the past month, I've gone to 2 different RR's.  Say whhhat?  That's what happens when you are a girl just hanging out with another girl, you want some endless fries. My coworker and I, went on our 'girl's night out,' dinner and a movie.  As we waited for our movie at the AMC Saratoga, we walked over to RR to grab a bite.  I ordered a super light meal: side of mac n' cheese, broccoli and a happy hour strawberry Margarita.  Overall, I was pleased with my meal.  Bonus I got to eat the fries off my friend's dinner.  The mac n' cheese I'd have to say was really good.  They give you good size portions for the sides.  Plus they are cheap.   Tips: Order the campfire sauce to dip your fries into.  There is a free sauce listing inside your menu on the lower left corner.  Do it!

Bottomless steak fries!  So good with the campfire sauce!!  The free refills on the freckled lemonade is also a plus since a lot of places only give refills on sodas and water.  I'm not much of a burger fan, but Red Robin has so many more options than burgers that anyone can find something they will enjoy. The workers are all very friendly and will gladly take your plate back if something is wrong or you mis-ordered your meal.   Margaritas have a good taste, but they aren't blended very well.  Too many ice chunks on more than one occasion.   This is a great place for lunch with friends, family dinners, or even dinner dates before a movie that's just across the parking lot.
i used to love this place till they took a corporate turn for the worse the service is terrible! and you have undercooked my burger every time since the manager change. do you not care?

I loved this place ! Great people great service great food great everything I love how the guy who helped us saw we had our baby and offered us anything for her usually in other places people just ignore her but here none of them did and I lied that also it was fast I recommend this place ! It was our first time here but forsure not our last

I love this place! My favorite server is Kristina! She is always friendly, you never have to ask for drink refills, and everything we asked for was brought quickly. Food is good nothing amazing but its  consistent.

Been to this one a few times, and a few different experiences, so just splitting the difference with the 4 stars. Love the fries & campfire sauce, and you have to order them right when you sit down so they (usually) will come out ahead of your meal. We've had a couple instances with less-than-stellar servers (not knowing the menu, not bringing fries till the meal is already out, etc), but fortunately our experiences have been more on the good side. I like that this one has also incorporated the SMS messaging for your table, so you can pretty much go off and do whatever you want, and then just go back when your table's ready. Way better than carrying around a big ol' pager that can only go 10 feet away.

I've been going to Red Robin for a few years - they had one in my town that I moved from.  This one is a lot better.  It's been a while - so I dont know if they're upgrading, on a trial, or if they upgraded all of them - but this one is definitely a step above other Red Robins I have been to.  Your sandwich comes on a plate with your own generous serving of fries.  While fries have always been bottomless, other experiences have had me share with my table and they give you like 10 fries. The burger was delicious, the beer selection was excellent and the atmosphere was upgraded.  Dont really know how to explain it - but it didn't seem as "chainy" as it used to.
Way better than I remember Red Robin from past visits.

To begin, service was slow, and we could not reach our waiter most of the time. He would bounce around nearby tables, but would somehow manage to skip our table numerous times when we needed service. The restaurant was initially packed, but the service speed did not pick up after the crowds cleared out. We started with the giant onion ring tower as appetizer. It was delicious and crunchy (and the probably best part of the meal). I loved the dipping sauces, especially the BBQ one. For entrees, we ordered the Ensenada Chicken Platter and the Whiskey River BBQ Wrap. The chicken was rather dry and bland. It had the exquisite taste and texture of cardboard paper. The BBQ Wrap was about the same. It makes me wonder whether Red Robin microwaves their food like Applebee's. The Cookie Magic shake was noticeably better than McDonald's Oreo McFlurry. (Apples to apples right?) However, its signature monster size has gone on a diet and is much smaller than I remember it during college. Was quite disappointed when I finished it a third of the way into the meal. The clam chowder soup was quite good and about the same quality as the ones I get from Safeway. I recommend it. On the other hand, the French Onion soup (which is supposed to contain sweet caramelized onions) was the saltiest I've ever tasted. I imagine the chef accidentally dumped half a cup of salt into it. No one at our table wanted to finish it. Overall, the food and service were quite subpar. I think I'll stick with McDonald's, as their

Tasty food.  Quick service. Cold beer. Waiting for my movie to start, I thought I'd have lunch here.  Found a seat at the bar quickly.  Server Lindsay was friendly and prompt.  Had a whisksey river BbQ chicken wrap.  Very tasty!   I also like this place because it is close to many other places.  Lots of stuff to see nearby. Definately coming back.
Great food - great service Great for the whole family TV for sports  Service was quick and accurate Very helpful Friendly to kids Good drink menu and food options Burgers are the best choice

OMG this place is amazing. My husband and I came here last night after watching a movie.  I was hoping for them to still be open after our movie had ended, and they were! We got out of our movie at 9:30 pm and I believe the restaraunt closed at 10 pm, but they were still willing to seat us even though they were only open for another half an hour. Our server was Lauren B. who was an absolute pleasure.  Most of the time when you go into a restaurant last minute, the servers tend to be grouchy and rude, but not Lauren. She gladly took our order with a smile, served us our plates in less than 10 minutes, had our orders perfect, and tended to all of our needs.   My husband and I ordered the Royal Red Robin, and it was absolutely amazing.  The burger came out perfect!  It's basically a cheeseburger with an over easy egg on top; however, we don't like our hands getting all messy, so we ordered ours over hard.  We ate those delicious burgers in a matter of minutes lol.  Our orders came with bottomless fries, but our burgers had us full enough. I am totally a burger kind of gal, and the burgers sold here are definitely some top rankers!! Upon finishing our meal, Lauren came back to ask us if we wanted some more fries or possibly a dessert.  She handed us our bill, and said no rush, just take your time, and let me know when you guys are ready to go.  We tried to skidaddle as soon as possible to clear way for their cleaning to commence, yet no one was in a hurry except for us. THIS LOCATION ROCKS: Great experience, Great Food, and EXCELLENT SERVICE!!

Terrible! Three times I ordered food here, it comes out ice cold.They made a huge mistake downsizing the menu, so the foods I did like are no more. Its not just this restaurant,  but all of them. Cold food and poor service. Never again will I or everyone else I know will eat here.

Been going here for a long time and a Red Robin member.  Recently the place was remodeled and it was a nice change.  But another thing changed around the same time and quite frankly it has me annoyed.  I'll explain.  My wife and I share a sandwich there because we're older and watching our calories.  In the past we've asked that the sandwich be split and it's never been a problem.  But following the remodel things changed.  We've been told under the "new system" they don't do this.  Really?  I don't believe this is good customer service, especially for people who are regulars.  Hence the 2 star rating.  Hopefully somebody in RR upper management will read this review and do the smart thing.  Otherwise there are plenty of other places that will gladly do what I request when I dine there.

I love red robin!! Their service is usually great at times you'll get the servers who are slower then the others, but the food makes up for it, haha! I always get the Chicken Ciabatta! It is the best with basket of endless garlic or regular fries with ranch & camp fire sauce! THE BEST! The whiskey burger is DELICIOUS too!! All at good prices (around $28 for two chicken ciabatta's and endless fries!
My friends and I enjoyed a tasty meal there this afternoon. The waitress was very helpful with my friend who has recently stopped eating wheat, making some great suggestions.
This place gets packed at dinner time so come early.   Awesome burgers! Bottomless Fries! Cold Beer!  What's not to like?

Im a vegetarian and it might be amusing that I love burgers :) But i love their veggie burgers not to mention their bottomless fries and their shakes are swim worthy (i,e- i can swim in it ). Nothing more to say  - great burgers, great fries, yummy shakes. Their alcoholic beverages are super strong and super good.

I was there for dinner yesterday for a friends birthday and the waitress that we had wasn't as nice as I hoped she would be. She took a really long time to come and get our order, but she didn't even ask what drinks we wanted before we started to look at our menus. Instead she comes back after having taken our order and says, "oh, you guys didn't tell me what you wanted to drink". I was just thinking isn't that your job?  But the waitress that delivered our food was really nice.  I don't really like the whole new Red Robin look, the sign and the menu. It's just too much.

I usually come to this red robin and sit in the bar area. Tonight I came with some friends and my husband and we sat in the bar area. I'm not sure what the deal was but a guy named John was the server. We waited forever to even get our drink order. People who sat after us got their drinks and food before we even got our drinks. It took 25 minutes to get our food. We asked for fries before our meal came, never did. We asked for lemon wedges, had to get them ourselves because they never came. We finally got our food which was cold, and no utensils for the salads. He tried to redeem himself but the whole meal took almost 2 hours. I will return but I may not sit in the bar area.

i was very unimpressed .. i decided to take my mother out  for  dinner we don't spend too much time together with both of our busy work days  we were both very excited we normally love red robin but had not been there in a while  when i went  decor was completely different  it looks fantastic i said oh they change the decor well apparently there service and food quality went down to maybe im picky because im a server  my self but i didnt not like our service one but nor my food  now i got my normal thing i have gotten every time i went  and it was terrible fries were cold chicken was rubbery  my server looked extremely unhappy this was not  what i was paying for  my mother and i could not get over how horrible our experience was  our server look as if we were bothering  her to order our food or drink no thanks  i might try it again but something would totally have to change

I came here for the first time in a really long time recently and I was pretty impressed and left with a happy belly! I had a regular cheese burger with avocado and got ciabatta bread instead of the regular buns. Delish!! Also their fries were so good! They say it's bottomless but I promise you don't need more than that first serving! They also have this dangerous bottle of seasoning on the table.....!!! I swear I used more than a few tablespoons on the fries and burger! DANGEROUS but SO GOOD! I also got their Freckled Lemonade which was yummy too!

Came here on a Monday night for dinner. There was no wait to be seated.  And the restaurant itself was not busy. I normally like coming here but when I got my soup it was cold. The pizza my son ordered was not that good. And my husband got sick off the burger he ordered. The only thing that night were the fries.

Very friendly and industrious staff. I stopped in at around 8:30 on a weekday, not expecting it to be crowded. I would be surprised. Absolutely packed, I was contemplating trying somewhere else, when one of the hostesses offered to get me a spot at the bar. Service was so quick, it didn't seem as if the restaurant was full at all. And that's just the service! Bottomless root beer floats and fries were excellent, as were the chicken tenders. Definitely will come here a bit more often.

If you like chain restaurants, here is another typical American chain that serves average food to the masses.  If you have tastebuds or a distinctive palate, you will be disappointed with their burgers even though that's what they market as their specialty. Meat was bland and a bit greasy.  Toppings are not that fresh, fries are big and generic.  Service during this visit was friendly but really slow.  It took over 35 mins to get our food. If you are a true burger fiend- go to the Counter- you won't be disappointed.
I don't think we've ever had bad service here. The waitstaff often go out of their way to refill drinks and fries quickly. They are very accommodating regarding special orders.

The servers and bartenders at Red Robin are very friendly and cool. Sometimes I sit at the bar, sometimes I eat solo, and other times I sit at the bar or a table with friends. All have been good experiences.  I rarely actually  order burgers here; instead, I usually order a chicken salad or chicken sandwich. Those are good, but not great.  The burger menu is enormous, and the burger combinations are creative. I like that you can get healthy sides as substitution for fries (broccoli, salad, and so on) at no extra cost. Red Robin is really popular; often there are lines to get a table and it can get noisy. it is also a great place to take the family.

Michelle was our server. She was quick. Interacted with our little one perfectly and made our entire experience enjoyable. The only thing that kept it from being a 5 star score was a few of the food items were cooked incorrectly. Over done fries. Under done cheese sticks.

I've been coming to this Red Robin for over 10 years, usually once or twice a year, and I'm finally writing a review.  First off, I really like the food here. The whiskey BBQ burger is my goto burger, subbing onion rings for fries and having at least one friend get fries so we get bottomless fries :) the jungle shake is pretty good too as I have recently discovered and red robin now offers some mini patty options for a dollar or two less.  Pricing is average, ~$10 a burger with fries. Nothing special.  The service on the other hand is totally hit or miss. In recent trips, I'd have to say I'm not impressed and last time I went the waiter never gave us any fries even though we asked for them the moment we sat down. He said he'd get them twice but never did, and it was a slow afternoon so that really disappointed me. In olden days, the staff would practically force feed us fries and keep them coming - that's what drew me to Red Robin in the first place and kept me going over the years. I even went for 3 of my birthdays in a row in high school! The location next to Amc 14 Saratoga recently remodeled and it looks pretty nice now. Food tastes delicious still. But the staff recently hasn't been too hot, which is why I'm rating this as 3 stars, because it really used to be the staff and fries that set red robin apart for me, and without it, I could easily go elsewhere. My friends feel the same and it's harder to get a group to go to red robin anymore :/ nonetheless, I would still say it is worth a trip every now and then! Carry on!

These folks do a great job. My gf and I typically get their food to go, which is always well packed and still warm by the time we drive 10 minutes back to the house. The bartenders are always great to us, and the entire staff feels helpful overall.  Definitely consider joining their FREE rewards club (one aside-we visited several times before a bartender mentioned its existence) and you get a FREE burger in your bday month, plus other rewards if you eat their frequently. A note about my reviews: I only give FIVE STARS for places that absolutely blow me away and rock my world. FOUR stars means a place I would frequent and feel comfortable suggesting to anyone. THREE stars is a place with potential or an occasional visit. TWO stars means we had a neutral or slightly negative experience. ONE star means we will never return.

I ordered for pick up at lunch time a few months ago. The guy (bartender) was really rude and made it seem like I was intruding on his important Red Robin bar tending.  Thought I'd never be back but I was starving, and across the street today and thought I'd give it another shot. The hostess was very nice and told me to go to the end of the bar (like last time). I stood there for TEN minutes without being greeted. Luckily I knew exactly what I wanted because I was never offered a menu. It was not very busy but my order took a total of 40 minutes. I wasn't asked if I wanted ketchup or anything else, there were no utensils or napkins. I was just really disappointed by the service once again and unfortunately I will not be returning to this location again.  I give two stars because the food is pretty good and because they offer vegetarian burgers.

I have been coming to this location once or twice a year for about 9 years and recently went for my birthday. I ordered the Beserker (promotional burger tied in with the Wolverine movie). It was supposed to be a burger with aoli and Sriracha onion straws on a brioche bun. I asked for the aoli on the side since I don't usually like my burger slathered with greasy condiments. When I got it, the overall taste was okay, but I didn't taste the Sriracha at all. So, I asked the server if I could have some extra on the side. He came back with a little cup of some kind of powder and said that was what they used. Sriracha powder?! That stuff is awesome! I sprinkled it lavishly all over my burger and fries, and that was the best burger meal I've ever had at Red Robin. Overall, I like coming here with my family. The service is usually pretty decent, and the updated decor is nice. My kids like having their junk food treat here and love stealing sips of Freckled Lemonade and the big, fat home fries. I wouldn't come here if you're watching your calories, though. Even the salads are pretty calorie-dense. I miss the free burger on your birthday without the hassle of getting the silly card, though. The last thing I need to tote around is another plastic "rewards" card - especially since I don't really eat there that often.

Red robins, yummmmmmmmmm  Right ?! So we came here around dinner time, we have about 7 people. We see some openings but the hostess told us to wait, she wasn't specific or welcoming, she makes me uncomfortable honestly, so we just waited, about 10 mins we got seated, I ordered milkshake, bacon burger, it was good. Wasn't great, it's nothing special here except eat all the fries you can haha. Food took a while, our waiter is friendly and polite . Recently we went it was renovated, looks nice inside, won't be back for awhile. Parking is kinda hard it's in the same lot as amc 14

I've been here a couple of times over the years usually to redeem my Birthday Burger with my family.  If there's anything that I enjoy is a free meal and Red Robin's Royalty Reward program always gives me something to look forward to on my birthday month. As for the food itself, this Red Robin, like other locations, has gotten a bit more modern in its decor.   My most recent experience here was my to-go order on the last day to redeem my birthday burger.  I was seated at the bar and I was amused to see how they arranged their hard liquor bottles on their shelves.  Some of their bottles were literally way out of reach for their bartenders...one of them even had to get a stool just to reach a bottle of Jameson!   Otherwise, a decently adequate Red Robin for your burgers and unlimited fries fix.

I've been coming to this Red Robin since after they replaced the Cucina Cucina that was previously there.  Mostly every time we've gone, we received great customer service, though, once in a while (as with every restaurant type establishment) the service was a little slow.  This last time that my girlfriend and I went, we decided to share a burger. We waited for about 25 minutes after we ordered, until our server came to our table. He told us that there had been a mix up with our order and that they were making it. Meanwhile, he brought us a basket of fries and told us our meal would be taken care of.  Within minutes, he returned with the burger, and left us to eat. We realized that the burger had been made normal(both my gf and I aren't a fan of the pickle relish), and asked if he could bring a bun without the pickle relish. He apologized again and brought his manager who informed us that they'd be making a second burger, and a bun for the burger on our table as well as a gift card for next time.  Talk about above and beyond.  Of course, by this time, we'd been there for about 45 minutes and were starving, however, her genuine concern for our meal by checking up on us a few times after they brought the second burger was reason enough to write a review. We left our server a tip and left with a smile on our faces.  Good Job Red Robin. You have the right people in charge at this location!

Great place to go eat if you have kids! I will bring the family out every once in awhile and we usually have another family join us for dinner. This place always has balloons and crayons ready when we show up to eat. The kids menu is standard eats, but we have never had an issue with the little guys not finding something they like. Its usually loud inside due to all the family's around. We usually go during dinner time, i don't know what the sound level is like during lunch. They have a great selection of burgers and endless french fries. You also wont break the bank eating here. Awesome place to enjoy a dinner out with the family.

This is a fun restaurant. Don't come here for gourmet food or perfect service.  It is just reasonably priced burgers and fries. The drinks are pretty good too. I am vegetarian and the veggie burger options (they offer two different patties) are great.  I always tell my wife you see the real California here. It isn't just Silicon Valley techies who look like douche bags. Since it is closer to Campbell, normal humble people come here. It gives it an honest vibe. Minus one because the wait on weekends sucks.  It's also nice that they have lots of TVs playing sports.

This is one of those places that you learn to avoid when busy. I have never had good customer service in this store unless it was half-empty. They just can't handle a crowd. The food is good, I had a bacon and guacamole burger and a great milkshake. But simple food shouldn't take so long to get on the table.  I'm giving this place two stars, but if they were able to deliver without a ridiculous wait I would give them four stars. (Yes, the service really was that unbearably slow.

I am new to gluten-free food. Headed over to Red Robin at the suggestion of a GF friend.   Had been here many times in the past as we have two young children.   Yesterday, our visit was through new eyes.  Explained to the waitress that I needed gluten-free.  She didn't hesitate and grabbed the allergy-menu. Plenty of options to choose from. Picked the cheeseburger with a GF bun with fries.  Waitress explained that the GF fries are cooked in a separate fryer.  Waitress was very accommodating - didn't make me feel awkward for ordering off a special menu at all.  Food was great (even the GF bun!), hot and the service was even better. We will definitely be back.  Not the fanciest place around, nor the quietest or quickest (usually there is a wait for table).  But 5 stars overall.  Thank you, Red Robin!

I've been back several times since my last review and I'm quite impressed. With new management comes progress. Their staff have increased in production instead of just standing around and their new menu is fantastic.

The burgers are awesome. And bottomless fries are even better. I find the draft beers to be watered down. The last couple of times I've been here the service was great. This place gets packed quick, so come early.   Sign up for the Red Royalty Rewards program.

Red Robin has a variety of food choices to choose from, but their food is whatever.  One day while dining with my Fiance, we were sitting near the kitchen and we realized that a lot of their food was already pre-made and came out of a plastic bag.  Since when did vegetables and macaroni and cheese come out of a plastic bag?  When we saw this, we were disgusted and told one another we would never come back to a Red Robin.  My Fiance's co-worker once had a bad experience from this Red Robin where the chicken burger his co-worker ordered was still frozen.  I can't believe they do not check their food before sending it off with the customer for their takeout.   We definitely had better experiences elsewhere.  I do not recommend Red Robin for any dining experience.  If you want a good burger or good food, go somewhere that will provide you with fresh food and not anything that frozen or comes out of a plastic bag.
love love love their onion ring thower thingy!

I've been to 4 RRs, on both coasts and really like them in general.  I'll be brief, this one was not like the other 3: -  extremely slow service, place was busy but not crazy -  order was wrong -  replacement order was a lukewarm burger, cheese didn't even melt -  no utensils delivered Mgr comped us the incorrect order but we (2 of us) were there well over an hour, (took for-ev-er)... ridiculous. Not going back here, will go to the RR in Rivermark.

my wife and I go here more times than we would care to admit. what can I say? I like burgers, fries and beer. sue me. look, they make a good burger.  bottomless garlic fries? yes please big fat glass of blue moon? you betcha the only reason they get 3 stars is because 75% of the time their service is lacking one way or another. not horrible, but there is usually some service hiccup that make the dining experience less than perfect. doesn't matter enough to me to stop going there. the place is close by and their food and drinks make me happy.

So this was the second disaster on my nephew's 3rd birthday extravaganza~  We were seated at 7p.m, we didn't receive our food until 40 minutes later!! There were other customers who were seated in the same area after us who received their food before us! When I spoke to the manger about the issue, he gave me a lame excuse about how maybe we ordered something that took a little longer!! We ordered a damn burger! The same thing the other customers ordered and got before us! When we finally got our food it wasn't hot and we had to ask for fresh fries! I'll just be. This just wasn't our day of good customer service~ Its okay nephew I'll make sure you have a good time at your big birthday party this weekend~
Good food worst service that i have ever had order drinks 10 min later you see them ask for more frys 20 min latter nothing wont be going back

This place has good television sets and ok food.  My southwest chicken salad was poor...the dressing was inadequate, few beans, limited cheese and tortilla strips..a very lazy effort, in my view. The wait staff is young and absent much training.  Go here for the beer, but, really needs a step up for families. Nice location, but management needs to get on the ball, seriously.

Very slow service! Came here at 6pm for dinner before a 7:45 movie. Got seated 30mins later, which is fine since it's the weekend. Ordered our food right away, however the food came out 45 mins later. This place has gotten slower throughout the years.

we kept hearing how busy our server "Billy" was. No napkins , no utensils. Went to ask the girl behind the bar, but I had to wait while she finished texting. They brought the wrong order, then brought the right order minus the avocado. The only things paying us any attention were the gnats flying around the tables. We should have left as soon as Billy said "I'll be with you as soon as I POSSIBLY can"  J. Alves

Even though it's the week before Christmas, and everywhere is busy, this Red Robin let us down. Prior visits have been satisfactory. The longish wait for a booth was expected, and about a dozen people were in the lobby. We waited perhaps twenty minutes. Not too bad. The booth was in the bar area. The wait person, Juan, was not friendly or engaged. Our drink order took a long time (perhaps another ten minutes), he said the bar was backed up; but we watched the bar tender casually washing and wiping glassware, yet still promptly serving customers on the bar stools. One drink came first, then Juan took our food order. Right out of the menu book, nothing complex. After a reminder, the second drink arrived.  Then we didn't see Juan near our booth for sometime, perhaps another twenty minutes. We flagged down a staff member and out came Juan with our cold burgers and cold fries. I told Juan we'd not eat those, he shrugged and vanished. We asked the person at the hostess station for the manager (we were very tempted to just cut and run). Well, Juan got to him first! "I sincerely apologize" over and over. Then a new one "Why didn't you tell me sooner?" Really dude? This is your restaurant. If you don't know when your customers are being ignored, or your food is cooling off at the serving line, or your servers are "phoning it in" you might consider another career! We didn't go there to manipulate "free dessert" - another lame offer made to bring us back. A juicy burger, an a little holiday people watching, was why we came in. Bad service and bad attitude is why we won't come back! Visit here at your own risk.

The service was 'ok' .... My disappointment was with the food ... first off the burger wasn't served in the traditional 'RR paper pocket that makes it easier to eat. Next thing ... I asked for 'medium' and it was served 'well done' ... lastly ... I ordered extra BBQ sauce on the side .... instead they skipped the BBQ sauce on my burger as if I had asked for the sauce on the side. Very disappointed!!!!! Will not go back. On the plus side the servers were nice and attentive and the beer was great. So I am changing my review from 1 star to 2.

Service was absolutely terrible the last few times I visited. If I am going to see you once the entire night, AT LEAST get the orders right...  On top of that, this location has the worst, most meek and useless managers that I have ever seen. It will be a while before I visit again, which is a shame because I love the bottomless fries.
I love their bottomless serving of french fries, their onion rings and teriyaki burger! Still my favorite burger.

I would have given this restaurant a 5 start if it werent for the fact that our waiter did not put our order in the computer and after about 45 min., we started to wonder why our food wouldn't come! We asked to speak to the manager and she apologized for what had happened. She was very nice and our whole lunch was on the house(it was 7 of us total). The waiter was also very nice I just think it got really busy too fast and he lost track, I don't know but either way he was ok. The food was amazing, we had fish and chicks, onion rings, burgers and kids meal.  This incident wont stop me from coming back.

It was date night with the boyfriend and we wanted to go somewhere we could watch the Sharks game. When we walked in none of the TVs were playing the game but they were nice enough to put the game on. Although I liked that we were able to watch the last period and overtime in it's entirety, it made me upset that we had to wait about 30 minutes for our food while tables seated after us got served before. I ordered a Crispy chicken salad and my boyfriend ordered a chicken sandwich. To me that shouldn't take that long of a time. I give them three stars because I would probably go back.

Service is ok here, but the food is meh. 1)  The home made wing sauce they have is funky, some weird aftertaste in their recipe.  Also, they were fatty and low quality. 2) Burger was tasty, but the buns are oily and sticky, felt like I need to wash my hands after every time I picked it up.   Annoying.    Generally this place is like Bj's and many other chain joints, looks nice but I always walk away feeling unsatisfied.

I am a frequent customer at red robin and usally I would rave about how yummy and cheap they are, but the other night me and my coworker went to eat there after work it was around 7:30. And it was pretty bad.  So I forget our servers name but he was cool, joked around with us got us anything we needed, and got our food out fast.... But that's were it goes down hill. As soon as he drops off our food he drops the tab too. Now I've been a waitress for over 2 years and that is so rude. You don't drop the tab off until the customer is pretty much done with there meal.  But we just set the bill aside and try to enjoy our meal, not 5 mins later I'm not even half way done with eating, our server try's to pick up the tab... I told him we haven't looked at it yet and he looks super embaresed, and walks away.   And no joke, and soon as he leaves our table the manger comes over it's this blond guy with a mustache comes over and demands that we pay the bill. I've kept my cool so far but that just pissed me. So I tell him " this is unbelievable, were not even halfway done with my meal and your asking me to pay. What If wanted something more or dessert, I'm a waitress and I would never treat my customer like this!" He kept demanding that we "pay him now "so we did. But that was really one of my worst experiences eating out.

Don't go to this restaurant unless you like horrible service and improperly prepared sandwiches.  When I told the manager, Brian about the bad service and food and how I was not going to pay for my sandwich, he starting yelling at me "don't tell me how to do my job"  he then pulled out his cell phone and threatened to call the police on me for "running out on my bill".   Red Robin should know better than to put this guy in charge of a restaurant who knows nothing about customer satisfaction and being respectful of customers especially when the customers are senior citizens!
