Our server was nice and helpful. But we were there over an hour before we got out food and it was cold when arrived. Heared other people complaining about the service to. Maybe they need more help? Hire more people!

The El Paseo Red Robin is my favorite location with its great service. Plus, who doesn't love the endless fries? I was surprised to find this location very busy on a Saturday night at 5.  It was filled with families with small children; I guess a 5 PM dinner time for families with toddlers is the equivalent to a 7 PM dinner for adults.  We had to wait for 20 minutes but it was nice that they texted us when the table was ready. When we were seated, we were greeted by a nice waitress who served us our waters quickly.  We took a while to decide what we wanted but she was very patient and checked up on us without being pushy.   I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ burger and it was pretty good considering I am not a Red Robin fan.  The burger was nicely cooked and the toppings were not overwhelming.  I would expect a BBQ burger to be dripping with barbecue sauce but it was not overwhelming.  The crispy onion straws on the burger were a nice touch and every other bite I would crunch on a piece of bacon.  The bun however, was not toasted to my liking (or at all really) as well as everyone else's buns.  I guess they don't toast their buns or they were really busy that day... My big problem with Red Robin is their "endless" fries are usually not endless and floppy.  Our waitress asked if we wanted more fries but I was satisfied with the fries I had.  The manager also came by and asked if we were satisfied with our meals, which we appreciated.  The steak fries were also very crispy!  Not one was soggy, which made me very happy.  The fries were tasty AND they were actually endless. Overall, I was pleased by my dining experience.  The service was great and the food was good.  I still prefer the Island chain to RR, but I am starting to reconsider after that Whiskey burger!

Horrendous experience after waiting for 50 Min with kids. The order was delivered wrong ...manager was obnoxious...we were never welcome. This is is my mast experience with Red Robin. The last time another floor manager asked me to give them another chance. So we showed up to be disappointed again. This will be my last time at Red Robin because it is it worth any of the effort that hoes into it for a customer. This is not the experience I expect to have in a place like this with the kids hence I will not go again ...ever.

Since when has happy hour excluded beer on tap Really. Service was ok I waited for more then 5min for an extra basket of fries.  I finally got frustrated and asked for the bill. Over all the burgers are great but will not go back for happy hour. I would rather got to Applebee's for a real happy hour.

Undoubtedly one of the worst meals ever! I should have known that the story would not end well when we were told out wait would be 15 minutes and clearly half the tables were empty. We.ordered the onion rings and zucchini for appetizers. The rings were ok but we only got half an order of the zucchini and the waitress made no move to fix the order after it was brought to her attention. The riblets and clucks was the most awful dish. The riblets were literally broiled in a pile causing them to char and stick together like a pile of meat marshmallows which were then dumped into a soup of nasty bbq sauce. The only redeeming aspect of the dish were the French fries which came out 5 minutes after the rest of the dishes but were at least hot.
Decent food. Nice staff. Good for a quick bite.

Can never go wrong with Red Robin and their burgers. Not only do they come with endless steak fries but their own seasoning is amazing!  The big cantina tavern burger and the guacamole bacon burger were both incredibly satisfying and delicious!  My friend brought two hungry teenagers who can eat bucket loads of fries so the first thing you might want to consider doing is to asking for the fries refill PRONTO when ordering the meal, this way you would not have to wait for more fries to come as they can take some time.
Cold food but at least the service was really slow and the server kept the comment card.   Gee. Wonder why?  Really poor.   At least McD's serves warm food.  Inexcusable.

My 10 year old and I got to spend the afternoon together since Daddy and big bro were watching a movie that was too mature for him. So he got to choose where we had lunch. Server was ok, but it took over 30 minutes to get two chicken burgers and fries. At least the chicken was juicy, the fries were hot and crisp, and my little man ended up being very happy with our lunch.

I like coming to this location because i usually do dinner and movies with my boyfriend since AMC is just across the parking lot. So I came in on 3/16/14 and the experience was just terrible!! I came with my boyfriend and 2 of his buddy's  to do dinner and movies, We arrived and got put on the wait-list at 7:09 they called us in around 7:29. We got our beverages as soon we sat down. They took our food order at 7:45 and we didn't get our food until 8:30!! Our movie started at 9!! 45 minutes just to get our food. We didn't even get to enjoy our food! As soon as we got our food we literally gulped our burgers down and left around 8:50! 1 star for the food because it was good but I didn't get to enjoy it..

This location is hit or miss.  Sometimes it's great and everything from service to the food is on point and other times it's so bad you don't even want to pay.  If I didn't love bottomless fries...I'd skip it
Great Service, Lots of Parking, Friendly Service. Also, can't go wrong with all day happy hour and bottomless root beer floats.

My daughter and I stopped in here for a quick "beverage" after getting our nails done.  It was a friday around 3pm so I figured it was a good place to "happy hour".  To my disapointment, the bartender politly said they no longer have a "happy hour".  Instead they have a handfull of items that are always lower priced.  That's no fun, I like Happy Hour! Oh well, we ordered a glass of $4.50 house red (Rex Groth) and a Screaming Zombi.  Wine was bleh but it's $4.50 so what can I expect but my daughter enjoyed her Screaming Zombi quite a bit.  Not too sweet, not to bitter and plenty of booze to make ya "feel" it.   The hubs and I have come here a few times for the food.  The burgers are good.  Nothing outstanding but good for a chain restuarant.  I tried their onion dip and didn't really care for that.  The chips were weird and the dip was way to sweet.  Oh well, gotta try it at least once right?  Service is consistantly good. Very friendly bartenders and the crew keeps the tables cleaned after folks leave.   Red Robin really caters to families and young adults.  My daughter came here with friends often when she was in High School.  It's not a place I would choose for dinner just because I've had my fill of chain burger joints but it's a nice stop in before or after catching a movie at AMC14.  They have a small outdoor patio that faces the parking lot when the weather isn't to bad.  This place does get busy on the weekends and evenings .  I've driven by plenty of times and the line was nuts.  So if you're planning to visit, I'd come early.
Spoke to the Gm and am ok with the info I was given and feel they are trying to better the location and staff. I will give them another try .

This place sucks. Don't go here unless you want to wait 50 minutes to an hour for your food. Once the food gets to you its cold and tastes like the troll in the Hobbit part 1 not 2 took a crap on your plate.

I've been to Red Robins all over the place.  Generally love them.  Not this place. Was told 20-25 minutes to sit.  40+ minutes later we got seated.  10 more minutes to order.  10 more minutes  and we had to beg for some friggin fries to stop my son from gnawing on the table.  Wanted to pay for out drinks and leave.  20 more minutes for our orders; one patty still icy in the middle.  Should've left.

Today they get 2 starts specifically because of the food.. I order the Whiskey River BBQ chicken salad and UGH.. there was sooooooo much sauce on/in the salad it was horrific, the Jicima was the size of hubba bubba bubble gum..NOT A GOOD LOOK, the tomatoes....let's just say it was some bullshit. I cannot believe a restuarant would serve tomatoes that looks like they've been parading in the Tomatoe fair or something..like on Highway 101 after a bad accident. I politely took my plate to the waiter and informed her I was eating or paying for that.. she was sweet.. I think I lost my appetite but I placed another

I have been to other locations and have had great food and service, however, I've been disappointed every time I go to this location. Today was just terrible. Our server never did bring us out sugar for our iced tea even though we asked 3 times, I just took it from another table. Our food came out cold. One of our dishes came out hot and the rest were just lukewarm. Clearly, they were waiting for the one dish. I had soup and warm soup isn't the best. My son also asked for no mayo which didn't happen. We didn't send anything back since we had already waited so long to be seated and a long time for our food, we just couldn't wait anymore. There burgers are good, but not any better than what is available at other restaurants nearby. First time, we chalked it up to just a bad day. This is our third and last time. If I really want Red Robin, I've had good experiences at the Eastridge location. Our server was nice and kept our drinks filled, but that is about it positive about today's experience.
Bar seating available at this time wow.. Well I guess baseball season just started soo anything could happen.. So what I am trying to say is.. This is about the best time to come..

I go to this place a lot and every time i have gone the service has been horrible! Every time i have been here we have had to ask for more napkins. But this night we went and all ordered! I got the whiskey river BBQ chicken wrap (which is my favorite) and fries and m brother and mom ordered fries too! we waited for about 40 minutes and our food was still not here... we asked out waiter where it was and he said he would go check and then 15 minutes later he said its almost done. ITS ALREADY 9:30!!!!!!!  Finally he comes out with are food and the hot food we ordered and fries are ice cold literally!!!! If i am going to pay 40$ for a meal i want it to be hot and delicious! so we called the manager and apparently it was his first day ! so they got us hot fries in less than a minute!!! and he also took 15 bucks off the meal! so overall i come to this place because the food is okay and its a good hangout if you want fries and a milkshake. And i am not just saying this to be rude but i go here alot and the service is always bad.

I don't go to  chain restuarants very often, but we felt like a burger, and we enjoy the bottomless fries this place offers. We spilt one of the more expensive "featured burgers" with blue cheese and onions and mushrooms.  While it wasn't as blue-cheesy as advertised, it was a good, juicy burger and yelp I like those bottomless fries. On this last visit they were not as salty as usual, and quite enjoyable. Our waiter was great and attentive.

I was a bit wary of this place because of the reviews about service, but this place is A-OK! I think we went there a bit earlier than dinner time, so our experience wasn't as bad. We ordered: Bottomless Milkshake ($4.49) --flavorless vanilla ice cream --We drank 3 of them and good thing they were bottomless because that's expensive! 3 A.1.® Peppercorn ($10.99) -Bacon, melted Pepper-Jack, A.1.® Peppercorn Spread, tomatoes and crispy onion straws on an onion bun, came with bottomeless fries -Burger was OK, A1 Peppercorn was blah.  -Steak Fries were nice hot and crispy  Overall: Tables should be wiped down, it was a bit sticky...Service was really good. She was really nice and attentive. Before we even spoke she asked if we needed more fries and a refill of our bottomless shake! She gave us 2 orders of fries and 2 root beer floats at once and we finished all of them! We left happy. Would come here again.

Favorite place to go for burgers! Endless baskets of fries and burgers that are fresh off the grill,  Mmm Mmm Mmm! The customer service is very good here and my order is usually always out in a decent time.  Only thing I give a THUMBS DOWN on is that I have to pay extra for my Thai Chilli sauce now!! Not happy about this at all.

They get two stars based on their delicious food, minus the fruit which is clearly frozen and thawed out (not fresh). One star only for the one server we had who was great, he was attentive, nice, did everything right but that's where it ends. I went on a Sunday and the place was so dirty, there was papers and food all over the floor, even where new guests were being sat, they didn't bother to even sweep before sitting new people to the tables. The bathrooms were gross, especially the changing table, I had to use paper towels to line it so my daughter wouldn't get dirty, it had used and dirty Napkins in it and was just filthy, as if they never even once cleaned it. The hostesses were now welcoming and just sat you down, don't bother to make eye contact or talk to you. I'm not sure if I'll return yet, maybe for just to go orders.

yes, I knew that it would be a long wait on a Friday night, but ... 50 minutes to get to the table, and another hour before the food was brought to the table. when they brought the food, my burger came out lonely, on a big plate with no fries. the server promised the fries would be out soon. meanwhile, my gluten-free bun was as hard as a football. it took another 10 minutes to get the server back to the table, and she did finally swap the stale hard bun for a soft, freshly steamed one. as soon as it cooled, it was hard and leathery like the first. so I just took off the top and ate it open faced - all the time with no fries. server kept apologizing and promising they'd arrive soon. finally regular fries arrived, when I'd ordered sweet potato fries. the served acted like I'd changed my mind or something, instead of admitting she messed up. when the fries finally arrived, we had finished every thing on the table. :( this was a very uncool visit to the Red Robin :(

Our favorite place for the whole family to get our Steak fries satisfaction! The custom gourmet burgers are delicious! You should bring your appetite but be prepared to starve since service is quite slow. Tip: ask for the bottomless fries right away.
Food was good... But service was extremely SLOW, almost an hour before our order came up.

Good burgers, nice selection of beer, and - most importantly - kid friendly. Look, this isn't a fancy, foodie restaurant. But, you don't go here for the gourmet. YUou go here for consistent, tasty, not fast-food burgers. It's loud inside, which works for me because I don't have to keep telling my kids to lower their voices. My husband loves that he can keep an eye on the game score. Basically, it's a great spot for your weekly family dinners.
My food was good.  They service was slow. I asked for a side of ranch it and my serve was not seen again. Nor was a refill on my drink.
Service is not the typical Red Robin quality. Looks like they're having management problems. Serious ones.

I have frequented this location and I must say last Thursday evening was a very pleasant experience.  My family and I all have food allergies and going out to eat can sometimes be a burden on the wait staff, but not for Bruno. He was very helpful and went out of his way to make sure we had the information we needed. He is one for the newer staff, I gather from what was presented to us, but was not bothered by all our requests and questions. He grabbed the ipad with the new app that listed the menu breakdown. He did everything he needed to do make sure we were given the correct information. Thank you Bruno, great job

Don't waste your time or money.  There is no management at this place and it is a zoo.  We waited 20 minutes for water and another 30 to get our food.  My burger was supposed to be "a little pink" and it was well done to burned.  Nobody every came back to check on us so I didn't even have a chance to send it back.  We waited in the lobby for a table for 20 minutes to begin with and there were several empty, dirty tables sitting there waiting to be cleaned.  You could drive to In N Out by the airport or Oakridge and get a better hamburger, eat it and be back to Saratoga before you get your food at Red Robin.  Go down the parking lot to Mimi's, they have a fabulous hamburger and good service.

Red Robin.... yummmmmm! bottomless steak fries, freckled lemonade, and burgers! what isn't there to like?!?! I do like how they have gluten free buns available so I can actually enjoy a burger vs. only have the patty and lettuce at most burger joints.  Make the most out of it and sign up for the rewards program ;) They also use NoshList which adds you to a waitlist so you can see the time you've waited to be seated and you will get a text when your table is ready.  I wish all places had this available!

I love this place... and everyone I know loves this place. The burgers are the best and I always get the Bleu Ribbon with a turkey patty.  This is my 1st pick for my Mothers Day meal and my kids are more than happy with this choice.

Service is just dreadful! They hide behind the fact that all staff are students but if they are they definitely failing all their classes. Common sense lacks at this red robin. I gave them chance after chance because my kids love the food and its close to where we live. I rather pay and enjoy time with my family instead of eat free and leave mad because of the horrible experience.  Management changes too often at this place, waiters have no training or experience, you will wait all night for your food and when it comes it will be wrong so you will never sit down with your family and everyone begins to eat at the same time.  The last 5 times (months in between) I have came here with my family and left mad.  One time waiter came out with one entree like me and my wife was sharing a burger because we ordered the same thing .  Another time we waited a hour for our food and they brought the appetizers with the entrees. Tonight a ignorant bus boy dropped a glass that completely shattered everywhere right by my table and he left without checking on the safety of my kids and my wife who had on sandals. Then he came back with a broom and did a half-ass job cleaning the glass...and he still did not ask if we were ok or apologize.  I understand the accident but not to feel the concerns of my table safety or other tables around the incident was completely ridiculous.  Never in my life will I set another foot inside this poorly managed, long wait for food, dumbass waiters having ass piece of shit establishment.  Don't waste your time unless you want free food in exchange for a horrible experience !!! !!!!

When we came in it was not very crowded but it still took a while before we were seated. It took 25 minutes for us to get our food. I ordered my burger well-done but it came undercooked with a lot of pink.

We were seated outdoors since there was a crazy wait for seating inside.  We ordered the Red Robin burger with egg and bottomless fries.  The service was a bit spotty since it was really crazy but it won't deter me from going back to try other items on the menu.

Our first time at Red Robin "Gormet" Burgers was lackluster, to say the least. For some reason we decided to come back for a second time and, quite honestly, it was worse than the first time but our our return visit the service also lacked. The only good thing about this place was the amazing desert - I think they call it "Mud Pie".  I might go back just for that if I wanted to eat myself sick again on a HUGE slice of chocolate, Oreo, caramel awesomeness.  But, sadly, I most likely will not because the rest of everything else there kinda sucked.

The service was great. The ambiance is pretty chill. MY food was great. There's just one thing. The person I was with found a hair in his burger. When we brought it to our waiters attention, he apologized sincerely and brought it back to the kitchen. In the end the second burger came out great and he finished it without another problem. But something I wasn't satisfied with is that they charged us for the hair burger and the second burger. We ended up paying for both but I'm really upset at how we have to pay for someone else's mistake and a burger with the managers hair in it.  Definitely picking a different chain red robins next time. Last time I was here there was a whole party of adults with their children and they let them run around popping balloons & scaring the other diners. Management did nothing to stop the disturbance and a hostess kept supplying the balloons.

By far the worst dining experience I have ever been apart of. Came in to eat before seeing a movie and what a mistake it was. We get sat for about 10 minutes nobody comes to table until another server said she would start us out while our main server is busy. I work as a server so this is normal. I order my food and begin to wait at this point we still haven't seen or even know who our actual server is. The female that talked to us first came back with drinks which was fine. We notice one server keep passing our table at least five times but never saying anything, not even hello. He comes later on about 25-30 minutes into being the restaurant telling us our food is almost up, I asked for a refill of water. Now here comes the fun part, after getting our food still hasn't got me some water. I asked about 5 times before getting a refill on my water. My friends also had to wait forever to get a refill and when our server came to our table he would even let us get a word in before he would leave. It took me for ever to just get a knife to eat with my salad. We were planning to have drinks before our movie but for how long it was it would have taken another 20 minutes. I've worked in a restaurant and it seems like Nobody trained this kid how to serve. I ended up giving my tip to the female that was even our server. Plus our server decide to give all his attention to the table that just sat 45 minutes after us. I would not come back here and little shock I even pay for the food. Only good thing is the salad and chicken was good to eat. I would have rather gone to Denny's

Maybe the "wood fire grill" got put out, but does it really take 50 minutes to make two burgers? As if the 30 minute wait wasn't long enough. Yeesh. Can't say that the food was spectacular either. When there's a 5 guy's joint so close, one would think other burger places would step up their game. Apparently not the case with Red Robin. Definitely not coming back.

Been to a lot of red robins and this one confuses me more than any of them. I cannot understand why its a 20 min wait to get seated when you can blatantly look in and see a whole section empty. Warranted i can understand if there is not enough staffing, but considering the one in Eastridge or Rivermark will fill the whole place while short staffed i am sure this one can too. Also if i have to flag down a buser to find me a server or to refill my drinks there is something wrong.

Everytime my bestie comes into town we have a reunion at thie Red Robin. I'm surprised to see the comments about how long the waits are for people, then again we usually go around lunch time not dinner. Never a wait more than 10 minutes. We are usually catching up the whole time so if the food service is ever slow I have never noticed. Food is always yummy and the prices are not too high. I will continue to come to this Red Robin. (YUUMMMMMM)

My co-worker today got me lunch from here today. Let's see how that went! First off, allow me to start off with how I always enjoy this place, no matter what the location. My co-worker got us some burgers and fries to go. She came back rather fast so I can say from that, that the service shouldn't have been an issue. As for the food, for take-out, it wasn't half bad! I didn't get as many fries as I would if I ate in. It was still fresh and tasty for take-out. Overall; Not too shabby for take-out, dinig in must be great

3.5 stars for food, 4 stars for service & hospitality. Burgers here are definitely gourmet- flavorful, filling portions and a great variety to choose from. I tried their "sauteed shroom" burger with a vegan patty. Mushrooms on my burger tasted delicious and patty was juicy too. Bun was fresh. Substituted steak fries for sweet potato fries- which were BOMB! We also tried their shakes- banana  and cookie dough- both were delicious. Onions rings are average. I like that Red Robin has tons of choice in their menu. Even if you are not a burger person- you will find something for your tastebuds (sandwiches, wraps, appetizers, shakes, desserts). Also, they have the ability to customize their menu- you can substitute a salad or coleslaw or sweet potato fries for their regular fries (all burgers are served with bottomless fries). If you are a vegetarian you can turn any burger into veggie burger by just substituting it with a vegan patty. They also offer a variety of buns to choose from.  Then why am I holding back one star? I wish my food came out a little more hot than it did (at best my burger was luke warm, with cheese slice just softened but not melted enough; onion rings were also at room temperature). Service here was excellent. Kaylee was our server. She has a good sense of humor and is very attentive. She got our order right and refills were served promptly. She checked on us regularly to ensure a great dinning experience. I would certainly recommend this place especially if you have a large group since seating here is plenty (indoors and outdoors) and wait time is generally limited. Decor is typical of an upscale burger joint and atmosphere is lively. Prices are at par with other gourmet burger joints. All in all, a good dining experience!
Horribly long wait for food 1 hour.  Kitchen apparently backed up, never saw the floor manager.  Sandwich bread soggy, very disappointing.  How they stay in business is a miracle.  Poor managers.

Sat waiting for our food for about 40 mins.  I think they had to go out and slaughter the cow. What was frustrating was while our waiter was nice - he didn't say anything until we pressed him.  Then he shared the kitchen was behind.  Offered fries if our food didn't come soon. He came back and said our ticket was next.  Waited 5 more minutes.  What he SHOULD have done was just given us our stupid fries while we waited.  My daughter had the burger with the free refill fries - it would've been SO EASY to just give us the fries while we waited. But NO.. cheap and stupid. NEVER go there if you are hungry.  burgers are good but so are the burgers at the Counter!  Or Habit, or 5 Guys or Smash Burger, or... get the drift? There's SO MANY other places that are just as good and not as slow. The manager came out to placate the table next to us - NOTHING for us - not even comping a drink or ANYTHING! Am NOT going back to Red Robin again.  Customer service doesn't seem to matter to them.  And as I said - there are MANY other good places to go.  Such a shame but given they've been in business for a long time - you'd think they'd get this figured out!

Three visits over the last year, and all I can say is: Don't bother going out of your way for this one. If you do, don't come hungry, and expect to wait.  The decor is disjunct, the wait is interminable, the food is mediocre, and the bathrooms are smelly. If you sit in a booth by the far wall, there's even a draft coming through the bottom of the window frame.  Our wait time for a table was quoted at 20 minutes, but ended up being closer to 30. Their handy app showed our place on the list. Once seated, however, it was another waiting game. We ordered a mud pie and some drinks to pass the time before our burgers arrived. We waited 10 minutes for the pie/drinks, and then 30 minutes for our burgers. Good thing we weren't starving! Our server Jeff hustled like crazy to serve us, apologizing for the wait, and attentively checking in. His hustle was to no avail, though, as the kitchen seemed to be moving at glacial speed. We could see that the few orders that were partially made sat under heat lamps for several minutes, awaiting last parts/ingredients before runners/servers brought them out. All the employees looked frazzled and exhausted. What a mess.  There were empty two-top tables over by the bar that could have been filled. Large parties often take up many tables and sit for long periods of time. This creates a backup for smaller dining groups. These could have easily been arranged into those bar tables.  I always look forward to the bottomless fries. Today, though, they were soggy and mushy. I didn't even finish the ones on my plate. My tavern double burger came lopsided, with tomatoes arranged on one side of my burger. It was greasy and ooey with cheese, but only served to remind me that Five Guys would have been a similar, cheaper, and faster meal. Tremendously disappointing.

I definitely enjoy the burgers are red robin, but this location isn't the most impressive. Nothing wrong with the staff or environment whatsoever, I just enjoy a little more pep in employees step and general excitement. Trust me I know it's an exhausting job and people suck when ordering food, so again. Really nothing upsetting with this location. Maybe quicker service? Or perhaps not sending everyone on break at once.

I went here with my 2 kids for dinner they said it would be a 30 minute wait but it ended up being 45 minutes. We ordered our appetizers and our drinks but my daughters chocolate milkshake never came. Our main entree came but they messed up on my sons order and it took longer. I come back because I love their fries with campfire sauce for dipping.  I get my burger bunless with a lettuce wrap, because their buns aren't that good.  Shakes are decent. Big fail Red Robin! Went craving there onion rings our server took the order, her name was Charlotte! She placed the order and we never got our onion rings and our food came out after it was sitting on the counter for ten minutes! The manager brought out our food and we basically told him we no longer were going  to be eating there and our service was unacceptable! Charlotte you need to work on your serving skills cause you are not a very good one! I will not be going back anytime soon!

Last time we came I was convinced that I'd never come back!  Today was my sons birthday and this is what he wanted, so we came. So being with the horrible experiences before I didn't expect any better. We where seated... Less than a minute greeted and receiving our drinks! WOW that's a first!  Our server was Juan! He is outstanding! He took our appetizer and food order, brought out appetizers with enough time to enjoy them, without being overwhelmed by our main entree. He also brought the kids food first! Thank god for that! I was impressed!  My husband is very particular about eating and drinking, he needs to drink with his meal! So when he doesn't have to ask for a refill that's a great waiter for him already!  Juan was definitely on top of his refills and napkins! He was just awesome! He definitely bought us back! I hope to be treated to his awesome service again in the near future, with my family! So thank you Juan and RR I hope you guys can afford to keep him!

My friends and I used to come here a lot, but the last 3 times we have been here it's been absolutely terrible.  The wait for food is just ridiculous. 40+ minutes just to get a chicken sandwiches for 3/4 people?  None of the servers we had we attentive or offered anything while we waited. The drinks took forever to get, the refills took even longer.  Hint: when you want the server to bring something extra (like extra barbecue or campfire sauce) tell them BEFORE you get your food. We made the sad mistake of asking when we got our food initially and didn't get what we asked for until we were finished.  The last time we went, our server gave me the wrong food but I decided to eat it anyways because it took 45 minutes to get it and I was starving. We love this restaurant. Great place to bring the whole family. The burgers are great, plus they have a variety of other menu options. We do miss the family-friendly games they used to have in the lobby - We wish they would go back to their original format. The staff is great. Parking can be a challenge at times - so be patient if you come on a Friday night or a weekend.

My wife and I spent two hours at RR at Paseo de Saratoga yesterday evening, It was not a good experience for is, the wait staff, or other guests. All the guests waited forever to get anything. Mostly what we got were apologies and very weak smiles. I never got the food I ordered, and my wife's was cold and inedible. We left hungry.  Sorry, Red Robin. Next time we want an upscale burger, we'll give Smashburger a try.
This place has great sweet potato fries! good burgers and overall staff. they seem nice and come by quickly always friendly and attentive. i love the guacamole burger

We've been long-time customers of this particular Red Robin restaurant, long before it was given a facelift and calling itself a "bistro."  Let me tell you, from one burger lover to another, that it has pretty much gone downhill since then.  While the menu has expanded, offering new things like chili cheese fries and a myriad of dipping sauces, the quality and consistency of the food (particularly takeout) has taken a serious nose dive.  For example, a couple of nights ago my husband and I ordered our usual takeout meal, including chili cheese fries and mac and cheese.  We've ordered these items a dozen times in the past, and let's just say that we have gotten something a little different each time. It all depends on who is in the kitchen and who is packaging the food.   To be fair, there have been times when there has been a lot of love put into our meal, and it has shown through the quality of the burger, the amount of chili put on the fries, and how neatly it was packaged. This time, when we asked for chili cheese fries, we were told that they were "out of chili."  Out of chili??!??!  How can you be out of chili???  The mac and cheese was literally buttered pasta with shredded cheese sprinkled on top.  On TOP, and not mixed into it.  ARE YOU SERIOUS.  Who the hell makes their mac and cheese like that?  Were they banking on the heat of the pasta melting the cheese while it sat in the to go container?  I literally had to throw it in a saucepan and add our own cheese and milk.  Really??!   Also, the packaging of the food was horrendous.  Foil sloppily wrapped around the burger, burger boxes a little smashed with shreds of cheese stuck to it... you get the picture. That reminds me, one time when we dined in the restaurant, we were actually told that they were out of mac and cheese.  What?!?   It's just pasta, cheese, butter, and milk, for Pete's sake.  How often do they stock their kitchen??? Regarding quality of service, we've actually had quite pleasant experiences with all of our servers.  So, that's why I'm being pretty generous and giving two stars instead of one. All in all, when Red Robin is good, it can be really good.  However, when it's bad, it's annoyingly AWFUL.  And, unfortunately, we've experienced more bad than good lately, so we're hesitant to come back for another dine-in or takeout experience.  Just not worth the money.
Good food and good service. Rarely let down and with the redesign there are more unlimited options(fries,  broccoli and sweet potato fries)

What can I say? I come here if I'm in the mood for a burger, but I'm also in the mood to get restaurant-style service. Food here is decent. The burgers taste like burgers, and there's a pretty big variety. The fries here are bottomless, which means you never leave feeling hungry. Personally, I left feeling like I should go for a jog to alleviate some of the calories I just packed in. The wait can be surprisingly long. Sometimes they seem a little understaffed (as in you won't get seated even though there are 3-4 empty tables in the restaurant).

i know red robin isn't the fanciest place in town, but man i love their burgers! this location is the one i visit most often, maybe a few times per year.  their service is the only thing that knocks them down a star (almost 2 stars). it can be pretty bad.  the girls at the front aren't always very welcoming.  but last time i was in, we were seated and just left there for a pretty long time before someone finally came over.  she wrote nothing down.  it would have been fine if she actually had the capacity to remember it all... but she didn't.  so some things didn't get ordered, other things were ordered wrong. food:  burgers. yum.  they cook them perfectly, and it's just the right size.  i go for the basic gourmet cheeseburger.  nothing really gourmet about it, and i'm ok with that.   mayo, pickles, tomato, cheese of choice, and my fav... shredded lettuce.  i think that's what gets me.  i'm not a fan of leaf lettuce on my burger.   oh, and onion rings... delicious.  the bbq dipping sauce is tasty. it's a family place, so you have to expect lots of kids.  but really, it's not obnoxious or anything.  good place for a laid back night.

This place is horrible. I went in on friday at 7-25-14 at 710pm, my wife was asking a simple question to the two younger female hostesses.  They were very rude and both had attitudes so we decided to leave. Quickest three minutes I've ever spent at a restaurant.  The two girls looked 16 one Caucasian blonde and the other maybe Hispanic with brunette ponytail.  No smiles and not even a greeting at the door. Horrible customer service skills and will definitely turn away customers.  Hopefully the owner will see this. We went to smash burgers after and had a much better experience there and the burgers were delicious.

Absolutely horrendous service! Avoid at all costs during dinner time unless you enjoy a minimum of a 2 hour dinner. Servers don't even know what's in the burgers. Asked for the bill multiple times. Mine as well take your cup of water to the bathroom and fill it up with the faucet. Every employee needs to get canned and corporate should consider hiring people who actually want to work. I feel the waiter should have tipped me.

I've come here time and time again but have to admit there have been less than stellar lunches and dinners here.  Today I came here for dinner with my Mom. We waited ten minutes and we're seated at a small booth. Our waitress, Sara, came by shortly to take our order. She was warm, friendly and efficient. I ordered a drink from the bar, the bar was out of Disaronno. Bummer, I get a soda. Two out of our three appetizers get to the table. Sara apologizes, admits that she forgot to put the order in for the third, and races back to the kitchen. When our burgers came, they were all wrong. We didn't want pickle relish and avocado added. We sent them back. Sara came back afterwards with our corrected burgers and third appetizer. While eating my Mom discovered she had no avocado.  We give up on trying anymore. The manager comes by, in addition to Sara, to apologize for getting so many things wrong with our order. When we got the blithely compared our burgers and my drink. Overall, we've definitely had better there. Hopefully management works out the kinks in the kitchen so food is made how the customer wants and brought in a timely manner. Sara was a great waitress. Most of the problems we had weren't because of her.

We arrived tonight, a Saturday, at 8 pm and were quoted a 30-minute wait time.  They called us shortly before the 30 minutes.  Hostess sat us at a table with a dirty seat, and a crayon still on it from the last guests. The waiter came over and asked about drinks.  I said that we definitely want 4 waters.  My husband and kids ordered milkshakes.  He brought only one water for me.  My husband ordered three more waters.  He brought the shakes over and again, my husband ordered three more waters.  He brought half the waters in the freckled lemonade glasses and half in their giant pint-style glasses. He took the order and that was the last we saw of our "server". The food took too long, and was not hot.  We had to ask the food runner to bring some cutlery and napkins.  No one came over to check on us to see if we needed drink refills, fry refills, find out if out food was okay.  Nothing.  I've never seen anything like it.  Also, none of the other staff made eye contact with us.  I was trying to get someone's attention, anyone, to get a drink refill, but no one even looked our way.  Finally, my husband had to get up and ask the hostess to have someone bring us a bill. I think we fell throught the cracks at Red Robin tonight.  All I can think is that our served got phased, or he started the table for another server - I don't know, but something went wrong and we got the short end of the stick. Then, the very casually dressed manager came over, did not identify himself as a manager, and said "It looks like you're all done here, can I get anything else for you?"  We said that we'd like the bill and a soda refill.  He brought the soda refill, apologized that I had to wait more than 15 minutes for a refill, and then said he was going to adjust the check and find out who was responsible for this.  Buddy, we don't care who is responsible, we just want to go home.  It was nice of him to take a random $13.30 amount off the check, but it took another 10 minutes to get out of there.  He dropped the check and said, "I know you want to go, so....." and kind of trailed off.  My husband was reaching into his pocket for his wallet as the manager was saying that, and yet he left the table and never came back.  We finally got the attention of the server who was waiting on a table next to ours and she ran our check.   This location was so good right after they remodelled the place about a year ago.  They were so on it.  The staff was smiling, upbeat, professional, following all the steps of service and they weren't raffling off the dishes when they got to the table, they just put them in front of who ordered them, which was very impressive for a casual family restaurant.  Well, that's all gone out the window now.  After tonight's lack of service and the quality of the food on our two most recent visits, we won't be back.  Next time it'll be Island's, or Five Guys, or SmashBurger, or The Counter, or one of the other MANY burger choices in the area for us.

Warning!!!!! If you ever get sick from eating their food and want to complain,  please take a medical examination ASAP. Because they will treat you like SHIT if you don't have any hard prove! tasty burger and love the steak fries.  they have a fully stocked bar which also creates a palpable and necessary barrier between people not wanting to be surrounded by kids hopped up on mike shakes and soda floats and the parents that have to deal with the sugar rushes.

We love coming to this location but my veggie burger yesterday was horrible. I'm not sure why but it felt soggy like the bread had been exposed to moisture. The Boca patty also seemed under cooked.  What's up with the new menu?  It just confuses people.

We were there last night.  The sever, Ashley, was wonderful however the kitchen timing was horrible!  We waited quite some time for our meal and  when it did arrive, only half of our group was served.  The balance of the order came 10 minutes later!

My family and I have been coming here for 2 yrs and it's consistently been 3 star type of place for us. But today I wish I could put zero stars mainly for customer service.  I came in with my mom for lunch and were seated at the two seater booth all the way at the end of the restaurant by the kitchen. We were waiting for our food to come out and bam! What amazing customer service! We live going here the manager is really accommodating and friendly, the staff are quick and the food is awesome! I have many options to choose from even on weight watchers.
