The place is rather large and can get pretty busy on busy days/nights. There is plenty of parking. This place can't get any better! Definitely check it out! Oh and the onion ring towers are YUMMY!

I don't really have high expectations for a chain restaurant, but if you're gonna choose to eat at Red Robin, this location is the one you wanna  avoid! First of all...parking here is HORRIBLE (thanks to the theatre) and wait times here are HORRIBLE (you can guess why...thanks to the theatre). The bar area here is super tiny, and the restaurant has a very odd, narrow lay out. The main dining room you get a view of the kitchen (which is SUPER loud btw). Putting all that aside, one thing Red Robin does is try to make dinner a good value. They have all sorts of cheap appetizers and most burgers are around $10 with bottomless fries. Quality isn't as good as before, but for the price you're paying, it's not a bad deal! I stick with the Royal Red Robin or Whiskey River BBQ burgers and they are usually done well! They have a bunch of dipping sauces which are good too.  Fair prices on drinks, but they aren't very generous on pours. Well drinks come in taller pint-style glasses, so you end up with a standard serving with 90% mixer. My vodka lemonade was so watered down, I complained to the manager who admitted that she has to order a double. She was nice enough to comp the drinks and give us a free speciality cocktail on the house, but I won't be drinking here anymore...unless it's a beer or something! Overall, it's too much of a hassle! Smashburger is at Westgate Mall, and if I'm hungry and craving a burger in the area, I'd probably go there. However, if you don't mind waiting, Red Robin isn't a bad option! 3.5 stars rounded down!

My family and I came here after we participated in the Luminate 5k run in San Jose.  This location is close to home and we frequent quite a bit.  My kids and I love the menu and how kid friendly it is.  Normally I wouldn't bother with a review except that this was my worst experience in the restaurant.  We got there at about 9pm and it was a 20 min wait.  Not bad for a Saturday night.  The new app allowed us to view our waiting time and how many parties were ahead of us.  When we were seated(about 20 min wait) the hostess gave us the menus right away.  We already had our order ready since we go so often.  Plus the kids were getting antsy since it was past bedtime.  It took about 10 min before our waiter Brandon showed up.  No apologies or intros.  Just "Are you ready to order?"  Yes of course we were!  We've been waiting for 10 min!  We placed our orders and food came out in a timely manner.  Brandon however was not the one to bring out the food nor did he check on us while we were eating.  No drink refills extra napkins nothing!  1 waiter checked on us in passing and a hostess offered placemats and crayons.  That was all the service we received.  He was not on a break because I had plain view of him checking up on his tables across from ours.  When we were all finished eating, I had my credit card ready to pay.  We waited about 20 min before he showed up to ask how we were doing finally.  I gave him the card and told him we were loyalty members which he did not ask.  Worst service we have received here.  I don't have high expectations for chains but we have never had an issue here.  Makes me want to choose another kid friendly restaurant so that i can avoid the server!

My boyfriend and I ate dinner here last night, we we're really excited because Red Robin (in our hometown) is usually delicious. We were seated within 5-10 minutes and ordered an appetizer and drinks while we looked at the menu. The waitress came back multiple times seemingly ever 2 minutes to ask if we were ready to order. It felt as though we were trying to be rushed out, granted it was busy but I don't want to be rushed when I go out to dinner. We ordered our meals and our drinks have yet to come. We ordered a beer and a mixed drink, it had been over 15 minutes. I FINALLY got the attention of the waitress, which was dang near impossible, and asked about our drinks. She apologized and mumbled some excuse as she went to the bar. She comes back a few minutes later and states they were out of the beer we ordered. So it takes 20 minutes to figure that out?! Uhh, no. Regardless we ordered a different kind of beer and received our drinks a few minutes later, which was after we got our dinner, which was both annoying and ridiculous. The fries were cold and the burger was not good. The buns were cold and tasted like they came straight out of a bag, which I'm sure they did, but they should at least warm them up. The BBQ sauce was insanely overwhelming and the crispy onion strings that were on the burger were a soggy flavorless mess. The whole rest of the night we were bother by how disappointing it was, and definitely not worth the $50.  With both the food and customer service being mediocre, at best, we will not be returning to this location.

Super slow service. Waited 28 minutes for two burgers, and they were simple burgers; just burger, lettuce, tomato and bun.  Server didn't let is know if burgers were coming soon or offer us fries to munch on while we waited. He just kept walking by and looking at us.  Burgers were good but the service may prevent me from returning. This isn't the first time I've encountered such sloooooow service. At least, the last server was more attentive.

I am totally upset by the service we received tonight. After a two hour water polo game a few of us decided to take the players out to eat. These girls were hungry and ready to enjoy some greatly earned burgers. We were sat rather quickly, then nothing for 15 minutes .  it took us having to get up and ask for someone to take our drink order. At that point the server rushed over and stated he was ready. We then set a timer 35 more minutes to get our food no appetizers.  When the server dropped our food he couldn't even bring it all at once. When checking back his words were " everything ok,  good" and walked away. No time to responed or even ask for a refill on drinks. Would I go back. No

"Doggie entitlement mentality" runs rampant around here.  We realize that.  California realizes it too, so this summer the governor signed a law that allows pet owners to bring their pets along to a restaurant as long as they remain on the patio.  It is still illegal to bring any animal inside a restaurant, unless it is a service animal. So imagine our surprise and dismay when we went to this Red Robin location a couple of nights ago and were seated in the dining room, only to discover that a woman at the table next to us had her smallish (Pomeranian?) dog under the table.  She had even put two little dishes (one filled with dog food and one with water) on the floor under the table, so this little prince (or princess?) could have its meal, too, though this did not stop the little creature from continually begging for scraps (which were occasionally given...yuck), nor from stepping in its water dish a few times as it wandered around beneath the table.  This was clearly a pampered family pet, not any kind of service animal.  WHAT was it doing in a restaurant? I should mention that the outside temperature that evening was very mild.  It would have been entirely comfortable for this lady and her doggie to sit on the patio and LEGALLY enjoy their meal.  It would even have been perfectly fine for her to leave her precious pet in the car for an hour or so...it was NOT hot and would not have posed any danger to the animal. Allowing people to bring their pets into a restaurant is just irresponsible and cowardly behavior by the restaurant's team and management.  I realize that people in this area can get pretty worked up if they are told that their precious pets cannot go everywhere and do everything that humans do...but that's just tough.  Managers can and should stand up to them and uphold the law for the benefit, health, and enjoyment of the other restaurant guests!  If a guest really believes that their dog should be treated like family, then they should either eat on the patio where their pets are legally allowed, or stay home and eat at the family (and dog) table! A disappointing and gross experience.  We expected better from Red Robin.

Arrived here on a Saturday evening, 5: 30pm. Given that it is a busy weekend night, we expected for a wait time before being seated. We had to wait 1/2 hr to be seated. Once we were seated, our waitress greeted us. She was very nice and accommodating. We all (3 of us) ordered shakes before we ordered our meals. Water came right away but the shakes took about 20minutes. At this time, we each ordered out meals. The food took about 40 minutes to come! The waitress knew we were waiting long and was nice enough to give us some fries to snack on while we waited. My fiancé ordered another beer shake with an extra shot. When this came he said he was still not able to taste the alcohol. Word of advice: order drinks at the bar directly to make sure you get what you pay for. Alone, he spent $18 on drinks and they were watered down and not mixed well. In addition, there was a charity event going on ( sheriffs raising $ for special Olympics), and they would go to every table and ask for money. It was really uncomfortable and I would see them scout families. To make a long story short, waitress good- food alright, alcohol drinks boo, and the harassment at tables was annoying!

If you don't want to wait in line to go eat here then you better know what you want to order, give them a call to order for a pick up, kill time for about 30 minutes somewhere or at home, pick up your food, go home and enjoy your food. Parking does suck here because of the movie theater. Wait times vary since there were times when my party and I were seated in 10 minutes and there were times it was 45 minutes to 1 hour. Just be smart about your dining decisions when it comes to Friday-weekends. It's better to just call to order for pick up than waiting more than 45 minutes :) Their bar area is a bit too small but Brianna is such a champ when it comes to super busy times at this place because she doesn't like one of those irritated bartender/bar area server. Love their Whiskey River BBQ burgers and bottomless fries though! Oh, milkshake too!

Update: for whatever reason I gave this place another shot and have been back a few times since. Greatly improved experience! Staff much more attentive and a more relaxed feel. Maybe the time of day I went? Change in management? IDK, but whatever it Is keep it up.

Don't even know why I gave this location another shot. The first time (about 2 months ago) service was mind numbingly slow and my food arrived cold. Not a good experience, at all. This time was even more frustrating. We didn't get seated with any type of smile or graciousness. Then it took once again waiting, waiting, and more waiting to get drinks and orders taken. I look around and oh, the hostess is chatting loudly at her front desk and over at the kitchen all the servers are talking and laughing loudly with each other....in fact both areas were having louder conversations than the actual patrons it seemed. Me and my guest sat looking pretty upset and got no acknowledgement or apology. I can understand a wait when it's busy, but at this time there was, maybe, five occupied tables? No excuse for the plain disregard for customers. I also went to the restroom and it was disgustingly dirty and zero empty tables had been bussed or cleaned and had used plates and empty cups. Overall, it was a week night and it was evident there are a bunch of kids working here who could care less about giving any type of customer service or keeping a clean and presentable restaurant environment. Waste of money and time.  Never, ever, EVER again...
My server had amnesia I swear. Much of our order was forgotten, and on the second round after asking for correction the same happened. Food was decent, not as good as I have had at other locations.

location: West San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: I love coming to this place!  Great service! Fair prices! Great food! Family friendly!  Ask for Annette's section, by far the best waitress in the world! Every visit we ask for her,  she's awesome!  And there's a bar! With TV's
This place is alright- typical burger place with some good beers and french fries. Just mad that they never get my burger order right! How hard is it to not keep the pickles off...... :(

Service quality WAY WAY down. Came here 6 weeks ago and ordered a kids Mac and cheese, 2 burgers, a beer and a lemonade. Wait time for our drinks alone 20 mins or longer. Wait time for our food (including the kids meal) over 50 mins after we ordered. Other tables that were seated after us, ordered after us, cleaned up their plate, paid their bills AND left the premises before our food arrived. I complained to the manager and they comped our meal. Tonight I decided to give them another try. If you call waiting for your food for 45 mins an improvement then please feel free to eat at this place. For me, I rather drive the 15 mins to visit another burger place.

I come here for two reasons.   First, endless fries.  And second,  I want to be punished with the absolute worst service possible.  There's a reason there's usually a long wait.  It's because their wait staff keeps effing up.  Want to know where Denny's and IHOP recruits?  Right here.  But I don't fault the wait staff entirely.   Management is just as much to blame for poor training.  Getting comps for messing up is growing old.

Went to dinner with my wife and kids today I was a little reluctant after reading the reviews about their service . Didn't know what to order and our waitress Kristen suggested the banzai burger and the endless fries. It was outstanding. And the fries kept coming. Its not often when I have a waitress that is so nice and sweet. Thank you Kristen for making our dining experience so enjoyable!!! Will be back again for sure.

We love Red Robin.  We used to visit this location a lot when it first opened, and it was well worth the visit every time.  Banzai Burger.  Need I say more? But since the latest remodel, unless we just had a string of bad luck in our visits,  either the management has changed or something fundamental shifted but this is a place that needs serious help.  Service quality is seriously diminished.  Certainly there are some good people working there, but errors in orders and long waits for food shouldn't be the norm.  Food quality and presentation has also slipped.  It isn't the same experience at all. We keep telling ourselves we'll never go back, but tonight, after watching a movie at the AMC, we decided to give it another chance for dessert, and arrived to no hostess at the front station at all (waited for five minutes and even asked staff if anyone was available to no avail).  We had to leave knowing we would be stuck in there for a VERY long time.  The only folks waiting aside from us was a family who walked out with us complaining they had sat there for 30 minutes looking at a number of empty tables filled with uncleared dishes that were not being tended to. The place was a mess.    Red Robin is a repeatable concept.  It is a successful franchise. It has an established system that should be easy for any conscious manager to sustain.  I have no idea why this place has tanked, but it needs to wake up and get the fix it needs.  We'll come back when it decides to be a restaurant that cares about its customers again.

I pass by Red Robin quite often and I finally decided to go and check it out tonight. When there is a wait, they have a system that sends you a text when your table is ready and also allows you to see how many people are in front of you all from your own smartphone. The system was very helpful and interesting and made my experience start out on a positive note. On to the food! We ordered a bowl of clam chowder, fish and chips, and a bacon burger. The food was very good, but did take a little too long to come out.  Clam chowder 4/5: came out quickly, was almost lukewarm, but tasted very good and had a lot of clams  Fish and Chips 4/5: took a little too long to come out, but was very moist and seasoned nicely Bacon burger 5/5: again took a little too long to come out, but was a very tasty and moist burger (definitely worth the wait), came with decent fries Overall, my first time at Red Robin was better than average. We only had to wait 2-3 minutes until we were seated and our friendly waitress came and checked on us quite often. From the other reviews I read, it is true that many tables are left uncleaned for quite some time and is one of the reasons that there are long lines outside, so come earlier to prevent the wait! I would definitely come back for another one of those amazing bacon burgers!

What a crappy place! Went with my daughter last Sunday to taste "some of the best tasting burgers", as I remember them back from about 10 years ago. Waitress brought the coffee, without the spoon or sugar.  15 minutes later brought the spoon - the coffee already got cold. Brought a new cup - tastes like CRAP! This is NOT a coffee, people! Ordered soup and a burger. Waited for 25 minutes...  She then brings the burger only. She "just forgot about the soup". After complaining, manager brought the soup and tells me "we will remove it off your bill". Burgers taste just ok. Nothing special. In'n'out have tastier burgers now. Tortilla soup - absolutely tasteless. Waste of money. Waste of time. Waitress brings the bill, the soup is still on the bill.  Decided to leave a feedback about the experience on Red Robin's "Guest Support" page ( ) - it's just blank!  I guess the management of this place doesn't care about their "Guests" altogether, regardless of the branch... Sad.

Not impressed. Last time I was here was great. But this trip we had two people in our group whose food came out wrong. One had a raw hamburger. Not rare but raw when I was ordered well done. The replacement burger took at least another 20 minutes. Just awkward.  Not sure if I'll be back. I'll try other places first. Food was ok once it was cooked properly but service needs a lot of help.

2 star because of service. I loved Red Robin. I used to visit often in the past because the service, presentation and taste of the food were beyond my expectations. I'm not quite sure what happened recently, but every time I've come here, there is such a long wait for any of our food orders (at least 30min). It's saddening that my experience here is not the same any more. I'm sorry Red Robin! I'll try again sometime.

Piss poor management of the restaurant. Drinks took forever to come out, basic request of sauces, forks, and napkins took forever to come out as well. My first experience here was phenomenal. Our server Ali was quick and prompt. He deserves a gold medal award. However, on our next dining session, it took a complete 180 degree turn. It was almost as if they were purposely trying to do bad, hoping they would get enough media attention from Gordon Ramsay to have a "Kitchen Nightmare" transformation. I was so irritated by the drink orders that I went to go take a look at the bar. The ONE bartender had about 20 slips/drink orders coming out of the machine!! What is going on with this place?? UNTIL THEN!! ^-^

Slowest red robin I have ever been to. Took an hour and a half to get seated, and then another 30 minutes before we ordered. Granted it is a crowded area, but still hire some more workers so the manager can sit in the back and not be running around waiting tables. Our waiter was super nice, just feel bad for the guy.

Worst service I've encountered in a long time. Tables seated after us were served and received food before us, and our food came out in 2 waves spaced far apart. The first half of group basically finished eating before the second half got their food. To top things off, water took 20 minutes to come even asking multiple times.

I see a lot of low star reviews were for bad service, but I didn't think it was that bad Delicious Burgers! Bottomless Fries!  One of, if not the best, gourmet burger places in the south bay. Location is convenient, seating is plentiful and spacious. There's outdoor seating for days you want to enjoy the cool crisp fresh air of the south bay. The service decent, though you may need to ask for refills every now and then. I got the guac burger, which was absolutely melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Their fries are also really crisp and fresh and I like how they come as wedges. I will definitely be coming back here again when I feel like getting a burger.

I was here on two occasions in the last 3 weeks; once for dinner and once for lunch. I am not sure if they are understaffed but service was reallllyyy slow. We had to wait for a really long time for the food to get to the table; we had to wait for water for 10 mins too phew. The taste of the food was not that good either. We ordered garlic fries and they tasted just like regular fries; when we mentioned that to the server, she just smiled and said, 'oh yes that is right, the recipe for garlic fries has just changed'. So that means you pay for garlic fries and get regular fries??? I have had better experience at the Rivermark location. I am definitely going to that location from next time onwards.

Why do any of you blame this Red Robin for parking issues?  They have no control over that.  Also, many of you complain about not being served promptly or not getting refills on your drinks or fries rapidly.  Every time I have been here there has been no problem with the service.

The first time we went we had Very bad service !! The manager of the day was awful he didn't apologize for the service . My husband's food was late. & one of the employees was arguing with the MOD !    The second time we went again our food was late but at least the manager of the day was much nicer & gave us a discount.  I love there onion rings that's why we go there , but after this second time no way !!

Took a while to place both orders.  We had 3 different waiters... the appetizer was wrong then replaced.  When I got the fried zuccini I wasn't happy with them.  I told the manager who wasn't friendly and didn't smile.  She asked to touch them to check them and took them off the bill.  Then I got my prime rib sandwhich and it was bland.  No one cleared our table or refilled our drinks.  Out of our 3 waiters there was only one that smiled. Yummy french fries though!!
We ordered 2 burgers one was spicy and the other one a simple burger.  At the end we concluded that the simple one was better.  In general good food.

There seems to be a difference between restaurants up here and restaurants in San Diego. Service was slow, parts of the order were missing and the burger was just meh. Which is weird, considering I love Red Robin. The server was nice but there really shouldn't be a 10 min wait just to get started with water. The smoke and pepper burger was basically a regular looking burger with pepper sprinkled over bacon. Tasted alright. Nothing special. Still love the bottomless fries and freckled lemonade though.

My son picked Red Robins to come to eat for his birthday.  We were seated quickly and Brandon was our server. Brandon was on top of everything, our drinks were ALWAYS filled. Would definitely look for him the next time we come on. Thanks Brandon you were great!!!

My family had gone to Red Robin on Thursday, January 22nd and Sunday, January 25th. The experience was almost like night and day.  Both times I had called ahead to put my name down because I had the Red Robin Royalty Card.  Let me start with Thursday, January 22. We got to the restaurant, checked in, and immediately got seated. We got a few bad stares because their were people waiting, it looked like I just walked in, and got seated right away. Service was great and quick. I ordered the Fish and Chips, and it was done well (crispy). Our waiter was very attentive, and making sure everything was fine.  We went again with my family and friends on Sunday, January 25th, and once again called ahead of time using my Red Robin Royalty Card. We waited a little bit, but we were seated pretty fast. Now service was way slower. It took like 15 minutes to get our drinks, and when we ordered our food it took almost an 1 hour to get. I ordered the Fish and Cod, and it was "soggy". I didn't want to send it back because I didn't know how long it was going to take, since we already waited an hour to eat. My mom ordered the same thing, and her's was just as soggy as mine. They messed up on my friend's order, and had to send it back. I know it wasn't just our table because the table next to us sent their food back several times due to mistakes. My dad ordered beer also, it took ordering it 3 times to finally get it, and drink refills also took a long time also. I've been to this Red Robin several times, and never see service this bad. I'm still a fan, but not sure what happened the night of Sunday, January 25th.
Bartender Cristal was very helpful and friendly. Burger was cooked as ordered and the fries were heavenly. Too bad the fries aren't on my NY resolution diet!

Service was good. Our server saw that I was removing the tomatoes from my salad and gave me a second salad without tomatoes. The food was okay. However, I found a sticker in my side order of broccoli.
Very poor service and cold food makes for a waste of money and never a return trip. Good chain but NO one is paying Attention at this location.

My husband and I finally got some time to go in a date night, we don't usually get to go out!!!  It sucked,  we ended up leaving.  We are really patient people, and we have been to this location a few times before, with no problems. We ordered our food and drinks at the same time-- I a diet coke and my husband an ice tea, drinks came back wrong, should have been an inclination of the future. We waited for our food for almost an hour, without the waiter coming to check on us or to tell us the food is still being cooked.  The waiter took a larger party's order, was very attentive to their party, even brought out their appetizers!  (This party was seated about a half hour after we ordered our food). My husband ordered his burger medium well done, so they did not have to wait for the burger to be fully cooked.  The one star is for the service, not the food.  We didn't get a chance to taste our food this time around.  The waiter could have come by to explain they are busy or food is almost ready, he didn't.  We left without him noticing, we did get a thank you on the way out by the hostess.   We ended up going to Carl's Jr.  The Carl's Jr. On Saratoga, where there is one lady taking the order, and making the food-- we got our order in 5 minutes, with a hello and a goodbye. AND a thank you.  IDK if I want to go back to this Red Robin location. Might just have to haul my cookies all the way over to the east side, next time I'm able to go on a date w my hubby.  So sad.

Our visit was 2/9 at about 7:45pm First off I want to start by saying this review is based off of the staff around me not my server, our server Alexa was very attentive and very respectful. Alexa gets a 5 star for the great service despite the other staffs behavior.  The first this that really shocked me and really gave me a sour taste in my mouth was Pricilla The hostess was walking with Amanda a Server and stopped next to us against the shelf where the lego Burger and fries are and Amanda whispered something to Pricilla and then Pricilla responds with a very loud, "Oh heeeeellllllllll no, I'm not f***ing doing that" and it really blew me away when I heard that come out of her mouth. Later right before we were leaving Pricilla became a puppy dog to Amanda just to keep talking to her and laughing.  Pricilla also was so stuck talking to the busser (who was clearly doing his job) and she was touching him and pointing at him with a pen and was going on for a good 3 minutes, while a couple is standing at the front waiting to be seated. The manager Nicole who I guess has only been a manager for a short period of time, which is no excuse. Nicole seats them and on her way walking to seat them gave Pricilla very dirty look, which shouldn't be happening at all.  Nicole the manager started off too friendly with her employees and then as the night went on she became increasingly rude with her staff, making rude smart remarks with very rude facial expressions, and while expediting the food she was being really rude to the kitchen manager clearly yelling and being very repetitive, which I can clearly hear everything she's saying and can see all of her facial expressions. I'm sorry but in my 5 years of coming here I have never had such a bad experience with staff.  Thank you Alexa for the great service and not falling into the carelessness of the other staff.
Great place for a vegetarian like myself to get a veggie burger. Friendly staff and fast service!

Josh our server was attentive and courteous. We came for our daughters 11 birthday and he made our experience a good one. My husband and I came on another occasion and I ended up giving this place a really bad yelp review. Josh gets 5 stars, only down fall is the 45 minute average wait.

I'm not going to cook dinner today! This nurse nerd proclamation resulted in mini me and the hubby deciding that it's burger time .... So Red Robin is their choice tonight. Well, I must admit that I wasn't really in the mood for burgers... but hey at least they serve alcohol! Yes, it has been one of THOSE days!! So, we are promptly seated and our server appears relatively quickly. Great! We have the spinach & artichoke dip to start. Can I say super yummy! It was perfectly bubbly and warm with just the right amount of greenery. The chips, on the other hand were quite greasy, so I stuck with the celery sticks (hmmm.. Who serves celery with spinach & artichoke dip anyway?). Well, I guess RR does?!? Oh yeah, I must not forget the hubby's potato chowder ( still searching for clams and flavor). Well, atleast it looked pretty! Next are the burgers which were all good. No complaints from mini me ( DGB burger) or the hubby (BBQ burger), I had the chicken breast burger - sans bun. Note: I didn't mention fries, because they were cold and old! Minus a star! ( who the heck wants cold fries? Hmmm...Old & Cold Bottomless =fewer repeat requests). Lastly... My drink. Ok so I love martinis and the holiday special was a Kettle One cranberry concoction! Score....or so I thought. Ummm... Where was my Kettle??? Not in my drink! Minus a star because weak drinks= pissed nurse nerd!  So, dinner was just ok. My buzz was nonexistent and it's still raining!

I WILL NEVER VISIT THIS LOCATION EVER AGAIN!!! Came to this location awhile back with the boyfriend for date night. There was a 30 min wait so we decided to go to the bar section for a drink before dinner. Bartender was talkin to his coworker and didn't bother looking at us til couple mins later. Bartender didn't know how to make me an amaretto sour or Midori sour because it "wasn't in his drink book." I settled for a rum&coke while it took him a couple tries to remember what my bf ordered (corona beer). There was seating around the bar tables but we finally got seated 40 mins later.  By then I was starving so I told the bf to hurry up and order. The server took forever jus to get us water because he saw we already had drinks. I saw a TON of plates just sitting under the heat lamp with no servers in sight. The servers I did see just glanced and walked past the plates stacking up. I looked around at all the irritated customers, the table next to us even told us they've been waiting for an HOUR and still haven't gotten their food. When they finally got their food, they told me and my bf how cold and disgusting it was. After a talk wit the manager they sent their food back and eventually left without finishing their meal. I was soooo hungry, and the food took SOOOOO LONG I wasn't hungry anymore. You ever get that feeling?  Sadly, because the bf was so hungry he ate his burger. Even though I had been starving, the cold bread and lukewarm fries disappointed me. They even ran out of boxes...  I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS LOCATION!
Food is always wonderful but service is slow & prices have jumped by $3-$5 per entray.
My son and husband love this place. Good selection of burgers. Love their fries. All around good place for a family dinner night with a young child. My favorite burger is the burnin love

location: West San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: NEVER COMING BACK! Ugh worst service ever! Came here on 2/26 with my boyfriend and I have never experienced Red Robin this way. We have been coming here for years and occasionally we've had to wait longer than usual, but the food was always decent. Tonight, we got there at 6:40 and were told it was a 20 minute wait. Not bad, so we waited. We were finally seated at 7:05. It took about 5 minutes for the waitress to come and greet us and take our drink orders. We ordered our appetizer and our food at the same time. The appetizer came out really quick. We finished that and then the waiting began...we waited. And waited. Until I finally asked the waitress about our food. Meanwhile, I had seen my salad sitting on the line for about 15 to 20 minutes. She brings my salad out, the chicken was cold. The waitress tells us that the burger was just being put together now. They hadn't even fired it!!! The burger finally came out about 8pm and it was raw inside!!! The cheese wasn't melted, and the fries were soggy!!! I couldn't believe it. We asked for a manager immediately. She came out, offered to cook the hamburger herself and get me a fresh salad. Guess what? The burger was STILL raw! The manager was apologetic, but kept touching my boyfriend on the arm, inappropriate if you ask me. I ate a bit of my salad, but we were so turned off, we left without paying.  Needless to say, we will NEVER go back. How can a hamburger place fail so miserably and not be able to cook a damn hamburger properly!?! And by the way, the habits of the staff while pulling food from the line, is disgusting. They will touch your food, fondle your fries and be sure to touch the hamburger buns after touching everything. So gross. We saw it all tonight.
It took a very long time just to get our drinks. The wait for our food was beyond ridiculous. Food was mediocre. Do NOT get the French onion soup. The cheese is like plastic.

Food was alright, nothing to special I've tried it all, the menu didn't seem to impress me! What I didn't like is the fact the tables don't have napkins, you have to ask for them! What kind of shit is that! Don't recommend this for a date night! Go to in n out instead !

Looks like extremely long wait times, and bad service is a common theme at this particular Red Robin. 'Kristen K' was "supposedly"(this word was NOT chosen loosely) our server. Aside from irrefutably not wanting to be anywhere near this establishment, it simply should not take 40 minutes to whip up a side salad(yes a side salad). With there being multiple locations within a 15 mile radius, we will definitely not be back.

This place is HORRIBLE!! Me and my family have been comming to this location for years and the service used to be amazing! We loved it but then a couple months ago management changed. Ever since, every single time we come here, we have had a horrible experience! When we get here it takes about 20 min to get our drinks, another 30 to get our food. Once we get the food the FRIES ARE ALWAYS COLD!! Never have we gotten fresh hot food here. AND they always screw up the order and give us something wrong. We always end up speaking to the manager which kindly takes off items from our bill sometimes. Honestly we love the food here so we keep comming back but yall NEED to do something about the service because it has gone downhill so fast.

The food was okay. When we got here, we noticed a wait. We asked to sit in the bar area because generally service is usually the same as the service you get when sitting in the regular area. We came in around 7:15. It took about 20 minutes for our table to be cleared from the previous people and another 10 minutes to even get our order taken. We asked for fries to go with our drinks which we never received. Subpar service. I wish I would have read the Yelp reviews prior to coming here. Very disappointing.

HORRIBLE experience. We received a text message saying our was 35 minutes. After waiting for 70 minutes we finally got seated. The waiter came over and said he "would be with us shortly". It took 30 minutes to get our drinks. Total time we were there was 2 1/2 hours. Not acceptable!!!

Always been a fan of Red Robin. The Royal burger with the fried egg on it is the best, however I wish they would bring back the Godfather burger! And no visit is complete without getting a side of poppy seed honey mustard for your fries! Its like liquid crack!

Arrived at 5 pm and sat at the bar for a drink while waiting for friends. Bartender completely slammed with to go orders, making ice cream sundaes, milk shakes, everything but liquor drinks. No one helping him. Really? He made me a Bloody Mary 20 mins later which was sweet? Let me say that only one other person was sitting at the bar and restaurant only one third full. When my friends arrived, we sat at a table. Service was good, food mediocre. Crab burger ok. Bacon cheese burger meh. Bottomless fries were not refilled . Management seems to be nonexistent at this location . Maybe we just hit them at an odd hour or maybe hard earned money can be spent elsewhere

I went here last Friday night for dinner and had a absolutely horrific experience. First of all the hostess told me that it was a 15 minute wait for a part of two. 40 minutes later my sister and I were finally seated.  Then it once we ordered, it was another hour wait for our burgers. When I finally received my guacamole burger I was devastated when there was the tiniest smear of guacamole on my burger. I couldn't even taste the guacamole or even see it on my burger. Consequently my burger had no flavor.  When I asked for a refill in my bottomless fries it took another half hour to refill them. What is the point of saying bottomless fries if they are going to take forever. I was still waiting for my fries when everyone had finished their food. Finally my fries came and they were okay.  Before I even left the restaurant I had to run to the bathroom. I had gotten good poisoning! I don't have other digestive issues so I know that it was because of the food I had just eaten.  Finally after two hours of mostly waiting and paying to be being poisoned I will not be back to Red Robin ever again. I can cook better burgers at home in a half hour for half the price that won't make me sick. This place was a waste of my time and my money, and made me very sick.

Can never go wrong with a trip to red robin.  We sat at the bar because the restaurant was pretty packed (dinner time on a Saturday) but were promptly attended to.  Ordered the cod burger and a cup of french onion soup.  The food came out super quick and was amazing as always.  The cod was battered and crispy with a tasty slaw and tarter sauce.  The onion soup had the perfect amount of broth/onion/bread/cheese ratio, but was a little over salted.  Great dinner regardless!

Came here with my friend and my girlfriend this place is terrible. First, we had a ton of people pass by us as we sat in the front (even the host passed by us a couple times before stopping to seat us). Then we sat at our table for a little over 5 minutes before being greeted by our server. Then when we finally got our food which took longer than it should have, we all got wrong items. I ordered my burger  with peper jack cheese and received provolone cheese. My friend ordered garlic fries and receiver sweet potato fries. I order Mac and cheese and had to wait another 5 minutes just for my Mac and cheese which should have came with my burger, and it came out ice cold in the middle and only luke warm around the edges. And my girlfriends drink was super watered down and when she said something to the server he said that he realized the color wasn't right so he tried another machine but it looked the same. So my question is why would you bring someone a drink if you noticed that it didn't look right? I will not be returning to this location.

Warning!  Don't go to this restaurant after 9pm at night because the cooks have checked out and don't want to make anything.  The rest of the staff is standing around or chatting in a corner.   This is the second time this has happened to me and I should have learned the first time.  It won't be happening again!  We ordered burgers with sweet potato fries.  We also ordered appetizers before the meal and I specifically told our waitress that I wanted them first.  Everything came out together and the fries were burnt.  The bun was all soggy also.  I was surprised she even brought those fries out.  We told her they were burnt and we wouldn't eat them and asked for some fresh ones.  I saw her go and talk to the cook and he says there will be a long wait for them because now he has to make more.  I also had to ask someone in the front for some sugar because our waitress took our order and didn't come back till she brought our meal.  And we had to ask for napkins and silverware too.  I did ask to speak to a manager and told her that the cook had an attitude and she should talk to him.  I didn't blame the waitress because she was taking care of too many tables by herself.  I blame management.  There are many burger places and I won't be back!

Really disappointed with the service we received last night.  My sister and I took our Mom out to dinner...we arrived around 5:15PM and were seated...our waiter came by and took our order and brought our drinks...that was about the last time we had any contact with him....We waited and waited for our salads...yep that was all we ordered...it took at least 45 minutes...once our waiter rushed by and said your food will be up soon...15 min later we asked the hostess who happened to be walking by...can you find out what happen to our meals...she wasn't very nice...but said she would check with her manager...she came rushing by and said your food will be up soon..hmmm...we had heard that before.  Eventually, another server came by with our meals and while trying to balance everything on a tray shouted out the different items and handed them to us!  The only other time we saw our waiter was when he came by to give us the bill and a half hearted apology for it taking so long....We had ordered a meal to go for our Dad who was at home...but this guy didn't remember and we didn't remind him because we didn't want to wait another hour...Yep think I will pass on this place!

***FOOD POISONING!!!!!!**** Wanted to like this place, but nope. Just no. We were sat in what presumably is the armpit of the restaurant, there was so much yelling. Not the type I had expected at this restaurant as it wasn't loud patrons, but hostesses and wait staff yelling at each other.  Our waiter had an ok attitude, but the attention span of a goldfish. Our appetizers were delivered and we proceeded to have to ask twice for plates, utensils and napkins. Ummm, really? Then we were dive bombed the entire stay by little gnats swarming around. We thought they were coming from the door being open, hind sight says we probably should have taken that as a sign and left. We couldn't find our waiter for a large portion of dinner. Then as if to add insult to injury, got to witness a FANTASTIC waitress one section over run literal circles around everyone. Seriously, she delivered food to her tables and hustled and helped deliver for others. But alas, we were the Oliver Twist of this story.  We aren't planning on ever returning anyways, then at 2 am this morning my nine year old wakes up with food poisoning. After reading through other yelp reviews, it's kinda common here. That's it for me. I'm reporting this restaurant to the department of public health. There's a reason people get sick at restaurants and I've seen enough horrifying episodes if kitchen nightmares to be properly horrified at this place.

So, I gave them the benefit of the doubt and after the bad review, I was given a $20 gift card with their apologies for my horrible experience. Which I am very thankful for their genuine concern. Take two....went with my two daughters and got seated right away. Not bad for a Saturday. Our server greeted us and took our drink orders. He came back promptly with our drinks, nice again. He took our order and this is where it gets bad. I ordered two items off the kids menu and an appetizer for myself. 30 minutes go by, I finally get my food and everything is cold. I ordered queso dip and when I got it, the top was like creme brulee. The top was a solid. I complained to management this time and they took care of it, so that was nice. It appeared the kitchen was backed up and everyone's meals were taking too long. I was more upset that nothing was said to me. I understand, things happen, but I was told nothing. I tried...but this is my last time at this Red Robin. Fool me once, shame on you...Fool me twice...U get the rest.

Two words to describe this restaurant - CRAP HOLE!!!!!! This place is AWFUL! The only reason they are getting one star is because our waitress was nice....we actually felt sorry that she had to work in this crap hole of a restaurant! We had to wait 40 minutes for a table. It took ONE HOUR and TEN MINUTES to get our food! I got a salad that was wilted and soggy, I barely ate any of it. One of us got the WRONG HAMBURGER!!!!!! He had to wait an additional 20 minutes to get the right burger and it came with the WRONG type of fries. He ordered garlic fries and got the regular soggy gross fries that they serve there. I am AMAZED that this dump is still I business. Please please please (I'm begging you) don't go to this place. A total waste of time, money and crappy food to boot!!! UPDATE: RED ROBIN CONTACTED ME REGARDING THIS AND GAVE ME A GIFT CARD SO I WILL TRY IT AGAIN AND GIVE ANOTHER REVIEW

Stopped in here to kill some time and have an Ale while waiting for my movie to start at the AMC Theatre across the parking lot. I was looking over the beer menu - looking for a good IPA. The best they had listed was the Sam Adams Rebel IPA - but I was looking for something more local and more "craft." I asked Crystal - my server, if there were any other offerings not listed. She replied they had Lagunitas IPA. While not local, it is California-based, and a very good IPA to boot. So I sucked down one of those before heading to my movie. The IPA was served in a very large glass - I suspect it was a 20 oz. glass. The place was packed when I arrived. I was lucky to find a spot in the bar area to sit. Very loud!
Food service extremely slow, waiting half an hour for appetizers is ridiculous NOT COMING here again.

I have been here many times ,I like their food. I was by the neighborhood yesterday I tried to called in the order to go but the phone number was busy  so I walked to order togo " I was there for 10 minutes and no one even acknowledge me " bad customer service I left without ordering!!!

I love Red Robin, just hate this particular location.  This has been my third visit to this location as I normally go to the Rivermark location very consistent food quality .  This location really needs some help on how food is prep, as my table ordered four burgers that was completely over cooked or technically "burnt".  Not only was the food burnt, but the burgers served was only slightly room temp warm and not hot like a gourmet burger should be "fresh".  I think this location needs to remove the "Gourmet Burger" title from this location. I will definitely will not be visiting this location again.

Really good food. Extremely long wait though. Waited an hour for our food and we saw it sitting in the kitchen for 30 minutes. I was tempted to just go and get it myself. Service is sometimes good. They are sometimes really nice or complete assholes.

What the heck happened? Waited over an hour for a burger. It arrived as the wrong burger and wrong fries after 1 hour. They took it back and the only thing bottomless about the fries was the container to hold them. After 15 min I had another burger. Great, this time it was not Cooked well done, but medium. Guess what, wrong fries again. They apologized and started to take my plate away again. I begged them not to take my food again. By now it had been forever without any food. They left the raw burger and I just ate it without complaining. The right fries finally showed up (garlic season). I should have just gone to in-out-burger but my friend saw a TV commercial and had to go here. The waitress was great, we tipped her just fine, but what the heck. Don't come here on a weekend unless you plan on staying for a long time. Bring your friends and maybe a board game, but don't bring your appetite.

We had a surprisingly good lunch with the kids a couple of Saturdays ago.  Despite the place being packed, we were seated within 10 minutes and our food came promptly.  I ordered my burger medium, and it arrived medium--not well done like most places.  We ordered one refill of fries, which was plenty.  Our server Jimmy was hopping like mad, but still attentive and friendly.  Generally this is not my kind of restaurant, but choices are limited when there are kids involved, and Red Robin exceeded expectations on this visit.  We'll be back.

I AM LITERALLY SO DONE. The service is terrible. our waiter is just goofing off and took a shot of beer. i am never coming back. the food is such a rip off. go to in and out people. because this restaurant is not worth it.

Terribly slow every time we come, thought it was just a fluke but happens every time, so we had to ban this place. Foods decent but the service is so awful no matter what time you come. Took 2 hours even after we sat down

Shout out to Annette for the best service ever.... NOTTTTT!!! this bish provided the WORST service ever. You are a waitress/server whatever tf u are DO YOUR FREAKING JOB. She is so slow, and not only that but she never came to check up on us even when I made eye contact /had to stare down. Me and my group Of friends sat in the middle when this freaking bleep was helping and paying attention to the table in front of us and the table ALLL the way in the back corner. She completely ignored our table and only check up on us once and that was when she us our bill. Not even that, but I distinctly said CHEDDAR cheese but I got American Cheese. Uhm I work at a burger place I know the difference between cheddar and American cheese. Oh don't even get me started on my meat. I distinctly said WELL DONE NO PINK and what the eff did I get? I GOT PINK. I WAS PISSED AND STILL AM TILL TODAY. My fries were cold aka not fresh, neither was my food. I like to think of myself as a food critic and have been to different red robin's so I do know the difference between what's fresh and unfresh and my food was NOT FRESH. it was cold, it was ugly and it was sloppy. She was rude she was a slob she was bleep bleep bleep. My experience here was NOT GOOD, it was TERRIBLE and terrible isn't even the right word to describe it because it was FAR WORSE. I wasn't even able to enjoy my meal because the food was DISGUSTING and thank you Annette for the lovely service. I just wanted to eat in peace but was not able to. So You deserve the worst server award ever. Thank you and I hope you do not have a great day.

Just ok.  Got a free birthday burger - thank you!  But husband's meal was cold - the meal and fries.  They comped his meal. Our poor waiter had a HUGE service area and he tried his best, but it was slow service to our during the lunchtime rush. It will be a while before we visit again

I used to love this place. I'm not sure if other locations have gone downhill like this one, but I won't waste my time going back to this one. The last three times I've eaten here, my burger and the fries has been brought to me cold to luke warm. Three different visits spread out over about two years and three cold meals. It was obvious that the burgers were made and left on the counter for a long while before being brought to the table. They offered to remake them for me and once I accepted, but it too came out cold. There's no reason that a burger at a place like this shouldn't be brought to the table still steaming hot. And my last visit a week ago actually included at least one raw potato in the fries. Remaking my burger ensures that I'm not eating with my family or friends and that they're waiting for me, so I usually decline and at least they have been nice enough to take the burger off my order. But it isn't good, so I don't eat it and still need lunch. In all honesty, McDonald's is better.

Having had to work late this was one of the few places still open for dinner at 10.30pm. Even then we were waiting for a while. Crazy for fri night. Nig pig bacon burger with garlic herb fries and a mini onion ring stack to start. My burger was over unfortunately though my friends was correct. The highlight was our server was awesome. She kept our drinks filled and checked on us regularly. I guess being crowded and late didnt help but a place that supports a capacity of 260 should be able to handle the high flow. 3.5 stars

The foods is good when they get your order right!! Which is worth a star. Got a big order today and our food was cold and half of a plate was missing! I asked how many chicken strips came with the clucks and fries she said 4 so my coworker and i wanted to split it and when i opened it up there was only 2!! I called to ask management if i could come back to get the amount that was missing and i was put on hold for a while so i gave up. Not impressed at all and will not be ordering togo from here again
Burger was ok, a little over seasoned for me. Cooked perfectly, fries were good. Would come again for a quick burger,  but not for a while.

Wow, this place has gone downhill real fast since they changed things up and changed management. I've been going here since they first opened but after my service here tonight, it's my last. It's really irritating how they tried to remodel it by looking so upscale, especially with how they plate food. I ordered a BBQ chicken burger and my parents got two different salads. I bit into my chicken burger and it was COLD and RAW. My parents salads had burnt chicken and old lettuce. After that, we just decided to give everything back. I have never had any problems until everything changed and I wish the old staff was still there. Good luck if you go. I suggest cutting your burger in half before eating it.

This place has slipped so far it's a joke.  Honestly, any good review is most likely from a manager trying to save their job.  Really not even sure if there is a manager on duty.  To start, I had to go to the bathroom, which was thrashed, to get a wet paper towel to wipe down my own table.  All of the condiments at the table ( ketchup, salt, pepper) were sticky and covered in bbq sauce or something.  After about 20 minutes a gal who was not our sever came out and took our drink and food order.  20 minutes after that we received our drinks.  My beer glass was covered in crumbs and frosting from a milkshake our server had previously made and my wife decided not to drink her water because she was so grossed out.  Every table around us outside was also experiencing the same bad service.  We ate as quickly as possible and left, praying the kitchen wasn't as filthy as the rest of the restaurant.  Side note, our servers pants were completely ripped in the crotch.  Whoever was in charge of this restaurant on Sunday 6/28 at 7:00, please pay closer attention to your staff and customers.  Take responsibility.

Consistently good food. Ton of choices for great burgers.  Red Robin looks and feels like a national chain restaurant, but actually delivers on the food it serves. As mentioned, the burgers are very good, cooked to preference.  The service is ok, at least at my nearest joint. We always eat in bar area where there is no wait.  My latest meal there was the Atlantic Cod Sandwich, which I've tried before and didn't really like it. This time, it was outstanding. Glad I gave a second shot.  Boring selection of beers on tap, and way to many host/hostesses at door. But good food.

I had never been to Red Robin and was excited to see what the commercials were about. It was NOT good. I asked the server what she suggests since it was our first time. Per her suggestions of a tavern burger, which would have two kid size burgers and a size, I chose the Pig n' out burger. My mother went with the Patty melt with Thousand Island dressing on a bun. 28 minutes later our food was served in the tiniest portions. Mine was one burger, NOT two, with "mixed fruit" of mandarin slice, (ya know the one in the can), squishy strawberries and about 1/4 of a cup worth. My burger was definitely kid size at $8.49 price. For 50 cents more I could have gotten a normal size one.... My mothers was a joke. Her buns, crumpled in her hands and fell apart since it was so old and stale. I asked if there was even thousand island on it. After dissecting her food we found a thimble full. She received a handful of fries and thankfully the waitress saw our disgust and brought another handful. If we weren't going to see a movie we would have returned the food. I wrote on the receipt, this was our first time and we will never be back. With so many competing Burger Joints my suggestion is to NOT waste your money here. Bill came to $34 plus some change. Not worth it at all. My biggest regret is not taking a picture to show everyone the joke food.

The food is continually good each time i come here.  But, the service SUCKS ASS from the hostesses up front to the waiters everytime i come. You would think i would have learned my lesson. Maybe this Yelp revoew will help me remember. Note to Red Robin: GET SOME CLUEFUL MANAGEMENT AT THIS JOINT ALREADY!

As a returning customer at Red Robin, I absolutely loved my order for both its exceedingly good quality and portion size. I ordered the Bleu Burger to go, which featured a delicious medium cooked patty with deep fried onions, tomato, lettuce, and cheese sandwiched between two onion-flavored buns. The quality of the meat patty was absolutely superb - juicy, flavorful, and melt-in-your-mouth fantastic and definitely so much better than I anticipated from a burger chain. I would definitely recommend this burger for first-timers! The price of the burgers here are a little bit on the higher end ($8 and up), but it's definitely worth every buck when you taste how good they are. Also, your burger comes with a side of fries of your choice, ranging from steakcut fries to sweet potato fries to garlic fries. I'm always a fan of sweet potato fries, and they are definitely delicious here as well. Love Red Robin and cannot wait till my next visit! P.S. You can sign up for their Red Robin Royalty program online - on your birthday, you get a free burger w/ a side of fries for free! :)

We arrived about 530 on Wednesday during the summer, and waited 25 minutes for a table. We should've known there was a problem when reception areas (both inside and outside) were filled with people waiting, while two-thirds of the tables were open. The host was telling people that not enough servers were scheduled. Many customers walked in and left before putting their name on the waitlist. We were seated, and waited a very long time for our order to be taken, and another 25 minutes for water, and then 10 more minutes for drinks to arrive. The food took much longer. We thought seriously about leaving. The schedule was poorly managed on the day we were there. This restaurant is located in a shopping center with AMC movie theater. Not a recommended choice if you are working with a timeline, or eating with anyone unwilling to wait a long time.

I used to love this place, what the effff! Came here with my girlfriends before a movie. We gave ourselves an hour and a half, thinking it would be enough time. I should have known it was not going to be a good experience as soon as I talked to the hostess. She just looked down and with a very passive aggressive demeanor told us the wait time. We took open bar seating since we just planned on getting a drink and some fries. Our waitress comes over with water for two of us, and says she'll be back with one more for our other diner.  So 15 minutes later there's no sign of her and we don't have a lot of time.  We spot a guy in a blue dress shirt by the bar, and naturally assume he's the manager. We wave him over and tell him our orders haven't been taken yet. He just shrugs us off and says our waitress would be right with us. Great,  thanks. She finally shows up and takes our orders.  We get our appetizers a short while later but no drinks. We finish our food and still no drinks. We look over at the bar tender who looks genuinely bewildered. She's pouring beers for people at the bar and standing around with a confused look on her face. We flag down our waitress and ask about the drinks.  She goes to the bar and asks the woman behind the counter then walks away.  They finally come. Mines got a tiny piece of ice floating in it, with a big clump of salt stuck to the side of the glass.  We have to leave and didn't have any confidence in the manager to correct the situation anyway so we just get our check and leave. By the way, all the condiments, salt,  etc at our table and surrounding tables are all empty. Awful experience.

Awful, awful, awful.  Went just before the AMC movie and got burgers the size of McDonalds but McDonalds would have tasted better and cost less. Bun fell apart, burger burnt. Service was excellent, however.  Saw lots of people with children and felt sorry for them paying these high prices for terrible food.  I'm not a fan of Mcdonald's but at least they don't totally rip you off with their food and prices.  Worst place I've ever been for hamburgers and will never go back again. Paid $34 for crap and would have complained but had to rush to movie.  Hate this place.

Went on a Saturday at lunch time. Pretty busy so wait is 12-15 minutes to get your food. Onion ring shorty was 4-5 stars. $6.99 double burger special is a great deal. Ordered no salt fries and they came out perfect. A good change from in and out. I wanted the burger medium rare but they only cook one way so med well to well done. We'll be back.

Not the kind of place I generally go to, but went along with choice by larger group.  Gourmet hamburgers for all...server didn't have a clue as who got what burger when delivered and accompaniments screwed up In a couple of cases...condiments only provided on request.  As burgers go, okay, but nothing exceptional.  Meets expectations for a sit down burger joint.  Maybe I should skip eating with the group?

Gourmet burgers my *ss . . . overcooked crumbly beef slathered in secret sauce is more like it. . . which in itself would have been tolerable if there hadn't been a half hour wait when we were pretty hungry . . .as in, gr8888888t we can wait outside in the 90 desgree heat with the guys sprawled so their bellies hang over their belts. Oh! Or we could get appetizers at the bar!! But no, they won't let you take take kids into that area.  No problem the host cleverly offers, you can just order appetizers to go. But no, says the barkeep, because it'll look to other customers who are waiting like you're getting served ahead of them. That's a hassle says me. . . What? Like it's my fault that people are too thick to start appetizers before ordering mains, or the wait staff is too clueless to care about their customers enough to suggest the alternative, or to offer even so much as a cool drink   I swear, the cattle on the menu were treated better than those made to wait in line at this place. The staff doesn't give a sh!% about anything except looking smug.  We left, and went to Kirk's.  The food was *FAR* better tasting, with fresher condiments, properly cohesive fresh meat in the burgers, and way better grilled. There was also zero wait, couteous service, and it cost half as much. I'm pleased to recommend the experience to anyone reading this review     For my money, the best burgers in Silicon Valley are at Kirk's, unless of course you'd be interested to try the the grill at the SJ Muni Golf Course.
Cold food after waiting for over 45 min for it to get here. Broken salad plate is somehow an acceptable thing too. How disappointing.

We Asian-Americans are known for being opportunistic.  I'm one of those people who gets as many free or discounted birthday meals as possible- and I only use one birthday, unlike my ex!  Red Robin has two locations near me in Sunnyvale: the Rivermark area in extreme northeast Santa Clara, or the Saratoga area next to the AMC 14. The only other location is in Eastridge mall San Jose..  Neither of these two locations is really close -about 8 miles each way.  And just try going from my house in south central Sunnyvale to either location during rush hour -it may take you half an hour or longer. There are no Red Robins west of Saratoga for 26 miles -in San Mateo! Now that I'm newly retired, I can take advantage of off times to get my free meals.   I was down in Campbell , and made plans to hit Red Robin in Saratoga, with my newly printed out free birthday meal. You can't just get a birthday meal, but have to join the Red Robin e-mail club, and bring along your 16 digit membership number.  Talk about red tape, the 16 digit number is longer than my 9 digit social security number, and 10 digits would cover every man, woman and child on earth.  They purposely make it long so that if you screw up any one of the 16 digits, you miss out on the free birthday burger.   We get there at 435pm on a Monday, park the Prius, and saunter in, me in my shorts, and my   thin, smoky white, cross strap Birki sandals contrasting against my tennis tanned legs.  And I was overdressed, judging from the clothes or lack of clothes the other guests were wearing. We are served promptly, seated at a cozy table for 2 next to the kitchen, with a view of bumper to bumper traffic on Hamilton Ave(?)  through the windows.  Good ambiance, very clean premises, with waiters all over the place, and teenagers out of school for the summer seemingly in every booth.       Have not been to a Red Robins in years, and it takes us 10 minutes to decide what to order.  All burgers come with unlimited fries.  However I'm not a fan of Red Robin's fries, as they are too chunky and lack the taste of the thin fries.   So the wife and I order our burgers with unlimited salads, at the same price. It takes 20 minutes for our orders to be prepared and served, and this is at 445pm.  Come here an hour later and you may as well use smoke signals to call in your meal!  They don't serve the salads with lettuce, cucumbers, and bits of tomatoes, until the  burgers are ready, and then serve it in a small bowl.  If you want those unlimited salads or fries, you are going to have eat it in small chunks, with long wait times between servings. The wife gets the $10 California chicken burger, complete with lettuce, tomato  and guacamole.  I get the $10 Banzai beef burger, with pineapple, lettuce, tomato.   The burger must be 6" tall.  Nobody can eat that directly with their mouth.  OK, maybe my ex-wife could fit it into her big mouth, as she put her foot in her mouth way too many times. Messy to eat.  We would look like toddlers with food all over our faces!  Now you know why they provide a knife and fork! I love pineapple with my burgers, but this is seemingly the only place I can get them to put pineapple on my burger, except in Hawaii, where they put pineapple at Island burger in Wailea for $11, and the burger there is half the size with no fries .     So I'm in hamburger heaven here, savoring my Banzai Burger piece by piece, going through two salads.   We leave at 525pm, 50 minutes after entering, with the wallet $15 lighter, thanks to a free birthday burger.   A toddler starts screaming in the background.  Good timing, our leaving!

Was contacted by management and received a gift card to return and try again.  Glad to say service was excellent and their management professionalism to follow up on my earlier review was much appreciated.  Glad to be a customer again.....

Saturday evening my girlfriend and I went to the Saratoga Red Robin about an hour before our movie was to start. After being seated we waited quite a while before we saw our server. She ordered a prime rib burger with tea, and I had the chicken crisp salad with a glass of water. The server dropped the tea and water as he hurried by after a while, but there was no sugar or sweetener on our table or any unoccupied tables nearby. After trying to get the attention of any of the wait staff, it was finally resolved by a trip to the bar and bringing the sweetener back to our table. Interesting that they no longer have sugar, just sweetener. Our food finally arrived and my girlfriend was delivered a french dip sandwich, not the prime rib burger she ordered. The food runner had to go find our server. Can you say: wait another 5 minutes? Of course he said he would take it back and get the right food but by this time we had only a few minutes to get to the movie. He told the manager and when she came by she asked if we wanted the burger, we said no, we have to go to the movie now. Manager asked if we wanted to take it to go. Was she unaware that you can't take food into an AMC theater? Did she think we would leave it in a car for 2 hours to grow bacteria and get all soggy? We deferred her offer to take it to go and she said she was sorry about the mix up. Then, in a tone that came across like she was doing me a favor, she said she would take it off the bill. Duh, did she really think I was going to pay for a burger I never received? I think when they screw up this bad that she could have offered a certificate for a burger in the future or some kind of compensation because the snack bar at the theater was my lady's only recourse after this happened. Will I go back?  If I have any time constraints, probably not.

OK I admit RR has good burgers - but 45 minutes and still no burger.  At 35 min we managed to get some french fries - ate all the fries - still no burger.  We finally left and went to Pizza My Heart.  Finally food and good food!  If there is a 45 min or longer wait after ordering tell me this is going to happen when I come in.  Don't leave us sitting forever at our - table for 2 hamburgers!!!!  That is not acceptable:(((

Red Robin burgers are satisfying when I'm craving a burger that's not from fast food joints.  However, my experience at this Red Robin was awful. I came here pretty late at night with my boyfriend (9:30PM), so there was no wait and not many people inside. We were seated, and our waiter brought out the menus for us. We were ready to order but our order wasn't taken for at least 10 minutes. We had to call another waiter over to take our order because we had no idea where our initial waiter was.  When my burger came out, I saw that it did not come with many of the ingredients that were listed on the menu. I thought they had given me the wrong item, so I called our waiter over and asked him if it was the right burger. He told me it was, but I knew it was missing some avocados among other things like jalapenos. He brought over a menu and realized that my burger was indeed missing some essential ingredients from it. A few minutes later, he brought back a plate with a few avocado slices and some jalapeno pieces on it.  What a disappointing experience! Not the best service from this place. Only redeeming thing is their bottomless fries/sides.

The food was very good, however, the restaurant was very busy and due to that, the service was not what we expected.  10 minutes to order beverages, asked for sugar and a glass of ice when they arrived, 10 minutes later nothing, waiter came and we asked again - he took off without taking order, so another 10 minutes before he returned and our meal order was taken.  30 more before we got our meal.  Don't get me wrong, the waiter was nice and they gave me a to go order of what I actually ordered, but I started out with the wrong meal.  My Passion Fruit Lemonade and my dining companions Iced Tea and Soda were all to be bottomless, but none of us were offered refills - not even on our water.  The sweet potato fries are also supposed to be bottomless, but again, no offer was made.  I didn't ask only because I was afraid it would take 20 more minutes to get my refill.  I will rethink this location in the future.

Hospitable? I think NOT. Honoring offers made? No. Customer service? Poor to non-existent. Double check your take out orders!  We ordered burgers to go and found it was not what we ordered. We called and the Manager told us during our next visit they would pay for two burgers to make up for their mistake. When we decided to take them up on the offer, they refused to honor their offer. Don't offer if you aren't going to honor it. It's really too bad because we are frequent patrons. Not any more.

Food is okay but the service rather the management is much to be desired. Service is really slow and it's not the fault of the servers but rather management trying to maximize profit but having the bare minimal amount of staff possible to keep the servers running nonstop and constantly behind. It took over 30 mins for them to take our food order and took over 1hr to get our food. Not only did  Red Robin serve us cold food the service was terrible.  The fish sandwich that  my mom got was cold so we sent it back thinking that we were going to get a new sandwich but we got a heated up soggy fish sandwich.  The server must have said sorry about ten times.  I had to go looking for a refill for coffee.  I will think twice before returning.
Plain awful. Avoid at all cost. Expensive, low-quality burgers. Slow service coupled with long wait times. There's absolutely nothing good about this place.

In the midst of one of the worst dining experiences ever. Seated over 30 minutes ago, took 20 minutes and requests of 2 separate staff to get a high chair (which we finally just went and found on our own). Drink orders placed along with app order about 15 minutes ago. One app showed up, no drinks. No silverware. Server nowhere to be found.  Still no drinks. Still haven't been able to place an order for dinner. No manager anywhere to be found. This is ridiculous. Never again will this place get my business. Horrible, horrible, horrible!  Maybe they will go out of business soon and we can get a neighborhood restaurant that is worth our money.

Again horrible service. I don't know why I keep coming back.  Slow service, never enough servers, poorly managed. Empty Ketchup bottles so the servers can't or don't do their side work. Waited 45 minutes for food. ..probably won't  be  back. Last time we walked out without anyone greeting us except the hostess, andshe doesn't bring drinks. .

My husband finally spoke with the manager and was very diplomatic about the situation...and asked for the DM number... The manager finally came to our table with the number and acted as if it was our fault and that it was really not a big deal that we were still waiting for fries after we had been served Luke warm food!
