The worst Red Robin I've ever been to.  Server had attitude every time we asked him for something.  He rarely checked up on us, the place was not even busy (about 1/3 full).  Requests to the kitchen took forever to come out.  He forgot part of a friend's order but still charged him for it.  Orders were never delivered by our main waiter.  Fries and drink refills were rarely tended to.  He insisted we use the tablet terminal to pay instead of handing us a traditional receipt.  There was grease on the bottom of my burger (and everyone in the party).  To top it all off, I got mild FOOD POISONING.  Disgusting environment, I would avoid this location if you can.

Tl;dr: mediocre food and crummy service My husband and I went here for dinner on a Sunday night. It was not too crowded and we were seated right away. Unfortunately, we were seated next to the to-go pickup area, where a very loud young girl and her mother (who was uninterested in telling her to stop loudly kicking the bar) were waiting. That did not start things off well. I ordered clucks and shrimp and he got a bacon cheeseburger. His burger was underwhelming. My entrée was fine but the fries were cold and sad, do I wanted to get them replaced with fresh ones. This RR location is using ziosk table kiosks, which let you play games, order food and drinks, or call the server. I hit the button to call the server and a red light on top started blinking. And blinking. And blinking. Unfortunately it had no relation to anyone coming to check on us - in fact, several other servers walked by the blinking light and did not acknowledge it at all. We finally, after write a few minutes, saw our server, who brought me new fries. They were hot but also insanely greasy, which was kind of gross. We paid with the annoying little ziosk console and left. I don't think we'll be going back to this location.

I was first introduced to the Red Robin chain when I was in college.  For a student on a budget, it really checked all the boxes: - free refills on fries - free refills on drinks - reward program (buy 9 entrees, get 1 free) ... Okay, maybe there weren't very many boxes back when my metabolism was faster and my wallet was lighter. More than a decade later, it's still a decent sit-down spot for a diet-busting burger meal.  (I don't dare look at the nutrition facts here.)  The decor got updated a few years ago, and the new chairs are an improvement. The burgers are pretty good: cooked to order, juicy, and piled high.  The Whiskey River BBQ burger is one of our favorites, featuring fried onion strings and barbecue sauce.  The guacamole bacon burger is a self-explanatory classic.  These come with bottomless steak fries (try RR's salty spice mix on them) and run about $10 each. Red Robin now also features a "Tavern Double" line of small double cheeseburgers (about $8 each) and a higher-end line of signature burgers on ciabatta buns (about $14 each).  These likewise let you refill fries ad infinitum. The "freckled" strawberry lemonade is a popular choice that's been around for years.  The newer "poppin' purple" prickly pear lemonade is even sweeter.  These come with free refills, so it's no big surprise that they check in around $4.50 each.  (It would be nice if the beverage menu listed the prices though.) The guest service experience can vary pretty wildly.  On our latest visit, our server Katelynne did an outstanding job and made sure we had everything we needed.  Prompt drink refills, piping-hot fry refills, the works.  She even checked whether we could combine the "Tavern Double Tuesday" special with a free birthday burger offer.  Really impressive service, considering she was flying around to cover many tables. On the flip side of things, in that same visit we saw vacated tables neglected for a long time before being bussed.  It honestly seems like the busboys here don't try very hard.  You'd think RR doesn't employ any busboys, but once in a great while they'll come by and bus a table... Food:  4 stars Value:  3 stars, depends a bit on how many fry refills you down Service:  3.5 stars, can be hit-or-miss (5 stars for Katelynne) Overall:  3.5 stars
I hate the table terminals.  Last thing I want my kid doing when we go out for a meal is to play games that cost $2.00.  I had a double tavern burger that was way too greasy.  Probably won't go back
Good food, but service has gone downhill. My family were first seated without menus, then it took at least 15 minutes for someone to take our drink orders and bring menus.
Fast service. Large bar area so you don't have to wait for a table if there's a long wait  Friendly waiters.  Rebel IPA and other seasonal Sam Adams on draft.

Walked up at 9:30pm, one party of three waiting for a table, and the irritable hostess, BEFORE we can even say a word, blurts out "30 Minutes" in a negative tone. It could not have been more than 5 minutes of waiting, based on one party ahead of us. We left. Right behind us was another elderly couple. As we walked to our car, we looked back, and that couple also was walking out the door. Note to manager of this facility: your hostess is driving away business. Don't worry about what you pay her hourly, cause you're losing way more in terms of business.

The speed of service on Fri night is slower than molasses. We went here last night and these are 2hrs of our life we won't get back. Food is slow, and soggy and unappetizing. So first 45 min to sit, then 20 min for appetizers and 40+ min for burgers....which have obviously sat under the lamp because the bread is soaked and dripping and the fries are lukewarm and thrown on the plate as a last ditch effort. Unpalatable at best Overall, what a waste of Fri night! In and out would do a better job than this mess. P.S: we could see the servers hustling hard, not like they were sloppy. Makes it even more odd Verdict: never returning, not to this spot, and likely not to the chain

Do not eat the cheese curds. I ordered the gravy cheese curds fries dealio... never again.  The service was meh....  Eastridge and Rivermark Plaza have better food and service... don't waste your time here.
Ali was awesome. From start to finish he was ON point. Drinks and food were perfect! I can't wait to come back!!!

I usually like Red Robin. My One Star is for the server that didnt give a *uck about her service. Oh and for the Egg that took 20 min to make. Her name is Katelynne He... I get it, everyone has bad days, but to not take care of a customers because they screwed up on your order, doesn't help anyone. First it takes over 30 minutes to get my beer and 2 milk shakes. Then another 30 minutes to receive our burgers, to only find out that my order (Royal Red Robin) was screwed up. Egg Over hard was requested and I received Sunnyside up. Fine, no problem, its a mistake, I sucked it up and waited 20 minutes to have an egg cooked. 20 MINUTES TO HAVE ONE EGG COOKED OVER HARD!!! Wtf!! All of this while Katelynne is next door chopping away while I flagged her down to check on my burger. She clearly knew my order was screwed up because she only came by to ask where my burger was previously. But with no sense of urgency taking care of the situation, she said she was tired from being up at 6am. Ok, I guess it's ok to not do your job because you're tired.  When the burger came out, I dig in to my burger to only find out that the *ucken 20 min egg that was being cooked, cooked for literally 20 min on the grill. I waited over an hour just to get this burger that was not up to standard. Not only that, but I tell Katelynne, our server..... Her response, "ok".. and walked away. She should've taken care of the situation right then and there, but had us wait another 15 minutes to flag down someone else to get the manager over. And of course, she took care of the problem.  Morale of the story is, don't ruin someone else's day because your day was long. This was taken place on 10/01/15 @830pm on table 13

I will star this review by saying that I am a grown up and I went here with 5 friends (all also grown ups) and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! The food was good and there was no compromising to make this adult friendly... sure, you can hear them singing their "happy, happy birthday" song to the 5 year old at the booth next door... but that is part of the joy of the experience.  You can also see the Thursday Night Football game on... so they are trying to be "family friendly" but NOT to become a gymboree and cater only to the little ones (which I can appreciate) They have kiosks on the tables where you can only order appetizers or dessert (but not your meal)... I guess they are experimenting with doing away with waiters and have not gone all the way on that???  It was a little weird... however getting to split the bill at the table and pay separtely at the table with the machine was AMAZING!!!  This revolutionizes splitting the bill (you literally select what you had and it all gets split out...)  That itself is worth 5 stars!!!

Gave it a second try after a horrible first experience and shame on us for doing so. Service is just about as bad as any Buffalo Wild Wings. On top of shitty service we received the wrong burger, no ketchup and fries that were still frozen! Such a disappointment. Won't come back to this location again.

Love their Strawberry Lemonade here and how it is unlimited! The strawberries are delicious and so addicting to pick out. Another reason why we come here is for their onion ring tower. Red Robins seriously has THE BEST onion rings anywhere! Hands down they are delicious. Huge onions, crispy and perfectly fried in batter, and most importantly, it tastes so fresh! Only $5 for the small tower or $9 for the large. It's so worth it.  All the burgers that we've tried here have been pretty good. The cod fish burger and whiskey river burger are among my favorites. The burgers are huge and they come with bottomless fries. I'm not a huge fan of their thick cut fries so I normally replace it with a salad.  Most of their appetizers are pretty cheap, they have ones ranging from $3 up to $9.. not bad at all! The service has been consistently great. You can order off the little electronic tablets on your table too and even pay for your meal on there which is super convenient if you're in a rush or forgot an order. I think these tablets are pretty new we I've only seen them the last time I visited Red Robins. Definitely feel way overstuffed when I come here so it's always a good thing to share!

The food here is fantastic! Bottomless steak fries with burgers too! My favorite place to eat in Saratoga. It has excellent service too! Ask for Billy as your waiter, he is hands down the fastest:best waiter I've ever had (counting other restaurants too) refills usually arrive before I've finished my drink, and asks if more fries are required often when I'm around 3 left or so.

Just tried to have dinner here. What an awful experience. We were seated after a 16 minute wait, our server took our order and we didn't see him again for 45 minutes later when we asked to check on our food.  After another 10 minutes the burger and hush puppies came out to the table. The burger had been over  microwaved and brought out.  It was so hot from the inside out and the lettuce was nuked to a wilted weed. The hush puppies were cold. Server showed no remorse. Horrible food and service.

Half way decent restaurant. The three stars is mostly for their onion rings and malt milk shakes, everything else about Red Robin is "meh". The burger I ordered was lacking quite a bit in flavor, the cheese was hardly melted on top, and it was served lukewarm. The service is incredibly slow here. It was a bit crowded so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt, but it felt like we were waiting an eternity for our food to come.  Red Robin could use some work in my opinion, it's alright for what it is though.

Red robin is a new discovery in our house. Yes, I know - a little late to the party. They have great burgers here. The apps are also great. The fish and chips lack the oomph than other places. The breading doesn't stay on the fish which is very frustrating. The prices are very good also - let's be honest that is hard to find in this area. The reason this place does does not warrant five stars is the service. Last two times I went to Red Robin I saw my server twice. Once to take my orders and the next to pay. The food was delivered by an expediter not our server.  Whenever I go there I am convinced the reason they have bottomless fries is because there is no way possible for you to get more than one order. While we enjoy the food we only go to this red robin when we have lots of patience.  FYI, don't hit it up before the movie. You will most definitely be late to the show.

Absolutely yummy for my tummy tonight! We spent the day cleaning and by 5 when we got here had only had coffee and water, so needless to say we were hangry! We were sat promptly waiting the ten minutes they quoted us. Our waiter Elliot, a new fellow, was great and brought me salad right away once I let him know my condition was serious! Our burgers: mine the smoke and pepper was cooked just right and the hubby tried a new one - the uber burger which he was quite happy with! Fries, beverages, salad all Perfectly complimentary to the food. And Elliot. He made sure we were happy and we let him know we were thankful. See you next time YUMMMMMMM

Walked in, was directed to a table, waited 5 min for a waiter who never came. Looked around for an available waiter to flag down, but eventually excused myself. Menu looked great, too bad i was too hungry to wait much longer.

I'll start by saying, I wanted to treat my little brothers out to eat. I was going to smash burger but I wanted it to be a little more special than just a regular fast food store. We didnt wait for long until we were finally seated. I felt really good having my 2 little brothers with me in the same table. I was asking them how their school was and such. When my server came he handed me my phone and underneath it was the tip I had given him, he says "Heres your money, I dont need it" turned his head around mugging me. I mean my sallary is not that great also, Im barely able to get by with what Im getting. I will not be coming back to any other Red Robins Restaurant after this experience. It wasnt a very pleasant experience. Edit: Food was great, my brothers had a fun time. We have had a few bad experiences at Red Robin (not this one) but decided to give it a try. Good was amazing. Server was fantastic! He was well professional, great, very personable and friendly.

location: North San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: I will not come back. This place has gone down the drain. We were greeted rudely and since the place is crowded we requested to sit outside.
