We may not have dressed up to eat in this place but we make our living honestly and I guess our money is not good enough.

My mom and I tried to go to the movies at the nearby AMC but had the time wrong so we decided to have lunch here instead.  Our waiter was very attentive and kept checking on us until we were ready to order. I went with the basic burger with no cheese or bun and I added avocado on it.  My mom had the Whiskey River BBQ burger.  It was supposed to have crispy onion straws on it but it seemed more like sautéed onions.  I had the sweet potato fries and mom had regular fries.  Both were delicious.  The sweet potato fries had good flavor.  Crispy on the outside, soft inside.  Regular fries were the same way. Definitely a great place for a burger and fries.  They have lots of options and flavors.  They have a very exciting liquor menu too if you are into that.

If I could give this place a negative star rating, that's what they would get. Management has no control of anything.  They lag on everything from the moment you walk in till the moment you leave. About the only thing they do right is, oh wait, they don't do anything right.  AVOID THIS PLACE. POOR STAFF, POOR MANAGEMENT POOR EXCUSE FOR A BUSINESS.

Should have listened to my son and went to the Counter. Just didn't want to wait in the cold at Santana Row during the holiday season. Has to be nightmare over there.  But check out the picture I uploaded. Found moldy tomatoes in our burger, got lucky with it falling out of my sons burger for us to see, pretty sure a bunch of people had black mold tomatoes tonight. Last time here. Place isn't that good to begin with, so no loss.

Enough time goes by and I always forget how terribly slow the service is here. Wait and wait and wait to get seated. Wait even longer to have anyone bring you a drink. And then wait some more before someone takes your order. Then settle in for a really long wait for your mediocre food. Is there an app that can detect your location and remind you to always avoid a nearby restaurant?

Food is ok for what it is.   However, service always seems spotty to us.   We went once last month (Nov 2015) and the host at the front was odd/rude.   He seemed to have a private joke going with himself and was sarcastic to customers.   Kristina was our server and didn't crack a smile until it was time for us to tally a tip.    She was efficient, though. We just visited again yesterday (Dec 22, 2015) at 2:30 p.m. and we thought it wouldn't be too hard to get a table after the lunch rush.   That was a mistake.  There was a long wait for a table yet the restaurant appeared to be about 1/3 empty.  There were more than enough tables available to seat all who were waiting.  I am guessing there wasn't enough wait staff to work the tables.   It was frustrating nonetheless.   The good thing is the hostess was very nice as was our waitress.   Service was really slow at our table but we chalked it up to maybe a wait staff shortage.    It took us 2 hours to have lunch.   Not sure if we'll return.   Definitely won't if we are in any sort of time constraint.

Our timing was less than perfect as we arrived at the peak or end of lunch hour around 2pm and we were seated at 23 mins. Luckily our server daphne was warm, pleasant and knowledgeable. Besides having stellar customer service she was able to accommodate our table with 2 ziosks (the new tabletop technology that allows people to order, pay the check, summon a waiter, or best of all play games and watch movies) for a price 1.99 each our children were able to watch a movie while the other played a game. This is a cool service. The food was hot, delicious and served within reasonable time, the appetizers came out quick. The reason for three stars was the cleanliness of the facility. In the woman's bathroom there is a continuous drip under the sink that creates for slippery situations my 4 year old actually fell right by the caution sign. I hope they get that fixed ASAP. There were a handful or more of empty tables which needed to be serviced and remained that way the entire time we dined.  Overall it was a pleasant experience and this location remains among my top 2 red robins in the area.

We've been here about a dozen times over the years. The service is always horrible. The servers are kind, but everything takes so long. Dinner at Red Robin should not take 2 1/2 hours.  We only go there because my kid loves mac and cheese and enjoys getting his free refills because the bowl is so small. We learned last night that they no longer do that.  Last night was our final visit because I found a fish bone or piece of nylon in my chicken sandwich. I told our server and the kitchen manager came out. She said they would make me another sandwich right away. I got it 20 minutes later and it was burnt.  Not going back.

Eating at cabins are not so bad! Ted Robbin always delivered good delicious tasty burgers!! I usually get the banzai burger ! But I changed it up tonight to the peppercorn burger which is very tasty!! In the plus side they offer bottomless fries! We also got the regular bacon cheeseburger that never disappoints!! Gotta love red robin! Plus there's plenty of parking outside, it gets a little too crowded on the weekend but if you have wait it's worth it! Their 22 ounce draft beers are priced just right and the atmosphere to eat here is very family friendly and fun! The servers are super nice and tentative!!

did take out from her, there were multiple problems: 1). the online menu - printed version does not match their real menu 2). Hamburgers were the worst burgers we have had and expensive - in and out are much better at less than 1/2 the price 3). I waited for 5 minutes before they gave me my food because they were too busy trying to get the slushy machine in the bar to work - it apparently takes 3 people.  Therefore food was cold.

First, let me say the waiter was great, trying to keep us happy, my order the seafood one was fine, but my wifes burger had sweet potatoe fries with it, plus, they charge you more for sweet potatoe fries, hers came ice cold, like right from the fridge, next they have these idiot boxes on the table, probably named after the guy that invented them. You can call the waiter or ad things to your meal, well, maybe not, it only flashes a red light on top & IF your waiter sees it, he comes over! He eventually did about 10 minutes later, by this time my wife was almost done with her burger, he apologized for the cold fries & ordered more, 10 minutes later by the time they came she was already done with the meal, so was I, they still sit on the table for the next VICTIM, uu, customer! The manager comes over to see how the meal was, we give her the spill, she offers to take fries off bill, WOWWW, really, $1.40, definitely makes us feel like NEVER coming back, slap in the face!! Only been there twice in my life & I'm 60, WILL NOT EVER BE IN AGAIN,....YAHOOOOO!! Oh Yea, #UCK OFF!!

it seems like every red robin these days has terrible service. my friend and I were trying to catch a bite to eat before going to the movies, but between waiting to flag down our server and waiting for our food to come (which I thought was a long wait for a table of 2 without appetizers), I literally paid at the table and took a quarter of my burger to go, ghetto style in a napkin, as I walked across the parking lot to the theater.  it's too bad they can't seem to get it together because I love me a freckled lemonade and a shroom burger, but I always have to make sure I have a good 2 hrs to spare.
Can't go wrong with a burger from red robins, always delicious!!!! We usually end up choosing this place over a bunch of other burger restaurants

Pros first: The food was great. I had a cheeseburger and my dad had a hickory burger. I got the onion rings with uncharge instead of bottomless fries, because the onion rings are stupendous. My 3 year old enjoyed picking her entree, side, and beverage from the extensive kids menu, and I enjoyed that this menu was available for $5 and under.  Cons: My dad ordered a side caesar and he got a regular side salad. The silverware was dirty. We had to ask for silverware and napkins. We had to ask for drink refills. It took 20 minutes to place our drink orders, another 15 to place our meal orders, and yet another 10 for my daughter's milk to come out. That's 45 minutes from arrival, 25 minutes from order, for a 3 year old's milk to arrive. Not exactly stellar.

I had an unpleasant experience with a waitress, however, the management at Red Robin was kind and understanding and contacted me in regards to the issue I had.  They corrected the issue and I have been dining there ever since.  Their burgers are delicious and my kids truly enjoy the treat of going there every time.

Notice to all: Anyone who frequents the Saratoga Avenue Red Robin you'll want to BE ABSOLUTELY SURE you inspect your food before you put it in your mouth.  In a recent trip to Red Robin a Red Robin employee took a bite out of my hamburger before serving it up to me. On December 30th at 7 p.m. I visited Red Robin with family and I ordered a Bonsai Burger.  When it arrived, I called the waiter over to ask whether my burger is supposed to be a turkey burger, since I didn't have a menu in front of me and I thought I had ordered a beef burger.  He told me "Absolutely not, I'll send it back."  What he then came back with was a burger whose meat was so burned it was actually nothing but a charcoal disk.  Again I showed it to the waiter and his face looked shocked and he said "Oh that is really burned."  At the moment that he returned with a third burger I asked for a to-go box since everyone at my table had finished eating. At home, opening the to-go box I couldn't help but want to inspect the burger and this photo is what I found. Shocking!! I complained to the Red Robin management [transmitting the photo in separate calls and in-person conversations with this location's Red Robin Kitchen Mgr. Octavio Casas and Red Robin District Mgr. Chris Negley] and while Red Robin registered my complaint, my impression is (and I have been given no information to believe otherwise) that Red Robin is not taking this incident as a serious matter. Both Chris Negley and Octavio Casas told me that this location's General Mgr John King would call me to discuss and to this date I've never been given a call by Mr. King. Not at all sure that the Red Robin employee who took a bite out of my burger before serving it up to me is still employed there!! Translate the one star as a negative 5-star rating.

Our server was amazing. However, the food was less then satisfying. We asked to add jalapeños on one burger and avocado on another. I uploaded pictures of what was received. The onions were old, the bacon was... yea. The atmosphere was great and the service was great but the food was horrible. The last three visits, in three different counties, has been gross. It's safe to say, Red Robin is no longer a food option. (Gave it two stars because of the service).

This is my childhood RR spot. And I recently came back as a 20-something and I STILL LOVE IT. Memories and standards achieved! I'm the type of foodie who stays away from big chains, but RR will be that one exception. I'm all about supporting independent small businesses, but how do you say no to $2 endless fries?! YES, our wonderful server (I loved her tattoos! And she reminded us of Ruby Rose) was very chill and sweet...and told us that we could totally enjoy our beers, the Super Bowl, and a low low price of 2 dollahs for bottomless fries! Let's be honest. Those steak fries are the reason why we all go to Red Robin. Sure the burgers are yummy (the royal robin with the egg is my fave), but it's that special seasoning on the fries that get my blood pumping to eat here. I love this RR because it's HUGE. There's always enough room if your kid is hosting a huge birthday party, or even if you're just here on a casual date for two! It's my go-to, and now I know that this will be my place for big sporting events. The Super Bowl diners were SCARCE here, and there were so many seats available!! WE LOVED IT. Our service was prompt and relaxed...love that especially when I'm doing my thing and catching up with my friends!

Came her for lunch on Presidents day to eat with my wife and in-laws.  They were in a burger mood.  There was a 45 minute wait at The Counter at Santana Row so we came here as a plan B.  No wait!  Very cool I ordered the Bruschetta chicken burger to try something different and really enjoyed it.  My wife ordered the Chicken Caesar  salad and was happy with her selection.

First off, we got seated pretty fast. We sat near the bar. The waiter was ok. There were no utensil at our table. I ordered the cod fish and chips and my gf ordered A1 Peppercorn burger. When the orders arrived, the fries were cold. The cod fish and chip was cold and not only that, the second piece of fish I touch had a piece of hair. I lost my appetite when I saw that. THe burger was also cold. Not hot as I expected to be from a hot burger meal. The burger came with sweet potatoe fries and it was also warm/cold. This place totally sucks. The waiter did not offer to refill our water or "bottomless fries". After this experienced with this restaurant, I would never come here again. If you guys want a good meal that is hot and welcoming, I suggest you go to five guys, in n out or some other delicious place.

WTF They could have just served us melted crisco with a spoon! We wanted patty melts...good idea we hoped. The marbeled rye was over toasted, the meat was wafer thin, the cheese was minimal, oh and the onion...one 1/2 side only. And here is the truth...they cooked the whole thing in smothering grease. YUK, I'm telling you it was awful! We ordered onion rings, an indulgence, and they too were loaded with grease, gleaming, dripping, awful. Think very carefully about selecting this place, it is an adventure in awful.

I wouldn't recommend coming to this restaurant unless you were absolutely starving and it's your only option. Service here is really slow and poor. If you come around 5:00pm they'll make you wait 25 minutes for a seat when all the window seats are clean and available, and they won't let you sit at them because they "don't have servers." 10 minutes later you'll see the next family sitting there with no excuses. If you ask for their bottomless fries, it will take them 15-20 minutes before you'll even get them, if they don't forget (which they often do). To top it all off, ordered a chili burger and they told me they ran out of chili.. 2 days ago. Don't even bother coming here unless you don't care about slow service and potential ingredients being unavailable. The burgers are mediocre and you can get a good burger anywhere else nowadays. Save your time and money please.

The last time we came here I was disappointed greatly, wrote a giant complaint review and eventually erased it and went on with my life because I didn't want to deal with it. A few months later we come again and it's the typical stuff, rude uninterested, quoting people 30-45 minute wait for what was really about 15 min and half the back tables were empty. We sit and order our daughters food first so it comes out first then our drinks and later on our food. The food comes out not too long after and after a bit later of sitting my daughters macaroni and cheese comes out, apparently it takes longer to cook a tiny cup of Kraft macaroni than it does to make three hamburgers. Speaking of food, I thought my "pig out" burger was pretty gross, the meat like warm and soggy, cheap sliced government looking cheese, soggy bland bacon, the whole thing was mushy, bland and just disappointing, we used to live across from another red robin and their burgers were always hot, juicy yet crisp enough to have some bite to it, they were definitely two hand premium burgers, this was like a crappy old Burger King burger, I would almost prefer a good Big Mac or whopper over this, so I didn't finish it, the fries were a mix of decent fresh crunchy fries and old cold soggy fries,my daughters Mac and cheese was watery and bland (definitely in a whole class or two under elephant bar's) I never got a single refill of my drink, neither did any of my group, we did get a single refill of fries, but he offered to put them in right after we just got served and they didn't come out until we were receiving dessert. one of my biggest complaints from last time was the fact that they put those dumb terminals on each table trying to sucker people out of money for free cell phone games, it makes the waiters lazy and never come around, even to collect your money, it's like "you done? Well pay yourself". I don't even want to waste more time writing this, done with this place for the second time.

Don't know why we keep coming here.  Always have terrible luck with the service here.  Both dinner and lunch.  Service staff is friendly, but so slow.  If I'm paying $15, this is not what I'm expecting.  Slow to refill my water and super slow on refilling the bottomless fries.  Maybe it's a strategy to save costs, but a terrible customer experience.    Think I'm done with this place.  Would rather get a burger from Mooyah or the Habit.

The bar at Red Robins is not a recommended area if you're looking for good service... Host informed us if we didn't want to wait, there were seats at the bar. However, it took SO long to get our order in, to receive our food, and our waiter never came back to refill our waters. But he was nice and came by once to ask if everything was okay so stars for him. But the food was less than decent. My friend got the boneless wings with buzz sauce and I gotta say, they were the smallest pieces of boneless chicken I have ever seen. A couple piece of popcorn chicken constitutes as boneless chicken now huh? My tower of onion rings was fine; it was as good as I remembered it. My other friend ordered the chicken on ciabatta bread. Too much bread compared to chicken. Drinks were pretty good though. All three drinks were nice: TNT, Orange Blitz, and Merry Moscato. Not too strong though, which is how I prefer my drinks, but maybe not to others. Paid via their new electronic machine on the table so it was quite efficient. I've had good experiences here before. I'm sure I'll have it again next time when I'm not sitting at the bar.

Very sad to write this review.... First, we waited in line just to be greeted.  Mind you, we came in at 7.  Totally normal dinner time imo.  I have family members with a very specific allergy.  We have to use the app, they say... if it WORKED!  We asked to use their ipads to order.  She said, "They're all the way in the back."  Well, go get one!  Fries came out cold, no one checked in with us.  My husband flagged down a manager for help.  The manager took the cold fries, and put in another order.  Then the waitress dropped them on the floor.  45 minutes pass..... still no burgers.  Then an hour, and, cold food.  Disappointing is an understatement.
We sat outside because inside was packed and our service was slow and our food was cold. Bad experience.

I went there with a friend last week. She found a hair on her salad and when she told the waitress she said the manager will take 3 dollars off the bill. Not the best customer service. Won't go to that place again

This place had the worst service I've had in a long time! The meal took 30 min to get to the table and when I got my meal they said my onion rings were coming up shortly so as everyone at my table were eating I sat waiting for my onion rings which showed up as we finished our meal! Also  I now know why they offer bottomless items it's because the staff never comes to service you so you can't order anymore! I don't know how this is acceptable by any standard but I will not be bringing my family or work meeting here. Go to Burger King you'll get better service!

Ehh. Definitely not one of the Red Robins I would recommend.  Our waiter was pretty nice, was helpful when he was actually around and kept the fries coming since it took literally 35 mins to get our food! The host seem kinda lost but was also nice. The beer-rita was NOT yummy at all. I drank it cause I didn't want to waste the money, but definitely not getting it again! Food was yummy but my sweet potato fries looked so unappetizing! -__- Anyway, bathroom was a mess, and Yeah. Don't think I'll be coming to this location anytime soon.

Its red robin, not a steak house people lol. Burger and fried were awesome.  Banzai burger is my fav. Go with the honey mustard to dip the fries (trust me on this).  Service was as expected, decent.  Grabbed food and hit the movie 100 yards away.
Nice Red Robin. Gets crowded due to proximity with the Cinema halls. Slightly more wait times than average because of that.

Red Robin YUM - Has always been a favorite of mine (since High School, actually). Love that they have bottomless french fries - the bottomless feature also applies to SWEET POTATO FRENCH FRIES. What! Who could say no to that?! It's a great place to grab a drink after work & catch up with an old friend. The service was ok - Could've been better, could've been worse. And the hamburgers are always juicy here! (Even if they no longer serve medium rare).

Several times eating here & now we review. I had great times each and every time. It's busy but our servers always delivered. We met several friendly customers while we visited.  My chicken wrap was always on point, even down to the thick avocado slices. Boyfriend was always happy with his meals. We both LOVE the pick 2: mushrooms & cheese sticks. Yummmm... I would say my only complaint would be that the area closest to the kitchen needs a bit better ventilation. Smoke came our way each time. It was kinda distracting since I already have breathing issues that I'm on medication for. Something positive to leave with: Check out their HUGE Lego cheeseburger & fries display! It's very neat!

We came here for my dad's birthday. Our server was really nice, the one star is for him. Minus four for how it took nearly 1.5 hours to be served our food. As my dad put it "I ordered food this birthday, but was served food on my next birthday."
Love it here.  We go all the time!  I absolutely love the banzai and DGB burgers.  Oh and the purple pear lemonade is awesome.  Plus, it's a fun place.

Good food. But not worth $1800 a burger. I asked for a table and was seated at a tiny cramped booth in the back. Moved myself to a table. Manager had someone carve a scratch in my car door down to the metal.

Whoa, it's been 4 years since my last update? Okay, since that visit oh so long ago, I figured out Red Robin was doing a major overhaul on all of its locations. They've even upgraded their burger varieties. I used to always get the shroom burger, but lately I've been getting the Prime Chophouse burger which comes with horseradish sautéed mushrooms, steak sauce, fried onion strings, provolone, and it's served on an onion roll. Red Robin still serves bottomless fries, which is a definite selling point. Protip-ask for a basket of fries while the rest of your food is cooking. Might as well start out with some parmesan-garlic fries as an appetizer, right?

I've been to this location several times and the inital service has always been prompt and the servers are friendly, however, food delivery has been getting progressively worse with each visit.   The time from ordering to actually receiving our food this last time was approximately 40 minutes.  I'd understand this wait time for something like a juicy lucy burger, but these are standard patties cooked to order and assembled for variety from "stock" ingredients.   Of course, at least with the "old" Red Robin, I could snack on fries while I waited.  However, their recent corporate overhaul has resulted in transforming a generous fry policy to downright stingy.  I no longer get a basket of fries and it instead comes out with the burger.  When the burger does finally arrive, it comes with a fry order that's probably the equivalent of a child's fry order from McDonald's.   At the end of the day, it's a good burger, but I've decided that "gourmet" isn't worth an additional 45-60 minutes sitting there nursing my drink.

I had not been to a Red Robin in 20 years yet the service and food I had tonight was amazing!!!  The servers name was Jessica and I must say she was TOPS!!  She was so awesome we left her a 40% tip!!!  She absolutely deserved it!  Wow!  We will definitely go back!  Thank you Red Robin!  A+++++

Do not eat here.... Came in today and literally watched our food in the window for 20 minutes watched the manager walk passed it and run other people's food...super bad service will not come back which sucks because I really like red robin.

Avoid like the plague. Got seated by an apathetic hostess who tossed down menus on our table and left. 15 min later, when no one showed up at our table, which by the way was grimy, we flagged a waitress, who turned out to be the manager, and asked if we could order. 10 minutes after that we left because no one ever showed up. The 'manager' had said to us - let me grab someone for you. Why? Don't you have someone to wait at my section? I'm giving this place 1 star because there is no way to rate them in the negative.

The food is always fairly great and I love this location. The only trouble I have is the gross restroom which appears to be clean but has a RANK ODOR like the plumbing has exploded right under the floor/tiles. There is no attempt to hide it either and I have experienced during my last several visits. Why won't the management do something? I've mentioned it before.... I love this place but I guess I'll just drive farther away to another location.

Cluster. Don't come here. Go to Main Street Burger or Happy Dog in Los Gatos or Big Basin Burger Bar in Saratoga instead of this place. Arrived at Red Robin for pre graduation ceremony. Waited 30 minutes to get seated. Sat in booth for 20minutes without any waiter even looking at us. No one gave us water. Used the "Call Server" on Kiosk TWO TIMES so we could order burgers. No one came. Our party was Completely IGNORED.  We walked out. They didn't notice!! Never coming back to this ridiculous place again.

Waited 40 minutes for a table. When we were seated the place was less than half full. Servers just standing around. The bottomless fries were under cooked and to try and get more of them was next to impossible. The server was nice enough, just super slow. Our burgers were cold when we got them and the buns were mushy. Will never be back here again, too bad.

Walked in around 9pm. Ordered food by 9:15pm. Didn't get food until 9:50pm. Waiter brought our meal in three separate parts. Order was wrong on both plates: my friend's beacon/lettuce wrap burger didn't have beacon, and my "flaming hot" burger wasn't even mildly spicy, not in the least. Other tables got their food before us, despite us ordering 10-15 minutes before them. We didn't ask for anything special, just regular burgers and fries with water. It was only my friend and I, TWO people.  Our waiter tried to make up excuses like "oh we start cleaning the kitchen around 9:30pm so the cooks were busy," "it takes a while to cook burgers," and other lame ways of avoiding the fact the service is just terrible. There were only about five other tables eating in the entire restaurant and just as many employees working as there were customers inside. What a joke. I spoke to the manger and he asked me how he could remedy the situation. Since I'm not looking for handouts, I simply requested they improve the service and he said they were working on it.  Don't bother eating here.

We used to like this location..Maybe they are way understaffed? The service is horrible...bottomless fries? Ha you're lucky if you get any ..The wait time for your food is so long you'd think you were at a gourmet place ..no refills on drinks blah blah ...really don't think it's the fault of the servers just believe they don't have enough...they really need to get it together

Haven't been to Red Robin in a long time and the restaurant hasn't gotten any better. I had the black and blue burger with a lettuce wrap, we shared a half stack of onion rings, and I had garlic fries. Our food took forever to arrive, all at once. It took a while longer for our utensils. The onion rings where the best part of dinner. The meat in my burger was cooked to cardboard consistency, there was only a hint of blue cheese and mushrooms. I couldn't finish it, it was that bad. The fries were very greasy and not very garlicky. The worst was my wife's Caesar salad. When it arrived we all looked at the waiter and said we asked for a Caesar. This was a plate of shredded iceberg with diced tomatoes on top and a sprinkle of cheese. Not sure where they got the recipe but they need to rethink it.

My family and I went here last Saturday, it was not busy at this time. When they took us to a table we waited, then waited, then waited some more. After 25 minutes at our table, no waiter came up asking us for water or any other drinks. So we got and walk to the door to leave, the manager was there and said to "have a nice night"  Why would u care, we sat our table for 25 minutes and no waiter came to take our orders. The manger said " it happens, see ya." Poor service, would never give them money again. The one in santa clara is soo much better

It's always a hit or miss at this location. Most of the time I get really good service and the food is super good. For my drink I always get the freckled lemonade and for the food I'll switch around all the time and try different things on the menu. But the onion ring tower is a must every time! Good for groups - I would come here with coworkers and the waiters were always great with getting orders correct and separating the checks.  The reason I'm giving it a three is because one time I went in and it was fairly busy but not to the point where it was chaotic. My friend and I ordered and our waiter was very rude and didn't get any orders right. He spilled my friend's drink all over the table and didn't even offer her a new one or clean up the spill. He also gave us the wrong order and when we told him that he got very defensive, rolled his eyes and left. I spoke to a manager who was able to get us the correct orders and took out the charges for the previous orders.

Came here after the 4th of July parade and thought what a better place to celebrate America's birthday than at a burger place?! Got some seats outside and environment was pretty good. The food was good, but the main thing that was annoying was the service. It's slow and our server forgot to come back with our fries. We even saw another table next to us leave because they waited so long to be help and no server came by...
Red robin went out of their way to find out why I was unhappy, so I think that is worth a lot, changing to 3 stars.

Although our server was good the food had left me wondering why would I come back to spend $40 for 2 adults and a child. We got a salad arhat had brown pieces of lettuce and at best maybe a half chicken breast. I had a wedge chicken sandwich where I got charged extra for asking to put on a condiment! And $$4.50 for a flavored lemonade that looked like Minute Maid pink lemonade and tasted like it too. The only reason this got 2 stars was our server was nice and accommodating and endless fries.  Did I forget to mention the kids grilled cheese came with one end piece of the loaf on it? Who does that? If I am paying top dollar for the meal I expect the best part of the bread!  Not a place I will come to again. Definitely has gone down a lot since it has changed their set up. Boo red robin my kid loves this place but not taking him here anymore.
worst food i've had in awhile. Stay away. Jack in box would have been better.

Came here with a couple friends to celebrate a late birthday.  Our waiter was nice and the food was fine. The reason for the low rating is that my friend had kindly asked our waiter for a small birthday special since we were celebrating.  After paying the bill on the tablet, the waiter didn't show around to thank us for dining and completely forgot about the birthday special. This sounds pretty bratty, but when you come in to a place to celebrate with friends, you expect the service to follow through.  She could have asked me for an I.D or anything to prove my birthday was a while ago. Pretty upsetting that the service at the end of the meal didn't follow through. Our waiter didn't seem like she appreciate our business.

Came here on 7/11/2016. Sat in the Bar very busy only one server for the bar and patio. Server was great other wise this restaurant is the dirtiest Red Robin I have ever been to. Condiments are greasy, dirty with food all over them. Fries always take forever to get to your table, food was not HOT! Fries also tasted like cleaner or something just gross. This Red Robin has been the worst for years. Had to drive 10 miles to get a GREAT meal at the Rivermark Red Robin. Sad that I have to drive 10 miles when I could walk to a Red Robin that is close to me. To bad I would not send my worst enemy to the El Paseo Red Robin.

Ring ring ring. Tv tv tv. Buzz buzz. Table is ready. Loud loud loud. Action action action. Look over there. Now over here. Something to drink?  Bang bang crash. Can I take your order?  Boxing on that screen over there. Informercial on this tv. Kids playing games on $1.99 screen at the table. Too loud to talk. So much going on.  I always like my burger at this and other Red Robins, but it is never a calm or relaxing experience. Lots going on.

We go to this location frequently but the service and "mood" of the people working here has gone downhill. We arrived tonight were not greeted but instead felt like we were inconveniencing the "hostess" (um isn't that her job to greet people when they walk in) instead we got an attitude and were asked how many and asked my name. My stepdad uses a walker as she could clearly see and when she asked us if we wanted s booth I asked for a table. Apparently that pissed her off as she rolled her eyes and put three tables together for us. I wish that was the end of the bad experience but it wasn't. We then waited about 15-20 minutes for our server to ask us for drink orders or just to come by and say that she would be right with us. Nope. I went to the bar and got our own drinks. She finally showed up and took the rest of the drink orders. She then took our food order. But didn't come by to see if we needed refills or anything.  Then we are done with our meal and had to wait forever for the check. I ask for the computer and she said that our table didn't have one. Ugh!  I gave up and we left. Horrible experience!  Next time we will drive a little farther and go to Applebee's. I don't like the food as well but at least we won't be treated rudely!!

Right out the gate, server didn't get to us for almost 20 minutes for drink order. Fairly unprofessional when finally showing up. Food was kind of overpriced for what it was. Had to repeatedly ask for basics, i.e. Napkins, utensils. Pretty much not worth it.

Just ordered our meal with my granddaughters let's see how it goes. I ordered a lettuce burger, first time trying it lets see how taste. So the verdict is Great lettuce burger . My granddaughter like her teriyaki burger so would definitely come back. The wait was about 20 minutes which as we all know is pretty good, the hostess did a great job moving the tables

Horrible service! Not a place I would spend a dollar at. All the servers seem so annoyed while helping you. The wait time is always long and you're never guaranteed an actual wait time. Every time I have come to this location my food seems to get worse and worse. The food always comes out cold and never taste right.
This evening I ordered to go. A patty melt with fries, a cheeseburger with fries and a onion ring. Food was delicious! The only problem I have is paying $40.00 for 2 burgers!

The service was off the hook and the food was good our server was very attentive. And pretty :) the dishwashers were cool aswell they didnt let our dishes pile up and the place looked clean and organized

My first time at any Red Robin and oh boy will I never be back. The chef and waitstaff repeatedly told me the Boca Burger was gluten free, but it definitely is not and I had to show them my google results to convince them. Trying to get them to make anything vegetarian and gluten free was like pulling teeth. I asked repeatedly for the fancy grilled cheese they make on a gf bun. Finally they said ok, but they brought out a dry bun with two pieces of American cheese that they had microwaved.  What kind of meal is that?   The kid's grilled cheese, that's what. And not even with the side of fries it's supposed to come with... I sent it back and eventually they at least put a couple kinds of cheese on the dry bun... The only good thing I have to say is that we didn't pay for the meal.  So there's that.

I usually don't give 1 star reviews, because I think it is really hard to be that bad, but my visit to Red Robin left me feeling very unhappy. First of all, it is clear that the restaurant is pretty understaffed. There was a decently long wait to be seated, despite available booths, and the process of ordering/getting our food/getting refills took a while too. This is not a deal breaker, and i am okay with waiting. The big problem occurred with the food itself. I ordered the Chicken Bruschetta. It looked perfectly fine when it arrived. If it wasn't for the fact that I was sharing with my sister and had to cut it in half, I would not have noticed the fact that the chicken was HALF RAW. This was no little bit of pinkness, it looked as if they completely failed to cook half the chicken. I just don't know how they could have made such a huge mistake.  After discovering this, because service was so slow, it took a while to wave down our server to get this issue fixed. Our waitress was so apologetic--I don't blame her--but honestly I feel like they should have offered to waive our check for this kind of mistake. Instead, they said they would bring me out a new one--they did, but they brought fries instead of onion rings (which I had ordered). I would've let this pass since I felt bad the waitress was so busy, but honestly they were still making me pay the extra so I was going to get my moneys worth. Furthermore, we asked if it was possible to change the channel on the TV. Not a big deal if they wouldn't do it, but the problem was that they said they would and they never did. Not very happy about that either. In the end, the food was decent, and our waitress did try to make things up for us by being more attentive after the incident. However, I personally believe that there shouldn't have been this problem in the first place. Imagine if I hadn't shared with my sister, I would've just eaten the chicken raw...
Service a bit slow but waiter(s) attempted to be quick as possible.  Just tried the robin Royal. It's fricken yum!!!
It's a Red Robin, people, it's not Morton's.  It's a clean, air conditioned place to get a drink before going to the AMC Saratoga theater across the parking lot.

We went to this place last night and we all developed stomach bug! We ate there around 7:30pm and when we arrived home around 9:45pm, our stomach started to feel very uncomfortable, we had diarrhea late in the evening and today. Till now when I am writing this post, I still have very upset intestine. And I think it entered my milk too cuz my 4 month old EBF baby also fuzzed and cried the whole evening last night and had mild diarrhea today. Poor baby.  Besides the food poisoning I am complaining, their service is bad too, they have a lot of empty tables, but they make us waited 30 mins to be seated, and they assigned us a table just right next to the restrooms. They didn't even consider that the table is poor to a family with a little baby. Food served very slowly. And our whole family got stomach bug after that.

~9:00 PM: Hubby and I arrived here a little past 9:00 PM and there were probably about 7 tables in the restaurant. No one in the front to seat so we waited...and waited.  9:03 PM: I had that awkward moment where you try to make eye contact with any of the workers but they don't want to help you so they pretend they're washing the tables. -____-''  9:07 PM: Finally, someone comes to seat us 9:12 PM: Waiting for our server to come and take our order. Once we finally came by, we ordered everything. Two burgers and sweet potato fries + a light lemonade. 9:13 - 9:45PM: WAITING....for all items except out drinks 9:45 PM: Burger comes out lukewarm...but steak fries come out piping hot.  I asked what type of dipping sauce they had. The waiter said "we have a lot." He brought out two salad dressings and two other sauces. I asked for the Chipotle sauce but it would cost 75 cents. That's more expensive than McDonald's!! All times are estimates... except the time the food came out is accurate as I was starving. I was constantly checking the time as I could not believe how long it was taking for the food to come out. Overall, the lack of service and the cold food has solidified the fact that I will not be returning. I wanted to give it another shot only because the place is a 2 minute drive from my house. I left feeling so disappointed and had wished that I had gone to Umami burger where the burgers are half the size, but 100% more satisfying.

I'm usually not the type to complain but today's visit was horrible. First off the food was cold. Second off they messed up my order and took forever to bring my fries and fix my salad. And it also took WAY too long for the check. Not coming back to this location.

I'm disappointed with this location.  Seeing my older review from 2014 on Yelp was actually helpful, a good reminder of that experience shows the place is hit or miss.  This place isn't always the best choice. Mediocre is the right label. My husband and I have gone to this location on numerous visits, but, the next time we want Red Robin, it will have to be the Rivermark location. The next time I'm near Westgate, I'll strongly consider other dining options. Our visit was tonight- Wednesday, Sept. 14th at 8:00.  We were seated in the coldest area of the restaurant- the central area near the window.  I asked if we could relocate- We normally sit near the bar, during afternoon hours.  When our waitperson (Jessica) asked what we wanted, my husband suggested that I needed a jacket. Jessica tells me the manager is busy in the kitchen, but will get to it when they get the chance.  It would have been nice if this mythical manager actually stopped by and acknowledged that there was a problem.  Our food came, and the fries were cold with my Arctic Cod burger.  My husband ordered fish and chips- the fish was soggy, and the four small pieces were buried in his cold fries.   Food would be classified as warm, but not hot.  Service was not stellar-it was okay, but, we only saw our server when she took our order and brought the food to the table.  We were near a semi-large group. It really wasn't that busy.  There were three people working at the maitre'd station, mostly having a conversation amongst themselves. It took awhile to get a refill on the drinks, and the replacement for the cold fries only came AFTER we finished our meals.  Same for drink refills. As far as observations on restaurant cleanliness, I noticed the tables outside that needed to be bussed when we came in, still needed attention as we were leaving.   As far as sitting at that cold table, I don't understand why we had to sit at that specific table other than the fact that table was in the zone for that waitperson. That situation could have been resolved in a personable fashion over the excuse of "We'll get to it when we can".   My guess is that the system cannot be adjusted.  My problem with this place is that I've had better experiences at this location.   Much better.  Enough that I normally ignore that the value of the food is overpriced for what is received.

Got the California Chicken burger ($11) with Garlic Herb Fries ($0.99) with Campfire sauce and it was so good, I bit myself twice. Well to be fair, I was pretty hungry too. But it was really good! The chicken stood out to me a lot and the upgraded fries was definitely worth. The fries itself is good too! Even better, you get unlimited refills. Though I don't think you'll really need more than one or two refills because the meal was really filling. The refill took a while to get here but the fries came out hot and crispy. Also tried the House Salad ($4) and Bowl of Clam Chowder ($5). They were both alright.

Bottomless fries. First thing I think about when coming to Red Robin. Unfortunately, it's not the burgers :( I love coming here just to scarf on those little fingers of crispy carbs. This particular location is right across from Westgate Mall and was busy, but not packed when I arrived with my daughter for a late lunch on a Saturday afternoon. We walk in and see the hostess moving at a snail's pace to get menus and escort a couple to their table. She looked at me and my first thought was, "Wow, is she in SLOW-MO?." Literally. She didn't greet us, didn't smile, or even say she'd be with us in a moment, she just blankly looked at us with an open mouth then very slowly turned away and started leisurely walking away. Even the couple following her to their table looked at each other befuddled at her sloth-like pace. Fortunately, at that moment another gentleman (likely a server) saw me with my jaw on the floor and said, "Oh sorry, let me help you get seated, table for 2?" So glad someone else came to seat us, or else we could have possibly been waiting quite some time for the hostess to slowly come back. We sat down and ordered our food. Food took a bit longer than expected to arrive.  Overall, it was the experience I expected. Good fries, OK burger, and service that you neither give kudos to nor complain about. Just a regular old American Diner experience.

Have not been to Red Robin in quite a while. Seated quickly and noticed that, in addition to condiments and menu at a small two top, there is some sort of tablet computer taking up room better reserved for other things. The waiter took our order, 2 burgers and 2 waters, and disappeared...for good. Another server dropped off the food.. The food quality would have rated 4 stars. The burgers were hot and so were the fries. A burger and fries used to come in a basket but now the fry serving is about half the size of the original and contained in a ring. Those quickly disappeared. Bottomless fries? Never offered nor were our waters refilled. The next interaction was still another waiter clearing our plates. May give them another chance later.

Red Robin is usually a pretty solid go-to place for medium speed burgers and grub.  Today was a 3-star type of experience however. Bummer.  We ordered the "Chili Chili Con Queso" and  the dip came out in a little bowl and was about a 1/4 inch deep. Hilarious. We spent the next five minutes laughing and deciding who would get to eat the next 4 bites. There was so little dip that we were looking for the hidden camera. Funny. Not $7 funny, but funny.  On to my (usually) favorite part of eating at Red Robbin's - the French fries! Today they were stale for lack of a better word. We tried a fresh basket and they were also stale.  Oh well. The burger was as expected but the fries were super sad.

We have been here a few times and usually there is something off! I am always excited about the consistency in the food and drink (although a little pricey for what you get).  The waiters and waitresses are noticeably interested in getting you in and out and the whole business is about that and not aiming for you to be pleased with your experience.  We also just went and were seated underneath an A/C unit. I went to go get reseated and the hostess said there is nothing she can do because there were no tables open. This was not true at all as there were 20 open tables at least! Instead of saying, let me see about that and I am sorry, she was curt and not helpful. When we left, the hostesses who were not busy at all, did not say thanks for coming. Isn't that their job?  I would pick another restaurant to go to in the area. Try veggie grill!
Ryan was  our waiter.   He very good  with what he  does.  He makes you feel  welcome.   Over the food is  pretty good.   Thanks  Ryan!

So Red Robin is not by any means a 'new' dining experience for me, and probably most of us out there, as it is not a new restaurant. What is new to me is the overall decline of customer service that has been sadly occurring in many like places (Buffalo Wild Wings, Mimis, Chilis, etc). My review is not about the food, because the food here is greasy good - so good in fact that after three consecutive bad trips I still have voted to go back for the promise of endless seasoned steak fries.  But lets talk about that for a minute - lets talk about the 'bottomless fries' premise. Now I don't know about you but when I hear the catch phrase 'bottomless fries' I am pretty excited and really do think I am about to do some real potato damage. The best part of that aside from the taste, is the fact that it is going to not only be an endorsed process but one that is facilitated with speed and ease for my consumption pleasure. But bottomless fry seekers beware....such is not the case. Red Robin has actually found the ingenious formula of attracting customers with the sly fry claim while gently folding in some basic satiating know-how. What ever you had in mind about bottomless fries let me tell you what actually happens. Your burger will arrive to the table with your first side of fries that is usually served in a little tea cup size metal 'holder' meant to jazz up the presentation and keep the fry portion to a minimum. Keep in mind these are steak fries so they take up some room. All said and done, you get a burger with roughly the amount of fries it takes to fill up a toddler. Then your server walks away leaving you fry-less by burger bite 4 and you are in your mind thinking "Its ok that she hasn't came back yet and Im almost done eating - they are bottomless". Minutes will start to overlap and you are now fully done with your burger and your drink is gone (long gone if you have a man that drinks like mine does) in desperate need of a refill. Finally just before you contemplate asking another waitress if you can get help your server will return and you will ask for more fries. Five minutes later they will return with a wire basket containing 10 fries all laid out flat on the serving basket to give the appearance of being full. Now if something is such a big selling point for you, like oh I dont know.....fries, then wouldn't you have a whole lot of fry action going on in the kitchen? My point is that even with the initial disappearance of your server once you do ask for the fries shouldn't they be there in way less than 5 min? Enter the trickery of the fry catch. By intentionally making you wait for the fries by spacing out the arrival of the fries one of two things is going to happen. One, your stomach will cue the brain that the parties over and you are full or two you are just going to get tired of waiting for fries in increments of 10. And just like that they have served you one or two servings of fries, making good on that bottomless promise.  But that was a rant and not even what this review is about - ok so basically here it is quickly. The service is just plain bad. Your server really does disappear on you and often your needs are just not met. On Saturday we went in early at about 5pm and were seated within about 5 min. We then sat at our table for about 17 min watching employees walk around, make small talk by the drink machine and seat other guests who had their beverages on the table within minutes. My husband wanted to go but I wanted to see who was actually supposed to be our server. Low and behold it was someone that walked by us countless times. Now I understand  being busy, so much so that the simple "I'll be right with you" would have shut  me up but over 10 min? I mean come on. So our server finally approaches and I just asked if I could talk to the manager. I know - I have become that person lol.....anyways she walks away, goes up to the manager and I see her laughing a little with him cause you know, that's always cool to do, and then he comes to the table. I told him what happened and that we were just going to leave but that he should be aware of what is happening on his watch - not that he seemed to care much. He then tells me to wait a minute because he wanted to give me a coupon for 'next time'. He then comes back with two 'Free $3 or $5 appetizer coupons' which was nice of him but basically means I can get fried jalapeno coins or the chips & salsa, and if you have ever had those here can probably agree should be free as it is so.....yeah. It was just a bummer all around having to get my newborn (not the easiest task) and go to a different place.  Case in point: If you want a burger really bad that is not from a drive through, have extra time, no kids, like being ignored and don't really like fries this place will work for you.

Worst service experience we had in the US so far. We literally gave 0 tip. And normally we are easy on 20% tip for a nice service. The seating personal was absolutely overwhelmed. We waited more than 20 minutes - 10 of them in front of 5 empty tables. And we were only a party of two. Even after being seated nothing happened for a long time. No server passed by while 4 tables were waiting to order. When the server finally arrived we directly ordered drinks and entree. We left the appetizer out to not risk waiting a long time for our main course. While we were waiting for our order people even started seating themselves. Guess that tells a lot. Luckily, you can pay at the table here. So, after finishing our burgers we could leave quickly.

This is probably the worst place to eat in the area.The burgers are good enough but it really lacks in customer service. So as you come in they always are going to tell you the wait is over 15 minutes even if there are 10 empty tables in plain view.Then you proceed to sit in the waiting area and you feel like your in that in the scene from Beetlejuice when they are sitting in the afterlife lounge and all those weird people are around them(which isn't Red Robin's fault of having that clientele it's just the area). Your then seated and ignored for another 15 minutes as the crew walks by you multiple times looking but not making eye contact as if amongst themselves they are deciding who is going to get stuck with you.Its like when your in school and your picking teams for a sport and it's down to you and the other kid who is not really good and they just settle for you.If your privileged enough to be served high five yourself!!! I ordered a drink an chips and they proceeded to bring me my drink promptly and a fancy bowl sculpture with about 5 chips on it.I then played trivia on the little tablet thing and like always looked around the restaurant to see if I could recognize who I was destroying in movie trivia.My burger arrived and it was good but kinda tiny(oh well it was good so I can't complain). Then I asked for a refill of my bottomless fries after I devoured my plate of 7 fries and they proceeded to bring me out another plate of 4 fries in another fancy sculpture bowl.Nice try Red Robin!!!distracting me with a fancy bowl.Why do they advertise bottomless fries and then they hoard their fries like a leprechaun and his pot of gold? Its too bad because when you cut through everything the food is good it's just a restaurant with quality food but a lack of customer service

The coleslaw was a huge disappointment...tasteless. The chicken teriyaki barely had any teriyaki sauce as well. The iceberg lettuce in it was also very unappealing. The fries were not offered in generous portions, nor was the tasteless coleslaw.

About a month ago, our group of five decided to go to Red Robin for dinner.  As usual, we had to wait awhile to be seated.  This was expected and not a problem.  When we were seated, we didn't see our waiter for quite awhile.  When he finally showed up, he took our drink and food orders.  The drinks showed up about 15 minutes later.  Dinner showed up about 10 minutes later.  Two of the meals were incorrect and had to be sent back.  One because he asked for no mayo, and it had mayo.  When he got his "new" hamburger, it was the old one with a new bun, however, the hamburger was now cold.  But, all the other burgers were only luke warm. The second meal was sent back because gluten free was ordered due to allergies and that's not what she got.  Her new meal showed up when the rest of us were almost finished.  However, the worst thing about the meals were the fries.  They were awful, hard and dry.  We asked for a new batch of fries and was told that "they are all that way, we are having a problem with the supplier".  Well, the fries are why we go to Red Robin.  I don't know why they would serve fries that they knew were bad.  I think they should have told us prior to ordering that they were having problems with the fries.  We could have ordered something else, like onion rings.  So, we didn't eat much of the "all you can eat fries" because they were inedible.  Also, just about when we were about to leave, our server asked if we wanted refills on our drinks.  By then, we just wanted to leave.  This has to be the worst experience we've had at Red Robin.  None of us are planning to go back anytime soon.  By the way, I did send an email to the corporation regarding the awful fries.  Their response, "we will forward the email to the manager".  That's the last I've heard.  So, the restaurant management doesn't care and neither does the corporation.

Came here Friday night with my teenage son and 2 yo granddaughter per the request of my son for bottomless fries. There was a 20 minute wait which was to be  expected. I asked the hostess for a high chair which seemed to confuse the hostess but she brought one anyway. We got drinks right away and ordered our food. I ordered the baby a kids meatball meal with broccoli as her side. Our food came and they decided to put fries on her plate as well. I was trying to get something healthy in her instead of fries. Oh well, once she saw those there was no interest in her other food. Everything else is what you expect from this chain.

My wife and I recently ate at this restaurant for dinner.  Our hamburgers were good, but not great. The service was even less impressive. It was obvious our server doesn't like her job. She seemed disinterested in waiting on us. Once she served us, she never came back to check on us. We were so unimpressed with our server, that we are not likely to go back again. Red Robin used to be our favorite place to go to for onion rings and delicious bottomless fries, but the bad service is enough to keep us away.

The hamburger was excellent as usual. I would have rated a 4 or 5 but the staff has lowered the rating I give for the last few times I've been here. In the past, it was slow service and errors on our order. Tonight it was 2 REALLY LOUD employees in the bar area. They talked for a long time and it was louder than the music!! Tip, don't annoy your customers! It'll be a while before I come back and I'll miss the burgers... :^(

I was craving Red Robin so I made the trek out to West San Jose on my day off. The experience was terrible and I won't be going back anytime soon. What used to be a consistent, reliable chain restaurant is now just a mess. First, I was seated at a table with a menu that was missing pages and it was the pages with all of the hamburgers on it. The place was busy and our waitress was slammed, even at 1:45pm on a Tuesday afternoon. When our food finally arrived, it was terrible. The fries were cold and limp. I got the Southern Charm burger that was barely warm and had no flavor. I couldn't taste the bbq sauce or onions on it. There was no ketchup on the table and the waitress didn't come around for another 7 minutes to get more ketchup, take an order for more fries and refill our beverages. It took another 10 minutes for our fries to arrive despite the waitress claiming that all of the "fryers have been fired." The interior was not very clean and seemed very worn. It was super noisy even though the restaurant was half empty. Thank goodness our server was a rockstar and hustled. She was the only part of this situation that worked. Everything else was awful. I definitely won't be coming back to this location anytime soon.

This is the worst Red Robin location. The first time I came the service was horrible and the food was soggy/cold. I thought I would give it a second chance coming in today, but nothing changed. Very disappointing compared to the Rivermark location. NEVER coming back to this location.

I really don't like Red Robin, and today's trip reminded me of that.  After waiting 20 minutes for a table, we were seated.  And then we waited.  And waited.  And waited for anyone to stop by to take our order.  Or even alone ask us what we wanted to drink.    When we finally got our orders in, they cooked my wife's hamburger wrong, and missed one of my items entirely.   The music was too loud for me, as well.      I won't be coming back.

An hour wait for cold food. ("The kitchen is backed up" - then why is the food cold?! And how is the kitchen backed up EVERY time we've been there. Normally they just pull the "aw, the kitchen is backed up, sorry we couldn't get your free fry refill out before you got fed up and left" crap.)

Ok but why are Red Robin burgers sooooo.. squishy? Other than that, I enjoy this place. I compare it to Johnny Rockets, Peggy Sue's, etc. An American themed restaurant w/ classics such as burgers, grilled cheese, etc. The unlimited fries really get me because fries are my favorite food. Sometimes on my lunch break I just order fries, 2.16$ I would come back for Ryan & Cassie in a heartbeat. They're amazing employees, working quickly and diligently.

Worst service experience! Had a bad experience before at this location but that was for a big group, but this time it was just 4 of us. I had to literally get up three times to go and call for someone to serve our table. The waitress was rude and least interested in looking after refills or clearing items. I think this was the last time we go here! The Red Robin's in Santa Clara is better.

If you want to sit in the bar to catch the game, it's a great place to do so.  If you want great service, just deal with the bartender, everyone else is useless!  you'll be waiting 15-20 for your order.

Dang! I haven't been to Red Robin in years and ran across this one while out shopping. I had the grilled cheese with turkey and avocado and it was amazing! Service was fantastic - everyone was super friendly and my waitress was the best. Luckily this place isn't too close to me or I would be here way too often!
David the server gave us the BEST SERVICE out of over 30+ times eating here. His manager Samantha came by and she was very nice and professional too. THANKS DAVID!!

I had stopped going to Red Robin for quite some time because of the horrible service. A friend had just gotten back from out of town and we went for dinner, still horrible Service, Plus after an hour and a half our food arrived, COLD! Plus the bathroom was disgusting. I am not going back, ever.

Came because i heard great things and i show up and tried to to get on list and they  told me that it was going to be an hour wait to get a table and 45 minutes after I get my table to get my food because the kitchen is not caught up and that they've been busy all day that is not acceptable. And I can clearly see 6 vacant tables. That's lazy, or bad management

The food is great and the menu is creative..  The bottomless fries will definitely fill you up..  Just sucks the holiday rush is blowing up the wait time for food..  This time we snuck into the bar so we sat quickly but the food did take sometime..

Horrible experience. The hostess was terrible. She initially said it would be a 15 minute wait even though there were at least 10 open tables visible from the waiting area. We ended up waiting over 30 minutes. The dining area was ridiculously cold and none of our parties food was even warm. For a place that serves bottomless French fries how are they not at least warm? This is suppose to be their thing. I used to like this place. I will never come here again. Red Robin .... Dummmmm!

It was not busy when we were there for lunch between Xmas and New Years. The hostess was attentive and seated us quickly. Otherwise, the service was slow it took quite a while for the food to come out.  When burgers and fries came out, nothing wasn't very warm.  The fries were barely warm and quite undercooked - pale without a crispy skin. Who cares about getting "bottomless" fries when they are soggy? The burgers were - odd. They tasted okay, but they completely fell apart as we ate them. The buns crumbled in our hands and the meat broke into chunks. ??? Although not busy, it was hard to hear across our small table as the place is really noisy. Since there were so few people in our section, I almost wondered if they played a recording to make it sound busier and livelier?
Best burgers, great fish and chips..good pricing. I'm a fan of the cheeseburger and fried mushroom with lots of ranch

Wow. Don't know where to start. We found a small piece of metal in our fries to start. The server wasn't apologetic and offered nothing as compensation. We didn't ask for any either.  The fries themselves were cold and stale.  The burger was also slightly cold and tasted unusually bland for a Red Robin burger. The fries were also soggy and undercooked. Then, two employees were on the patio. They stared me down the whole time. I asked what the problem is, and they laughed. I'm sitting here waiting for my burger (it's been about half an hour and I'm hungry) but as I've been here many times before I feel like I can write an honest, although hunger-motivated review. The food here is mediocre, complex flavors and seasoning being replaced by cheese and bacon. The cocktails and alcohol-containing milkshakes contain very little alcohol and a lot of sugar.  So why, you ask, would I choose to come here rather than any of the gourmet burger options offered in the Bay Area? I have a very good reason: the steak fries and freckled lemonade. For someone who mocks the addition of sugar in all of our food, I cannot stop myself from ordering a freckled lemonade. Sometimes (today) they add less sugar and it is slightly sour and delicious. Other times it is diabetes in a cup, but every single time it is exactly what I want. They make it with vodka too but I haven't tried it; why mess with perfection?  Now the steak fries: I'm pretty sure they contain recreational drugs as a seasoning (can I say crack on yelp?) Every few months I CRAVE these amazing bits of salty goodness smothered in ranch dressing (I clearly have a very refined palate) and these fries are the actual reason I will ALWAYS come back to Red Robin.  So if you're looking for a gourmet burger, go somewhere else. But if you're looking for a mediocre meal with the best fries and freckled lemonade ever, come stand in line for a half hour, wait for your food for another 45 minutes, and enjoy!
