When you were a kid (assuming you aren't any longer), did you ever have such a dreadful experience at a restaurant that you promised yourself you wouldn't eat there again? To me, that experience was at Red Robin Gourmet Burgers. When I was in middle school (or was it high school??), I had eaten at the Red Robin near my house for the very first time; I really didn't like their burgers one bit and decided I would never visit a Red Robin ever again. The only positive thing out of that experience was that they had decent fries.  Fast forward about 10 years and I've kept up my promise to avoid Red Robin. But that all changed when I decided to give it another try since my girlfriend got a free deal through their birthday rewards (basically if it's your birthday month, you can get any free burger from "gourmet burger" section). We ended up going to the one in San Jose. The Red Robin Gourmet Burgers that we went to was on El Paseo de Saratoga within the Westgate shopping plaza. Since it's a huge mall, there should always be plenty of parking. Getting here is also very easy because the plaza is nearby major streets (like San Tomas Expressway and Saratoga). I recommend coming slightly before you get hungry because wait times can be long. Even though it was a Monday night around 630pm, we had to wait approximately 15 minutes before getting in. And it would also take us around 20 minutes to actually get our food.  If you have never been to Red Robin Gourmet Burgers before, this restaurant is another one of those big burger chains that you see on T.V. and everywhere you go. As the name suggests, this restaurant specializes in fat, juicy burgers with a variety of different ingredients. Their burgers are split between the classic gourmet burgers (like the guac bacon and the original), and their finest burgers (fancier burgers with ingredients like arugula). In terms of pricing, Red Robin is a bit more expensive than most burger chains for what you get (more on that later), but one reason why people keep coming is because of their unlimited steak fries (they come with each meal and you can substitute for other type of fries for more $$). I ended up getting the Burnin' Love and my girlfriend got the Guacamole Bacon. -Burnin' Love (6/10). First off, I give props to Red Robin for actually putting some spice in this burger. Usually, most restaurants are flaky with their "spicy" burgers, but this one packed some heat. I love the idea of frying the jalapenos and placing one right on top of the burger. However, the burger falls really short: The patty was super small and not that juicy. It looked and tasted more like a charbroiled diner style burger (something you see at In n Out), which was disappointing as it should have been bigger. Plus, they don't have a medium rare option! And furthermore, the lettuce was very, very meh. They used sliced lettuce which probably came from a giant pack. Why not use a large slice of iceberg lettuce? I mean you clearly have some if it's on your wedgie burger picture? But all in all, this wasn't a "bad" burger per say. I feel like it didn't meet my low expectations.  -Guac Bacon (7/10). Though the Guac Bacon burger has the same shortcomings as the above, at least they had a very large helping of guac to make up for the meh patty. I love the bacon in there, even though it wasn't crispy. All in all, I probably would've gotten this one instead. Or maybe the swiss mushroom..  -Steak Fries (9/10). To be honest, I'd probably come to Red Robin just for their steak fries. They are HUGE, super crispy, and warm. I recommend getting a refill/second batch because those are much hotter and crispier. That's because when you get your burger, the fries have been sitting since it takes longer to make a burger than fries. Thus, get the second batch!! All in all, I have to rate the food quality at Red Robin 3 stars at best. It was probably just as I'd remembered it as a kid. HOWEVER, the biggest redeeming factor of this place was the hella good service. First off, the waitress/waiter who were both serving us were super kind; they kept asking if everything was okay. They also processed our checks very fast. And second, the boss was SO HELPFUL for getting my phone out of the little crevice in the bench where I dropped it in. I was a bit distressed since I always do this to myself, but he was very kid to me. He jokingly asked for a $100 tip, and if I had that money, maybe I would. So for that, I end up giving Red Robin a "nice-su, you can take your parents here and they'll be happy." TBH my parents would probably be okay with this since they love good service. But if you want the creme de la creme of burgers, this Red Robin (or any for that matter) is not for you. Eat well and prosper,

Phenomenal service from our waitress Tiffany, if she hasn't been given a raise yet, she definitely deserves it. Came with two of my friends around 7:30-8:00, hoping for a good bite. We ordered two appetizers being the onion rings and the chips and dip. Both came out fairly quick and was super satisfying. About my meal, I had the french onion soup as well as the Garden Burger (got the veggie patty but you can opt out for the vegan boca). Can't say I remember the prices of my meal but it was phenomenal. The French onion was super creamy with the amounts of melted cheese that was on top and the veggie burger tasted healthier than I expected. Woo-hoo! I also ended up signing up for the Red Robin's rewards system which seemed to have great perks as you build up your criteria. Plus a free burger on your birthday month! Overall, super satisfied with the restaurant's hospitality, the steamin' food and the open environment to just enjoy a meal with friends. Second time at this location and both 5/5 stars, great job guys!

location: Central San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: We went on a Wednesday and it was crazy busy. That meant trying to get the attention of our waiter was rather difficult. But he was very nice to help us split our check 6 ways and give individual change.  I had the banzai burger and wow it was banzai. The bun was nice and thick and toasted well. The patty was juicy and well done. The pineapple wasn't I believe grilled, but it was warm and its flavor melded with the burger perfectly. I had heard the fries were super good, but I was a little let down by how dry it was--granted I didn't have ketchup.  All in all, I would come here again, but maybe not on such a busy night.

I ate the Red Robin classic hamburger and my friends ordered onion rings stack appetizer. I'm allergic to the onion rings bread crumb exterior or the oil they used! Unfortunately, I didn't notice until I left the place and went to another place. This shows that their oil used is not good for us because I am sensitive to the oil restaurants use in their food. I am definitely able to eat onion rings at different restaurants. The waiter thought my friend, her brother, and I were trying to save $ and gave us the onion rings for free. Great service and we tipped him 20-25%. Great waiter. Sadly, I won't return for another while.  ---------------------------------------- First time here! The red robin classic hamburger was great! The bottomless fries were worth it, hot and steaming! I'd come back here again and recommend this place to others. I'm thankful my friends introduced me to red robin's!

I have been to this establishment a handful of times and have not had a problem. Today, I had the misfortune of meeting their bartender, Eric.I waved him down and he made clear eye contact with me. I was sitting less than 5 feet away from him. There is no doubt in that he saw me.  The second time I approached him, I greeted him politely (even asked him how his day was going) to try to reset the situation... and he still acted as though I horribly offended him. He was short with his reply and refused to stop to even take my order. Red Robin, I would highly recommend training your front of house staff on proper etiquette with customers.  I did not stay. I will not be coming back, nor will I recommend coming here.

I took my 2 sons here for lunch today.  We were seated by a very nice hostess.  20 minutes later, not one server came to our table.  Server on one side of us made eye contact with me, but still did not come over.  The other server on the other side of us, also did not check on us.  We have been to this restaurant many times and this was the first time I was thoroughly unpleased.  It wasn't even a busy day.  Normally parking isn't that easy for me because I have a big SUV, but this time, there were many stalls to choose from.  Other times, we normally have to wait about 10 minutes before sitting, this time, we were seated immediately.  I could not take it anymore.  I gathered our menus and told my sons that if the waiter next to me does not give us some sort of recognition, we are out of here.  He ignored us once again.  I took the menus to the hostess and told her that we were not being waited on, so we are leaving.  We then went to BJ's for lunch today and had excellent service and food.

A wise man once said, "Are you ready to order, sir?" to which I replied, "Only if you're on the menu."   That wise man was our server for the night, David.  Thanks to David, I enjoyed both a five star dinner and an enchanting evening. (The only reason I didn't give a full five stars is because the fries weren't the only thing bottomless)
Server was rushing me asked for no lettuce  or tomato  had it on the burger asked for ranch never got it she was  mire helpful to a large group disappointed with the service

location: South San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: This place always seems understaffed. Giovanna is great in the bar, there's also a male bartender that does great but don't remember his name. Still works as a great spot before catching a movie at AMC.

The food quality has taken a downhill slide.  I used to like their food, but haven't been there for a year.  Went last week and was so disappointed.  The only thing that was good was the fries and the beer.  Ordered a cup of chicken tortilla soup (served in a saucer! smallest serving ever!), pretzel bites (cold cheese and bites tasted like they were microwaved), chips and salsa (the salsa was so watery!) and an original burger (the burger was so overcooked!) with fries.  We were starving and just looking to get into air-conditioning that we thought we had a sure bet  eating at Red Robin.  It was busy and took a while to get a table and then to receive our drinks after ordering.  But the waitstaff looked very overworked and I didn't want to complain about the food.  I didn't think that almost every dish I ordered was going to be terrible.  It's a bummer.  The place was busy and when we left there was a long wait so I'm sure there won't be any difference with my review, but thought I should let others know.

I have come to this Red Robin since it opened.  When it opened, the burgers were fresh, hot and juicy.  Service was great, the servers got the order right and had no problem bringing you fries while you waited for your food and chilled with family. For the last 3-4 years the burgers have been cold or over done and it's taken AT LEAST 40 mins to get a burger out of the kitchen. When I ask where our meal is, after 30 mins usually, these are the frequent excuses: 1) sorry, the kitchen is really busy. 2) the fries are still cooking 3) we are really short on fries and you can only have one basket. 4) oh sorry there are empty tables but the wait is 20 mins because we are short servers.  8-10 other people waiting too. 5) oh sorry its taking so long for your server to come over for the first time, we have a few called in sick. 6) many, many issues that are simple with orders being correct...changing to a ciabbata bun, getting regular bun.  extra onions requested, no onions on burger.  No relish/spread requested, it has it on there!  Plain bacon cheese burger ordered, no bacon on burger!   7) sorry we are training a new cook.  The experienced one quit yesterday!  Seriously no one else knows how to cook a silly burger and fries??!! Whoever manages this place really is gonna lose their shirt soon when Steak and Shake opens, already smash burger is open and there are 3 other burger places taking share away from the Red Bird. I like Red Robin.  I really do.  But its time for the eagle to come in and clean house, hire the right management, to train the right staff.  Being under employed when people are looking for work is no excuse.  Get a bigger fryer and anticipate the fry volume better.  Fries sell drinks!  I cant enjoy fries without a drink and you charge $3.25 for a coke.   Figure it out!   Cook fresh burgers and dont let them sit under the warmers!   Its all basic stuff and if it isnt fixed soon, this bird will be extinct!   PS, never, ever, get rid of the baseball american flags!

This place can be a hit or miss, and Saturday's dinner was definitely a MISS. We got there around 4:45, so I wasn't expecting service to be slow. Took about 10 minutes for our server to greet us after being sat. I ordered a simple chicken, lettuces wrap sandwich. Delicious. No problems there. But hubby's food on the other hand, unacceptable. He ordered a bacon cheeseburger from the gourmet section, and that's where things went very wrong. His patty was BURNt!! Wtf. Shame on you cooks for having the balls to serve it. Then they had the brilliant idea to have the burned part of the patty turned over because you know, we wouldn't be able to taste the burnt-ness that way.  We let our server know right away (which took another 3 minutes or so because I flagged her down), and she swapped it out for us.  Will we be back? Probably. Only because we live close by.

Honestly, never a fan. Been twice,this location only. Friend treating, 3rd time's the charm?? Noon, Saturday. Not too busy (yet!). Had a great little server (mention only in case others by name), Steven. All the order was correct, including no salt fries. He asked also about the burger, I had not considered! Shows he's on his toes...so to speak. Food hot. Ice cream cake very good also. Steven had a wonderful personality!! He really made a great experience, along with pretty good eats. Now, I'll be back. Thanks Steven! (Btw, packed when we left at 1pm)
Fried pickles were burnt, service was extremely slow while there were plenty of empty tables, and fries were soggy. Not coming back to this location.

SCOTT is the BEST! Who would think you could get big juicy awesome restaurant quality burgers for LESS than Carl's or Wendy's or Jack? I cant believe their prices are so cheap for high quality burgers and perfect classic french fries!  Their 'To Go" service is great! Have you ever placed an order on the phone or online and you worry about forgetting something? Scott is so thorough and helpful. This was our first time back at Red Robin after many years. He took our phone order, made AWESOME recommendations. I even ended up going online to sign up and get a free burger on my birthday, The burgers were some of the best we have had anywhere!. I am really impressed and we plan to make them part of our dinner rotation that includes Giorgio's and Panda Express.  Red Robin is great food at great prices. I cant imagine ever buying another fast food burger again if there is a Red Robin near by.

This place is alright. We went at lunch time and it was quiet and we were seated at a nice booth. The server was pretty good. Our menus were sticky (that drives me nuts). My Southwest Sombrero salad was just okay - it had at least three large pieces of lettuce core in it, and I didn't realize until after we left that the fried jalapeño coins were missing. We had fried zucchini and fried mushrooms (so I really didn't need the fried jalapeños), which were really good. My friend had the Cobb Salad and she said it was okay. Nothing blows me away about this place. But it's in a good location with a ton of parking.

So we arrived and were told 30 minutes. After we were waiting more people who arrived after us were being sat first. I let it go once, but it happened 3 times. I walked up to the host station and asked why people who arrived after us were being seated, the host said " we sit bigger groups first" The server was good, he was slammed because they were short handed...

We always come back to this place cause the food never disappoints. The service is kinda a hit or miss, but tonight was definitely one of the best experiences yet. Regardless of the service, my family still considers this place to have some of the best burgers around. Our server Jessie, catered to all of our orders and was on top of everything.  Thank you Jessie, for an awesome experience, and good food too!

Red Robin isn't my go-to place to eat, but the boo and I decided to dine in last week. We were greeted and seated promptly. I usually experience long wait times here, so we already decided if there was a wait, then we would leave. We ordered the blue cheese burger with fries and the veggie burger with garlic fries. Both were good and reasonably priced, but nothing amazing. The garlic fries didn't come out until my bf was pretty much done with his burger, but they ended up giving us 2 baskets. Our server was attentive and apologized for the wait time on the fries. I do think their $6.99 burger with fries is a good deal. Just A-ok for me.
The worst service I have experienced. These guys are aversely understaffed. It takes 40 mins for them to get your order.  I have no idea why? The rivermark rr is so much better.

It's been years since I've been to a "Red Robin". I didn't have a lot of time. I sat in the bar for faster service. Once seated, I waited and needed to ask when someone would be taking my order. I asked a bus person and he went to ask. A huge "wow" as only a few minutes after the request, the hostess came by an apologized as the waitress/ waiter for my section had just gone home. A server promptly comes to take my order. She was friendly and appeared very knowledgeable. I did share I was in a hurry now. Four came very quickly as did the check . That is good customer service And the veggie burger with a side of onion rings tasted very good. Also, the restaurant was clean which is always appreciated.
My first time at Red Robin! Burgers were yummy and bottomless  fries are not bad at all! Had a Cobb salad that was quite good as well. Service was really good!

Terrible service Seriously I should not be waiting 15 minutes after they sent me down to order my food plus then we almost an half hour to get my food And never come back for refills on drinks!! The worst red Robin there is the manager don't give a shit about anything that's probably why the employees are slacking off! I will never go to this location again!! They make it worse I have my nephew with me!!

Great lunch today.  Daffne our server was really attentive, sweet and professional. It was so refreshing.  Plenty of places to eat these days, but when you have an excellent server, it makes all the difference.  Thank you!

I have usually had great service at Red Robin so I placed a to-go order online for two adult meals and two kids meals, no special requests. After driving around the parking lot for 20 minutes to find parking due to the lack of convenient to-designated parking spots, I arrived 10 minutes later than my confirmation stated the food would be ready. I walked to the to-go lit sign by the bar and was ignored by three servers. Finally, a server asked if I was picking up a to-go order and pointed me back to the hostess. I waited in line again only to be told my order would be another 5-10 minutes. I finally got my order 15 minutes later than I expected and not a single apology. Terrible service.

Last two times about 8/17 and 9/17 ish- the service and food was much improved.  I let the manager know we were happy personally.  Will be back - kids love this place so keep the parents happy because we pay the bill.

so I was eating there yesterday after watching a movie so I stopped by. it was not a good day. So I had soup and side salad. the salad was great oh yeah I was in the dark because there was no lamp. I witness other people who were sit in the dark. when they told the hostess they was to  it was an issue. The ice cream that I had was a melted version and the soup was so so. wow .

Worst place ... been here a few times but everytime they sucessfully mess up the order . Am a vegetarian and so is my family . Today was the last straw .. we ordered 3 vegetarian burgers (means vege pattie nd no meat ) aparently this restaurant doesnt knw wat tat means . They gave my son a beef patty .. nd i got mine with bacon strips !!  Seriously ??? BACON ??? I gave up .. 2 out of jus 3 ????  Either they have very very bad sevice or they jus dont care ! I dont knw ... but will never set foot in this restaurant ever !!!
This has good TVs at the bat. Bottomless fries are a bargain. Kids love the red balloons. Parking is pretty painless. The waiting area is a mess and small....wish bigger....especially on game days.
Hair in food, thanks Red Robin.  Not a very good Birthday dinner for my son. Not What you would expect from a $14.00 burger.

We were seated right away. The server was very friendly and extremely attentive. His name was Elliot. My friend enjoys coming to this particular Red Robin because it was the place of her first date  with her boyfriend. She recommended the pretzel bites because of the beer cheese it comes with. She was right, it was delicious! We ordered the bbq chicken wrap to share and they were accommodating because one of us wanted chicken and one of us didn't. We added avocado and this also was delicious! I did notice other tables were having difficulty with their orders being brought out. One table offered to pay $5 for their drink and wanted to cancel their order because of the long wait. Either my friend and I were not aware of the long wait or our server was just on top it! I had a pleasant experience and will probably come back.

Came here after my best friend's wedding! I had a bad experience at a different Red Robin location but since the bride and groom wanted Red Robin, I decided to give it another shot. BAD IDEA!! Apps never came out, asked if we could swap some side for fries was told there was an additional charge (no problem) but when the food came, NO FRIES! I sure got charged for them though. The kids plates (which did have fries) were COLD!! I mean COLD COLD!! really?? My burger was dry and overcooked. I had to go and find the waiter to get refills & ask to not be charged for the appetizers since we never received them!! I would have spoken to the manager about these issues but as I stated I was the driver and had the bride and groom with me who had to go get ready for their reception!! NEVER AGAIN RED ROBIN!! $100+ for bad service and worse food!!

It's a busy Monday at work, didn't have much time for a lunch so I ordered online. Went to pick up my food and everything was fine. Until I noticed my order is incorrect, called them right away and was told I would need to speak to a manager. No problem, spoke to Samantha and man does she have great customer service. This woman really knows how to take care of her customers. Thank you for helping me with my order situation! You deserve to get recognized for your work ethic! Hey Red Robin you have a great employee and she deserves a raise for it!!!

My fiancé and I went in for lunch the other day within fifteen minutes of them opening. We both ordered pretty basic stuff. She got a tavern burger with cheddar cheese. I got a blue ribbon burger on a regular bun and an ice tea.  The server says no problem it will be out shortly. No mind you I used to work for these guys in Alaska and when my uncle owned it it was a really great place and we were busy from open to close. This location maybe had 20 people in for lunch at best with in the first half hour. From the time we ordered to the time we were served, it took at least twenty minutes to see our server who told me the ice tea machine was having issues, it would be a few more minutes to get some tea. When she brought it to me it was like dirty water and had little to no tea flavor. But said it would get me started. I was not impressed.  Then our burgers came, the fries were ice cold and the burgers were like warm. Furthermore if you go into a place and they ask you for temp on a burger (some pink or no pink as the ask) than if you ask for some pink you should get what you order especially when the place is not busy. But instead my burger was cooked all the way through. A server there that we know got us one of the managers. They said they could remake. But we figured it took 30 minutes to get in the first place we were not going to wait another 30 minutes. Let alone pay for food we didn't order.  I mean how hard is it when you first open to not have the right food and drink ready and waiting. Is it a lack of training, lack of standards or a pure lack of leadership. That's why you have regs and checklists. If someone is running late it can mess up the whole team. Maybe schedule your crew fifteen minutes earlier to make sure things are done right. The manager gave us coupons for two apps, is that really a good standard. Besides taking care of our food for that day, he should have taken the time to get our names and take down our concern.  He invited us back but didn't give us his card. A little unpersonal if you ask me. Not a good lasting impression. 11/28/17 Went back today to give them a second chance. Huge mistake! I am not certain where the lack of training is coming from or even the pride of ownership of ones duties. But even after telling the server exactly how we wanted our meals, there was some type of breakdown either from the Manager who was in the kitchen actually cooking our burgers or the server who put in the ticket. They were not very busy so there should not have been any mistakes. My fiancé ordered a tavern burger with cheddar cheese and no sauce. Yet the burger came to us with American cheese and sauce all over the bottom bun. Her second burger can back with the bun soaked in grease, one patty that was charded to hell and back and a top bun that was all ripped up. Obviously they pitched the bottom bun and patty and did them over, scrapped the cheese off the top patty and just recheesed it. Then tried to heat the bun up on the flat top. What a fucking joke!! Plus the fries they sent out weren't even hot, and looked like ones left over from an earlier batch that had been sitting a while.  I got the Royal Red burger. The nice picture shows it with a sunny side up nice looking egg. What I got was a broken yolk chard flat egg with burn bottom and edges. Plus if a server asks you if you want some pink to the patty, you would expect some pink. Not the hockey puck that I got. I sent it back and still got a well done patty but the egg was sunny side up with a burnt bottom and edges. Which is a true indicator the cook did the egg in a hurry over high heat. I did not have the time or fortitude to wait a third time and told the server to just remove it. And I got my meal with a side salad instead of fries, but could only eat part of it because the lettuce was rusted and the green leaf was wilted. Two things you never want to see I. Your salad greens.  We got up from our table and asked to see the manager. We waited up front far too long and walked out. "Larry" the manager said he made our food but he was confused. Not what I would want to hear from a person who is supposed to be in charge. Told us to come back sometime for a burger on him. But not sure that's a risk I want to take again.

We went at 11:20 on a Saturday to beat the rush. Very disappointed in the service. The person who seated us took her sweet time (and it was not busy) and our server acted like he was being bothered. He was even sarcastic when I asked him a question about the menu. Food - good - not great. I can't imagine what it would be like in here when busy.

I don't even know how this place remains opens. The staff seemed more concerned with socializing with the cooks than serving the customers. We were seated at 835pm. Had to click ask for server on their touch screen at 845. At 850 she came and said sorry. Ordered and since we were starving, we asked if we could have our fries first. It's 905 and we still have not had any food delivered to our table especially the fries that we asked for first. When our food was finally brought to us, we were given no utensils, no napkins, no ketchup. Our waitress stated she would bring it right to us and we watched her go take another order to the bar, check on two other tables before she brought us anything.  There were only four other tables in the restaurant at the time we were there. Onto the food. Our fries were cold and the burgers were soggy from too much sauce. It wasn't the burgers I was used to eating at Red Robin years ago. I've never been so disappointed in a burger ever. This was worst than a Carl's Jr. burger.  Sure enough she never checked back in on us. We paid on the little kiosk they have at the table which takes away the whole food "service" aspect of working in a restaurant. I guess the up side of being able to pay at the table is we didn't have to flag down the waitress who didn't do anything other than bring our food to us. She did not deserve a tip and Red Robin did not deserve us as patrons. One star is more than what this place deserves. Last but not least, I checked my email receipt and was charged 1.99 for entertainment center which we did no use for any sort of entertainment other than paying. This place is a scam.

Solid 2.5 stars - went here for ma's b-day because she loves the bottomless fries, though overall nothing really stood out too much. At over $11 for a burger, even though they are 1/2 pound burgers, I expected a bit more. We got the chips and guac appetizer, which didn't really feature that many chips or that much salsa/guac, and it took a while to get more fries and pay, despite the digital menu device blinking. Overall, I feel like Red Robin has potential, but there would need to be an improvement in quantity of food and service that would make me more inclined to visit more often.

Burgers are usually pretty good. The rest of it, not impressed. Arrived around 11:15 to an empty restaurant and a 15 minute wait. Not a good start. Was starving, so ordered quickly, and added a salad so we could have something to munch on while we waited. That was a waste, as it showed up with the rest of our meal. Couldn't get our waiter's attention to save my life. Good luck getting bottomless fries. Asked for medium well burger, it was raw.  I understand s*#! happens, but this has been the experience I've had for at least the past few visits and I'm over it. Didn't bother mentioning anything to the manager because I did during my last visit and he was defensive, rude and dismissive. There are way too many restaurants around here to bother with this one, spend your money elsewhere.

Came here for lunch today. The service was stellar. Our waiter, I forgot his name, was very attentive and patient with us and always asked if we needed anything. My review is missing a star because the food quality has went down over the years. That and it was a little dirty inside. But other than that the food was still delicious and service was excellent. I would only return if I am in the area.

I'm giving this a 1 star review because I can't give it a no star review. The food was good as always, but the service was dreadful l. We had been sitting for 40 minutes and our waitress hadn't even introduced herself. They said they were busy but there was only 2 other full tables in our section. This is pretty much the worst service I've had. Waiters were on their phones, walking slowly and joking around with their employees. We were about two minutes away from walking out when we finally received our food. I like this restaurant, please get better employees though. I'm a big tipper normally but no part of this service warrants a tip.

To be honest it seems like this place is in need of more staff.  Because it was nearly impossible to get a refill on drinks. They provide you with these tablets for request Service and paying ect. But when you ask for service all it does is flash... like if they can't see me waving my damn hands how will they see the little red light. Other than the disappointing service the food was ok.  They got my order wrong,  also the fries where a bit cold. Not to happy with this location

I've been to a few Red Robin locations in the past. I'm going to have to say this again: "Red Robbiiiiinnnn....yuuuuum." S/O and I were looking for something to eat before we head into REI. Came around 2:30 and the place wasn't packed. We had to wait about 10 min to get seated. We waited another 10 minutes for someone to take our order.  Our waitress was really nice though, so that's a plus. S/O ordered the Burnin' Love Burger with onion rings. He finished his meal quick so it's safe to say that he likes it. I ordered the chicken burger with garlic fries. I liked the garlic fries more than my burger, so that says something. Each table has it's own mini tablet where you are able to order games and pay for your meal with a card. It's easy peasy to use if you will. Otherwise, bring enough cash + tip so you can walk out quick. Not a big fan of Red Robin but it sure fills you up quick.

For a self professed gourmet burger joint with unlimited fries, this visit failed on both counts.  The first two angus burgers ordered medium rare arrived well done with a very small number of cold fries on the side.  While we waited for a redo on the burgers another order of fries arrived cold and dry again.  Second burgers were better but closer to medium and edges were crispy singed.  The final fries attempt came very hot but the potato centers were not meaty and flaky but weirdly creamy.   Dessert guys?  No thanks!

Sorry I have to do this, Red Robin. I've been a pretty consistent fan of this restaurant for the last three years for its cheap prices and friendly staff. The food has always been okay; no complaints there. Not too long ago, the staff was very attentive and bottomless fries still existed! Now, good luck tracking down your server for napkins or a refill on those "bottomless" fries and root beer floats you paid for.  I appreciate the efforts our server made today to at least acknowledge our presence after 10 minutes of being seated, but the fact that it took him 20 minutes since we were seated to actually put in our order shows how understaffed this restaurant is. Our server was running around to so many other tables I couldn't even keep track. I don't blame him, but I do hope that this restaurant gets him some more help and other employees on the floor. Additional stars given for Daphne, Tiffany and Steven.
